story:
What's the story?

My name is Thanh and I was born and raised Vietnam. I spent half of my life in this beautiful country before embarking upon an international adventure in Canada, UK and Singapore. 
Blessed with inspirations from the best of friends that one could ask for, there is a thirst in me to live life extremely bold and incredibly loud. So in July 2015, I left the cushioned corporate life to embark upon a different journey. This October, I will be racing in the Atacama Crossing desert run, a 250km self-sustaining race in the world's driest desert to become the first Vietnamese female to complete such run. 

While this race will be the hardest and most challenging 7 days of my life thus far, I realize that there are many children in Vietnam who live in unthinkable and harsh conditions on a day to day basis. Thus, I want to dedicate this race for these brave children and fund raise to bring them a chance toward a better life with the necessary education. I will be racing to fund raise for Tu Sach Cau Vong (Rainbow Bookcase), http://www.tusachcauvong.com/, a grassroot organization which brings books, build schools and fund scholarships to ethnic minority in northern Vietnam. 


On another note, I want to take this opportunity to share the experience with the Millennials who are entering the critical stage of our lives. We are the most privileged generation. We make up the biggest portion of our population. We are going to inherit an enormous amount of wealth from the Baby Boomers, who had scarified so much to build the life we are enjoying now. We have the resources and we have time by our side. In fact, we have it easy. So, don't be afraid to follow that impossibly wild thought which your mind can't seem to get rid of. It will change your life and others' in the best way. Be strong and courageous.

Actions:

I'm inviting you to be part of this beautiful journey with me.
I originally set a target of USD 25,000 with the first USD 15,000 committed to Tu Sach Cau Vong to sponsor 5 students for secondary education, donate 4 bookcases and books for school libraries, and finish building a school and the rest to support the race cost. However, all the funding for the race cost was met by personal savings, closed friends and family at this point. So, the sole focus is Tu Sach Cau Vong. All the amount raised here will be donated to Tu Sach Cau Vong to procide more scholarships, build up libraries and shools in the remote areas in Northern Vietnam. 

The Impact

Although USD 15,000 is not a big amount, it is big milestone for the charity and this amount will actually reach various remote schools up in Dien Bien, Vietnam. Up in the mountains, villages area impoverished. Children not only have little access to education but also basic needs like food and proper shelter. Since Tu Sach Cau Vong is a grassroot organization, your contribution is not wasted on administration cost and the money directly helps the ethnic minority children. I have gone on a site visit and conducted due dilligence on sponsored students and I am very confident with the integrity of the charity.

I'm also hoping to document the experience to share this story with my peers, the young and capable Millennials, around the world and make it as fun as enjoyable as possible, despite the daunting 250km race. I will be making personalized and featured posts to pay tributes to those who contribute to make this project a reality (FB: https://www.facebook.com/tangy.vu

Instagram: tee_vu)

Risks & Challenges

I am setting the campaign expiry to 55 days (two weeks after the conclusion of the race) so please help to be part of the experience now and share this story. We will need to reach the target in 55 days.

As I have been traveling to the places that were home for me for the past 12 years, I will be sharing this story with all my friends and loved ones and friends, I hope that you can do the same as well. 

In regards to training, I'm following a rigorous training schedule while seeking advice from 4 Deserts veterans around the region in Singapore and Hong Kong. They have been very helpful in terms of sharing their experience, tips and pointers with me. I will be going to places with similar terrains to Atacama Crossing (Ladakh in Jammu & Kashmir, Sai Kung in Hong Kong, Sapa and Mui Ne) to familiarize myself with potential obstacles that high altitude, dry heat and sand dunes can cause. No doubt that the journey ahead is challenging but social media and I will make sure to keep you up to date. (Another great perk of being a Millennial, sharing is easy :)

And with that, thank you for being part of our story.

Thanh

campaign_city: Home is where the heart is, Vietnam

story:
Who are we? We are a young, international expression of daily existence, culture, and humanity based out of Austin, TX. Through global awareness, our community of contributors are actively working to break down the stereotypes of yesterday with the power of A Youth Mind. By means of photography, art, and storytelling, we will further the understanding of life around the world.

We believe in a world without alienation of outside cultures. The youth of today will have the opportunity to connect and learn with one another in a way that wasn’t possible before. Physical borders have created stereotypes which are a result of the general misconception about a given place and it’s people. A Youth Mind is the continuous effort to exemplify humanity and to defeat those common misconceptions that plague our world today. We want to see the world through the eyes of one another, not through the eyes of a company, a government or an organization. We are not a charity. We don’t see the youth in East Africa as helpless or as victims; rather, we are working with youth from around the world to share with one another their stories. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What is A Youth Mind: East Africa? A Youth Mind: East Africa is our first initiative of many to empower ourselves by empowering our project partners in East African countries. Our first partnership is with photographers in South Sudan. Participating youth will write their own narratives and document their daily lives with their own camera equipment, phone cameras and/or disposable single-use cameras provided by the Youth Mind team in the USA. This will inevitably place the power of their global image back into the hands of the youth, leaving it untouched by western media.

The initial plan is to loan our South Sudanese partners 250+ disposable single-use cameras. Working with our partnered NGO Lone Star Africa Works, we will provide students in South Sudan with the resources to capture the essence of their own lives. The youth will also be asked to write a narrative that corresponds to what makes life  enjoyable, exciting, interesting and even challenging to them. An optional piece of art will be accepted and integrated as well. Stories will be compiled on a website where hundreds of authors can contribute to one large collection. We’ll collect and develop all the photos here in Austin, and our local team will compile the pieces into a tangible collection available for purchase (All profits will be recycled back into the project!). There will also be a version accessible for free online to share globally. We will return printed images to the South Sudanese participants, along with ongoing participation opportunities through A Youth Mind.

Why South Sudan? A Youth Mind East Africa’s first partnership is with photographers in South Sudan, who have a unique story of everyday life in the world’s newest country. Working with these East African storytellers is Youth Mind’s collaborative partner Lone Star - Africa Works, a Texas nonprofit supporting community-run businesses in South Sudan. After this first exchange of photos and stories A Youth Mind looks forward to working with new partners in other East African countries.

Merchandise will be a way for us to expand our name, as well as give our supporters a way to show their commitment. Through stickers, t-shirts, calendars, and other marketing efforts, A Youth Mind will bring a clean and professional design element to the project. Since A Youth Mind: East Africa is about trade - exchanging stories, perspectives and cameras - all profits from the merchandise will be put directly back into our project fund.

The anticipated challenges of this project will include political, physical, and educational boundaries that we will have to take into consideration. Some of the many countries that we plan to encounter could have certain political stances that may disagree with our project. To counteract this occurrence, A Youth Mind is willing to partner with local organizations who will be able to safely and respectfully distribute our materials throughout a community. Physical damage to the cameras as they are being shipped or used is a possibility as well. Lost, broken, or otherwise faulty cameras/materials will be accounted for with our bulk orders. Lastly, educational roadblocks will most likely come from a lack of understanding for the purpose of our project. We will combat this by stressing the fact that we are not a charity. A Youth Mind is a united effort to both be the storyteller and the listener. We are not "western aid".

story:
Help GCE Rebuild The Schools


Pay-It-Forward

“A life lived for others, is the only life worth living.” Albert Einstein

Ten years ago in rural Nepal, a community built a school where there was no school. 

It was the pride of the community. 

Now, it is destroyed due to the devastating earthquakes in Nepal.

The genesis of The Devisthan Primary School grew from a trek made to Everest Base Camp by American Don Wilks in 2000,  where he met porter Tanka Kapri, a university student hauling bags to pay for his tuition. 

Don sponsored Tanka in last two and a half years of studies with an agreement that Tanka Pay-It-Forward

Tanka’s vision was to build a school in his village and with financial help from Don’s family and friends, the materials were purchased and the community built the school.

Little Devisthan Primary in turn formed the foundation of The Global Community for Education, a small, grassroots organization founded in 2005 that has now built and supported four schools in rural Nepal,  currently serving over 700 children. You can read the full story here: The Route Revision.



A simple question: Why does Global Community for Education exist?

GCE exists to educate children in a remote corner of Nepal, in agrarian communities often neglected by Nepalese government and the rest of the world. 


After the recent devastating earthquakes, we expect these communities will again be ignored or be relegated to the bottom of the list of aid priorities. The only cavalry  coming to help these communities is the one we send, and we need your help.

What it will take to rebuild:

We are seeking $7,000 to fund our Emergency Response.  GCE's Nepal Country Director hired a Jeep and made six relief runs to GCE’s communities with tarpaulins, medicines, food, plastic bags to store salvaged rice, and other necessary supplies.

We are also seeking $25,000 to rebuild the destroyed Devisthan Primary School, GCE’s first school project. We will be assessing the possibility of using non-traditional reused/recycled materials that will not only benefit the environment, but will be more resistant to earthquake damage. 

Total Requirements: $32,000

The goal of this project is simple: get the school rebuilt and get the children back in their classrooms.

The Impact

To date, GCE has educated and created hope in the lives of 1,378 Nepali children. 

Current enrollment: 822 children are presently enrolled in GCE schools. 

GCE Founder, Don Wilks covers all administrative costs.  95% of donations are applied to building schools and the remaining 5% are applied to capital improvements. Every dollar received is invested in the children and the schools. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our campaign on all your social feeds. 
  • Ask friends, neighbors, colleagues, and strangers to get involved by donating and sharing.
  • Pick 5 people from your friends list and ask them to share our campaign with 5 of their friends (keep the pay it forward momentum going)
  • Give up your coffee habit for 30 days - Donate the amount of your coffee to our campaign - challenge your friends, family and colleagues to do the same

story:
1. Who we are:

Martina: I am a book-worm, amazing cook, also food lover, great traveler and of course a female ;-)

Pavel: I am an IT guy, aMoto-biker,scout the travelerand tough male :-)

2. We have a big project!

And together we share a big project, rather a dream! Our popular culture reinforces the idea that travel is difficult and expensive. But we know that if you put your mind to something you can make it happen. So we have raised the money and are ready to go but we want to further our purpose as we travel 4 continents and 25 countries. This project we call „Our trip around the World“.

3. And we also have a super idea – to help!

Young people think outside the box, push boundaries and experiment with the new. We want to be part of this change and show people that adventure is waiting for them and they can live to travel AND help people in need. This is where we started to envision Our Trip Around the World and all the possible benefits we could bring to people.

There are millions of children and people in need all around the world. Everyday something bad happens to the new ones and there is not always help for them. Of course there are many humanitarian organizations like UNICEF, Human in need, Amnesty International or Doctors without borders but these organizations cannot be everywhere and unfortunately are not able to help everyone who needs and calls for it. There is no one in this world to redeem them all, not even us. But, we can at least try to help some of these people during our round the world trip.

4. Whom we are going to help and how!

We mainly want to focus on small children or families living in poverty and finding their shelters in orphanages. Why we chose them? These people need help and normally do not get a chance to receive anything from humanitarian organizations.

5. How we want to donate

First of all we want to point out on people’s situation by going to these shelters and write their stories. We believe that writing about them will force people think more about this problematic.

All the money we gain thanks to this crowdfunding campaign will be donated as follows:

1/3 of the collected money will be sent directly to UNICEF after the campaign ends. The proof of this act will be shown on our website www.ourtriparoundtheworld.com with a confirmation from our bank account statement.

The rest of the collected money will be then used during our travels.  We decided not to give them money because there is a suspect that they might never get them. It is not we wouldn’t really trust to orphanages or local organizations trying to help these people. But we do not know these organizations therefore we would rather provide them with material help such as blankets, pencils, notepads, food or anything they say might be of help for them. Our idea is to get to the place, talk to a representative, ask what they need, go and get it for them.

Each gift will be described and mentioned in our posts!

6. How you can help

For us to bring our trip to life, we need your support!

Your generous funding will help us get things started in order to realize our initiatives. It will assist us with the cost of further planning and creation. More importantly you get the chance to SAVE A CHILDS, THEIR FAMILY or HUMAN’s LIFE! 

Everyone needs pledging but above all people need your attention and interest! If you fancy and like our idea as much as we do, then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook or YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!

Help us establish a program to serve people in need. Finding out our passions for change through travel with ease will be life changing. Empower us to make this vision a reality with a donation to this project today! Every little helps. As little as $5 gets us on our way and can change children’s and humans life.  

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to watch this video and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference. Please know your efforts, even the smallest. Don’t go unnoticed! We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve. You are a part of our family. Help us make people out there happier. 

If there is a reason for you not to support or donate this campaign we will be happy if you at least share it with others. We are already travelling and are not able to spread the word and take care of the campaign that much.

story:
Standing at the grocery store staring at the wilted bag of spinach wondering if this stuff is really good for me...That's where I was when I thought: "There has to be a better way." I didn't know much about 'Organic', 'All Natural', 'Gluten Free' products, but my instincts told me something wasn't right. I remember when produce stands would pop up in early spring and summer. I remember the crispness and juiciness of a fresh apple. What I was about to buy at this big box store that had sat on the shelf for who knows how long, was not truly Organic or All Natural, nothing that stays fresh for that long ever really is. Then I heard about the FarmGirls and my whole perspective changed. 

The FarmGirls are a mother and daughter team, Marilyn and Donelle Simmons. They dedicate their time, energy, and often times, sanity to spread Organic garden education to the masses in the Dallas/Fort Worth area. Their local Radio Show on KAAM 770 AM on Fridays at 1 p.m. CST is a big part of their free education to teach others how to live a Monsanto-Free life. 

They have been instrumental in my education as to the levels of toxicity in the food I'm consuming from the store. They have opened up a whole new world to where I grow my own food, reach out to local farms for poultry, and get involved in my community to further demonstrate self-sustainability without the use of harmful chemicals. They have helped me teach my children what a real tomato tastes like off the vine, the miracle of soil life in an active compost, things most of their friends have never had the chance to experience.

The FarmGirls Radio show needs help staying on the air. The extreme wet weather, medical issues, and general life hiccups have put a huge dent in their Garden Coaching and Landscaping business that would usually cover this expense. I want them to stay on the air. I send people to their show each week, it is the perfect platform to help misinformed consumers to see there is a another way to live and eat today. We need them to be able to continue supporting local farms, gardeners, and other educational groups to help spread the word about Monsanto Free options to eat and live in our world today.

Without people like the FarmGirls so many people like myself will go without ever knowing there is a better way. Learn more about these wonderful ladies or you may donate directly on their site: http://www.farmgirlstx.com/about-us/
story_txt: Standing at the grocery store staring at the wilted bag of spinach wondering if this stuff is really good for me...That's where I was when I thought: "There has to be a better way." I didn't know much about 'Organic', 'All Natural', 'Gluten Free' products, but my instincts told me something wasn't right. I remember when produce stands would pop up in early spring and summer. I remember the crispness and juiciness of a fresh apple. What I was about to buy at this big box store that had sat on the shelf for who knows how long, was not truly Organic or All Natural, nothing that stays fresh for that long ever really is. Then I heard about the FarmGirls and my whole perspective changed. The FarmGirls are a mother and daughter team, Marilyn and Donelle Simmons. They dedicate their time, energy, and often times, sanity to spread Organic garden education to the masses in the Dallas/Fort Worth area. Their local Radio Show on KAAM 770 AM on Fridays at 1 p.m. CST is a big part of their free education to teach others how to live a Monsanto-Free life. They have been instrumental in my education as to the levels of toxicity in the food I'm consuming from the store. They have opened up a whole new world to where I grow my own food, reach out to local farms for poultry, and get involved in my community to further demonstrate self-sustainability without the use of harmful chemicals. They have helped me teach my children what a real tomato tastes like off the vine, the miracle of soil life in an active compost, things most of their friends have never had the chance to experience.The FarmGirls Radio show needs help staying on the air. The extreme wet weather, medical issues, and general life hiccups have put a huge dent in their Garden Coaching and Landscaping business that would usually cover this expense. I want them to stay on the air. I send people to their show each week, it is the perfect platform to help misinformed consumers to see there is a another way to live and eat today. We need them to be able to continue supporting local farms, gardeners, and other educational groups to help spread the word about Monsanto Free options to eat and live in our world today.Without people like the FarmGirls so many people like myself will go without ever knowing there is a better way. Learn more about these wonderful ladies or you may donate directly on their site: http://www.farmgirlstx.com/about-us/

story:
I am Johan Heinrich Vuurman Büxmann from South Africa and grew up in the Western Cape region. As a child I helped my father with woodwork which supplemented household income at the time. Today I work in another country, as an Air Traffic Control Officer in the United Arab Emirates. I am married to Manilyn, who is from the Philippines, We have 2 children, Chantelle and John.
The situation is not conducive for me to continue this toy making hobby but my father Abe (Abraham Johannes Smuts Büxmann, worked in the South African Air Force until around 1999) still makes toys as a hobby .
How did we start with toys...
My grandfather, also Johan Heinrich Vuurman Büxmann ( a farmer all his life) passed away in 1995 and my father  inherited some wooden toy samples and designs. 
As a hobby, my father and I continued making wooden toys and offered them for sale for supplementing household income. Since starting many different variants and new products joined the list of available toys however toys were not made to order, rather made depending on available resources.
It has been a long time an idea to start a small factory and fill orders while selling at a factory store and online.
I have children now and would like them to enjoy these toys that my brother and I had. Also getting more children to play, play, play... Hours of fun and expanding the imagination. No charging, no batteries or software upgrades.
Technology is great but I still feel that playing with toys is good, Stacking blocks, flying through the sky, taking a train ride, loading dirt or showcasing a long haul truck.  

What We Need & What You Get

We require a boost in funds to expand an existing family hobby into a thriving business. 
  • Business registration
  • A suitable premises or upgrade of current shop
  • Legal fees
  • Existing machinery will be supplemented or upgraded
  • Marketing
  • Branding
  • Employment and skills development of staff (about 4 in the medium term)
  • Continued Research and Development to include more toys for girls
  • SGS accreditation (Complaiance with EN71 and US toy safety standards)
  • Product improvement and expansion to include girls
  • Long term planning is large order export
When claiming a perk for yourself or donating it, still the toys will be made and people will be employed. The value of the perk is greater than when purchasing the toys direct because this is a fundraiser. Even if the total goal in raising funds is not achieved, children will benefit also the employees that would be helping making the toys for that time.  
Please look at the sample photo's. More will be added as and when they are completed.
The discount vouchers you can claim from the perk is issued and you can give it to a loved one or friend living in South Africa who can then make use of it.
International shipping of wooden products require various requirements depending on the destination, at this stage international shipping is unfortunately not available but will be after required product adaptation.
We endeavour to get SGS accreditation ( South Africa) and compliance with European and North American Toy Safety/Standards

The Impact

Children needs toys but financial circumstances does not always make that possible. You can help. By playing and interacting children learn while developing social skills, hand-eye coordination and IMAGINATION! 

The idea is to make toys and let children play, this cannot be achieved without funding. 

Whether someone is buying a toy for their child or funding a toy give-away. If we can establish a business that is funded to produce toys and in turn give our products away - that would be amazing. Investing in our future not only as a business but also in communities around us because without support we will not prosper.

The toys are well build and save to play with. Many have been sold at small markets, nurseries and out-of-hand. Special branding on the bigger trucks were also done on a case by case basis.

Risks & Challenges

The toys do not sell themselves, but cost or ability to buy it might be a hurdle. With funding a larger operation will reduce cost and make the toys affordable to a larger segment of people.

Employment challenges in South Africa can be overcome with constant work and better benefits to employees. We strive to become an employer of choice and set a benchmark for others to follow. Being involved in the low income labour market and dealing with labour related issues makes overcoming and dealing with them easier when a business is also focused on Social Responsibility. According to 'Business for Social Responsibility', corporate social responsibility means that a company is committed to “achieve commercial success in ways that honour ethical values and respect people, communities and the natural environment.”

Product preparation for international shipping is a medium term goal.

Possible workshop/factory established in the Philippines are being looked at, already we have private property and setting up a business would also benefit the community while presenting its own challenges. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign that will benefit children.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

While establishing the business we can make a difference...

story:
Rise & Shine er morgenfest på en helt almindelig onsdag i København.

I kan godt sætte vækkeuret og kridte danseskoene, for vores fjerde og sidste morgenfest bliver onsdag 12. august fra 7-10. Denne gang skal vi have god plads, så vi rykker festen udendørs i Fælledparken. Vi sørger for seje DJs, morgenkaffe og lir. I dukker op og ryster, hvad jeres mor har givet jer!

Festen er gratis, og alle arbejder frivilligt – men vi har brug for jeres hjælp til at betale for et kick-ass lydanlæg, der kan spille hele plænen op. 

Alle bidrag modtages med LOOOVE og evig taknemmelighed <3

Tid: Onsdag 12. august fra kl 7:00-10:00
Sted: Fælledparken, plænen ved talerstenen
Gratis entré
DJ's: Djuna Barnes og Katrine Ring
Vores partnere fra Kalles Kaffe m.fl. sælger morgenmad og kaffe, så I har energi til at danse.

Vi er Renegade Runners. Renegade Runners er et netværk, som laver events, kunst og happenings. Vi er en lille kerne og en masse venner. 

Dette er den fjerde og sidste morgenfest, som Renegade Runners arrangerer, så gå ikke glip af den!

Har du ikke været til en Rise & Shine-morgenfest endnu? Er du skeptisk? Vi lover, at det er sjovt! Tjek det selv her:

Rise & Shine #3
https://www.facebook.com/events/980277441991827/

DR.DK
http://www.dr.dk/Nyheder/Indland/Video/2015/02/04/100623.htm

iBYEN
http://goo.gl/cvgj3e

Eurowoman
http://www.eurowoman.dk/har-du-hort/kultur/morgenfest-i-kobenhavn-vi-dansede--og-tog-sa-pa-arbejde/

Smut forbi på vej til arbejde, eller kom dryssende, når du vågner. Bliv 20 minutter eller tre timer. Dans til du sveder, eller se på med en espresso. Tag en ven under armen, eller kom alene – bare du fester dagen i gang på en ny måde sammen med os!

story:
Short Summary

Every $1 counts.. make a small contribution and feel like you have done something great today

I am Daniel Travolto. I am long time friend of Togbe in Ghana. He is an absolutely amazing person. He runs a fitness studio, makes music & helps disabled children and also kids to stay in shape. Whats amazing about him is he brings so much positiveness to the kids and while there a lot of scammers in Africa this dude is the real deal. (i will include tons of photos here so you can see what i mean) He is planning a birthday and inviting so many kids in need on the 28th of July. He organizes events to feed children and educate them. So please help us make this a reality. We need $500 in total for the event but i said hey this is the internet.. lets do it big. lets get the 500 for the event and then some more to get other events going... 

So this money is really going directly toward:
* Feeding Children (orphaned, disabled and more ghana children)
* encouraging for them to go to school
* getting supplies for school
* encouraging them for fitness
* encouraging positive attitude

Even his music is so positive. Nowadays every musician is Rated for mature audiences only and talks about crap... he is exactly the opposite like when he recorded his "go to school song" etc.

I will keep none of it.. everything will go to his causes and i will make sure you see everything that happens with your money there :-)
you can follow us:
http://www.facebook.com/danieltravolto
https://www.facebook.com/TogbeofGhana

If you like to donate with bitcoin use this address:
1uVQ9DLMt7jix27MrCUTQjSw93GdQL6qV

story:
Keep the Smile on those Children

We are facing the potential break down of a 20 year old Non-Governmental Organisation that is responsible for kids in great need. They help in great many ways which you can see yourself in this link:

http://www.hamogelo.gr/36.2/What-we-do 

I have known this organisation for my whole life and as soon as I heard the news that the Financial Crisis and especially the very recent Capital Controls made companies and individuals from within Greece to completely stop funding this cause which could cause its demise in very little time brought tears to my eyes... 
You can see all the facts yourself in the link below:
http://www.hamogelo.gr/24-2/2524/Thousands-of-children-are-at-risk-in-crisis-hit-Greece

People that live in Greece

Due to the Capital Controls Greek people that live in Greece and only have Greek accounts cannot contribute to this campaign because we cannot sent money abroad (Hence to IndieGoGo...). However we are doing everything that is in our power to bring awareness of this problem both within Greece and abroad so that people do not forget that even in events of financial crisis there are people that desperately need our help. We have also included in our gallery the video of the campaign that was originally launched from the organisation which we are trying to help. Everyone can contribute directly there and especially Greek people that cannot do so in this campaign! 
So since it is very hard for Greek people to fund this organisation alone we have launched this campaign to ask for help globally. So please when you come accross this campaign and you cannot contribute at least share the campaign so that it reaches people that can!!! This act is as important as giving money yourself!!! 

We live during a Big Humanitarian Crisis 

The reality is that the Organisation needs a lot more money than the $ 1,000,000 we are trying to gather here because the amount of people it helps and the amount of activities in which it is involved are too many. We are just trying to gather this amount in order to give the organisation enough time to restructure itself and the activities in which it is involved. The Capital Controls (closing of banks) was very sudden and gave no time for planning. We just want to provide this time which probably means that they will have to start rejecting people in need and letting social workers go but at least it will not close down completely. 
  • So to sum up we need the money in order to give enough time to the organisation to restructure itself. I believe this would buy as 1 month.
  • If we don't reach our goal the money will still go to the organisation in full and help in areas in which they are needed the most. 
It is important to understand that this financial crisis is not only financial anymore. The whole of Europe experiences a humanitarian crisis also at the same time which in my opinion is what is more important. 


The Impact

Contributing to this cause will be a small (or big ;-)) stepping stone towards achieving our goal to keep this Organisation giving help to 1000s of helpless children. 

Please visit this link and see yourself what we are talking about because if I start writing all these points out a lot of people will start leaving the page without even reading. So please if you are really interested follow this link:

http://www.hamogelo.gr/24-2/2524/Thousands-of-children-are-at-risk-in-crisis-hit-Greece

In my opinion after seeing this and becoming aware you cannot leave without even a small contribution. It is certain that one person cannot change everything or help everyone in need but we can all play our small part in each/some cause.

I find this uplifting (with a little ''happy'' anxiety) and very fulfilling and I would recommend it to all of you!!! 

The Perks

We did not have enough time to study availability and transport costs of the perks we are offering as the organisation is about to fall apart. All the perks can be found in the e-shop section of the organisation's official website below also and in much lower prices:

http://www.hamogelo-eshop.gr/shop/products

However in a cause like this we are trying to raise some money out of the good will of some people. Essentially we are not selling products. We are not trying to make any profit for ourselves. It is all for the cause this organisation is serving. The money you give will go directly from IndieGoGo to their bank account. We are just the people whose job was to make a platform to raise money for this organisation. We are just showing them a new way they are probably unaware of!

Risks & Challenges

Well there are no real risks in this campaign or challenges. All the money go straight to the people that built a wonderful organisation from scratch and have a 20 year experience in this. It is just sad to think that they have to fight so hard for such a wonderful cause... 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute but you like our cause and you want to help in some way as I said before everyone can help in such causes by taking a small part of this compaign on themselves. 

  • Just get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share it everywhere using Indiegogo share tools or any other tools you like!

story:
The First Urban Festival In The Middle East

The Middle East and North Africa (MENA) is bursting with creative minds. The region is rife with spirit, music and innovation, but the picture being painted of the Middle East often shows us the opposite. The Word is Yours Festival is here to challenge that image and to celebrate the people and creative culture that is thriving there. But a good festival needs people. People like you. Every amount donated will go directly to sustaining the creative arts scene in the MENA and nurturing a network of creative and innovative minds. 

It takes a lot to put on a festival of this caliber – and we need your help to make The Word Is Yours Festival a reality. By being a founding contributor, your help will give urban youth culture in the Middle East a push forward. 

This festival doesn't just bring in renowned and upcoming artists from all over the region to meet, create, perform, skate, and build - it aims to invest in culture long-term, and in sustained creative industries in Jordan and The Middle East.

Each amount of money donated – no matter the size – funds the creation of a platform that will return dividends for years to come.  Stand with us and invest in culture; invest in a progressing community. 


Who We Are & Our Vision 

We are four young women who for the past 11 months have been working pro-bono to arrange the first interregional urban festival in Amman, and our vision is now transforming into a reality. Our production companies MEKTOUB and MALAHI have joined forces and have over 10 years of experience with producing cultural events as well as non-profit initiatives across Jordan and the region. 

Together, we will be flying in artists from MENA from disciplines of rap, dj'ing, dancing, spoken word, production, street art and skateboarding as well as establishing a network of creatives, where panel discussions and artist talks will take place between artists from the MENA region and industry representatives to discuss challenges and raise ideas on how to foster a creative industry in Jordan and throughout the region. 

We believe that culture is a vital tool for the socio-economic development of Jordan, which is a knowledge-based society. Due to the Syrian crisis, more jobs will need to be created in alternative sectors and this festival will also serve as a meeting place for refugees and local Jordanians, contributing to social cohesion issues between host-community and refugee groups. 

Through music, art, conversations and workshops - we aim to bring all these groups together, to show that the word is ours - and does not belong to agents who portray a negative image of youth in MENA. 


  • The Word Is Yours (TWIY) have already teamed up with a number of media partners, local creative spaces in Al Weibdeh (Amman) as well as 7Hills Skatepark - the first community skatepark in Jordan (funded on Indiegogo). 
  • TWIY is a FREE and non-profit festival for ALL! 
  • Line-up includes artists from 10 countries and 9 artistic disciplines. 
TWIY respects freedom of artistic expression, human and gender rights and will include female performers and participants in order to break down stereotypes and build empowerment amongst youth.

What We Need & What You Get

With your help of a donation of any amount – we can guarantee that your contribution goes directly to the production of The Word Is Yours as well as compensation and/or transportation of artists, materials for workshops and transporting marginalized youth to the festival.  With your donation, The Word is Yours will be able to:

·  Initiate the first ever interregional festival in Jordan

· Create a platform and network for artists to collaborate and further the creative industry in Amman and cities all over the MENA

·  Provide an experience for youth (including those in refugee camps) 

· Substantiate the loaner equipment program for 7Hills Skatepark

·  Support the long lasting decoration of walls and murals throughout the city by international and regional noted graffiti artists

· Highlight the opportunities for creative youth in Amman within their own city

· Stimulate the local economy in Amman by featuring local businesses and increasing tourism demands. 

Putting on a festival is no easy feat and all of these benefits come at a cost. In addition to the regular production cost of festivals – audio and visual, lighting, security, stage rental, artist fees, etc. – the scope of The Word Is Yours presents extra expenses. For instance, we will be bussing in youth from the nearby refugee camps as they are seldom provided the opportunity to leave the camps and this festival is created with them in mind. As an extremely marginalized group, refugee youth are not often awarded the feeling of belonging nor empowerment. The Word Is Yours will provide that, but we have to cover the costs of transportation to the festival.

The Word Is Yours involves creating a community of creatives throughout the entire MENA region. We have artists coming from Jordan, Palestine, Syria, Lebanon, Libya, UAE, Tunisia and Saudi Arabia. It is important for artists to meet each other and collaborate in person. It is necessary for the region to have solidarity. It is also an added expense to fly in these artists from their respective bases. 

What your donations will help fund:

  • The target of 10.000 USD will cover a part of all the expenses that are involved with producing a large-scale festival such as materials for: workshops (paint, brushes, teachers for youth), transportation of youth, transport for artists, establishing a creative hub hosting artists and creatives, AU/AV stages, projection of films, local permits and taxes and a small remuneration fee for artists. 
  • You'll be a founding backer of the first interregional festival in The Middle East focusing on urban culture!
  • This festival is all about co-creation, and we are open to your ideas, and your word. Word up. 

Impact & Reach

Over half of Jordan’s population is under the age of 25. This number is quickly increasing from an influx of refugees. The youth demographic in this region is integral for the future development of the sense of community as well as the economic direction.  These young minds are an untapped source for lifting the cultural threads of the region and stimulating the dialogue around the future of the MENA. Not only will The Word Is Yours provide a weekend of creative expression woven through multiple disciplines of urban life, but it will show how fruitful the creative arts is for the community and – more importantly – that creativity is a skill that can become a livelihood. 


What We Will Do

  • TWIY will reach an estimated 1500 youth in Amman and 150 refugee youth
  • Workshops and master-classes will be held in 5 locations across Amman
  • Activities will not end with festival, a regional network will be set up
  • Classes such as production and DJ'ing will help qualify youth to work and make money regardless of social or economic background
In Jordan’s capital city of Amman, The Word Is Yours will be hosted by 7Hills Skatepark, the first outdoor community skate park in Jordan. Located in downtown Amman, the skate park is easily accessible for all – including some of the poorest neighborhoods in the city.

Due to Jordan’s central placement in the Middle East – it has an important role to play in culture and politics of the whole region. Amman is considered one of the “safe havens” for refugees in the Middle East leading to an influx of Syrians, Palestinians and Iraqis seeking safety within the borders of the city. Many of these refugees are confined to camps and are rarely offered the opportunity to leave – with children being some of the most strongly affected. Staying true to 7Hill’s philosophy of providing all children with an opportunity to experience skate culture, The Word Is Yours will be bussing in children and youth from nearby refugee camps to simply allow them to be young for a day.

The Festival & Activities 

Day 1 – What’s Your Word?

Kicking off at 7Hills Skatepark the premiere day of the festival includes:

• A skateboard deck painting workshop conducted by noted arabesque and calligraffiti artists in partnership with AptART – these decks will then become part of the 7Hills loaner equipment program.

• An impressive roster of regional DJ’s, rappers, and beatboxers will be showcasing their great works, beats, and rhymes throughout the day’s festivities.

• There will be competitions for skateboarders and dancers with a judging panel of international professionals.  Followed by the judges showing their own bag of tricks.

• Finally, there will be an ‘Open Mic’ to invite the audience, MC’s, poets, and spoken word artists to demonstrate their lyrical skills; finishing with the reminder to all that the word, ultimately, is theirs.

Day 2  - For Artists, By Artists

At Al Locanda Boutique hotel,  it is time for the artists to work on their craft rather than perform it.

• Workshops will be held to provide an opportunity for any festival goers from day one to take the first steps in getting involved with any of the creative skills they witnessed the day before.  

• Artists’ Talks will open avenues for discourse about four general topics: (1)strengthening cross- collaboration and boosting creative industry, (2)legal rights and obligations for artists, (3)Arab sample culture, and (4)the current state of Hip Hop in the MENA region.  Each talk will be moderated by an invited, respected moderator in their field.

• A live-streamed, mind-blowing DJ set culminating the festivals artists and events we will conclude the The Word Is Yours with an after party  on Al Locanda’s panoramic rooftop. Going out with a bang, a view, and a rooftop full of smiles.

The Word is also Yours! 

We thank you kindly for supporting our cause and for helping us to make it a reality. Every tiny donation helps. We greatly believe in this festival and we greatly believe that with the power of creativity and the support of creative outlets – The Word is Yours will be the first step towards investing in youth and culture, and together we can make the word ours for years to come. 

Salamat, 
TWIY-team
story_txt:
The First Urban Festival In The Middle East


The Middle East and North Africa (MENA) is bursting with
creative minds. The region is rife with spirit, music and innovation, but the picture being painted
of the Middle East often shows us the opposite. The Word is Yours
Festival is here to challenge that image and to celebrate the people and
creative culture that is thriving there. But a good festival needs people. People
like you. Every amount donated will go directly to sustaining the creative arts
scene in the MENA and nurturing a network of creative and innovative minds. 
It takes a lot to put on a
festival of this caliber – and we need your help to make The Word Is Yours Festival a reality. By being a founding contributor, your help will give urban youth culture in the Middle East a push forward. 

This festival doesn't just bring in renowned and upcoming artists from all over the region to meet, create, perform, skate, and build - it aims
to invest in culture long-term, and in sustained creative industries in Jordan and The Middle East.Each amount
of money donated – no matter the size – funds the creation of a platform that
will return dividends for years to come. 
Stand with us and invest in culture; invest in a progressing community. 



Who We Are & Our Vision 

We are four young women who for the past 11 months have been working pro-bono to arrange the first interregional urban festival in Amman, and our vision is now transforming into a reality. Our production companies MEKTOUB and MALAHI have joined forces and have over 10 years of experience with producing cultural events as well as non-profit initiatives across Jordan and the region. 
Together, we will be flying in artists from MENA from disciplines of rap, dj'ing, dancing, spoken word, production, street art and skateboarding as well as establishing a network of creatives, where panel discussions and artist talks will take place between artists from the MENA region and industry representatives to discuss challenges and raise ideas on how to foster a creative industry in Jordan and throughout the region. 
We believe that culture is a vital tool for the socio-economic development of Jordan, which is a knowledge-based society. story:
We organize Movies In The Park because we love these events and witnessing the growth of the community.

Inspired by an outdoor, movie series in New York City, our founder Nicole decided to start Movies in the Park.
As a member of a not-for-profit fundraising board, we see Movies In The Park as an excellent opportunity for non-profits to increase their exposure and to offer the families they serve a fun and free night out.

Riverdale Park East is, has been the City of Toronto's best outdoor screening venue for the past four years. The sun sets behind the nearly 8 meter (25 foot) high movie screen, the city skyline twinkles in the distance and the audience gathers on the gently sloping hill. It's magical.

If we do not raise the needed funds we will have to cancel the movies this year. Thanks for taking the time to help!

Our Story

Night falls, people gather, Toronto's skyline lights up and our giant movie screen entertains. 

Summer 2015 celebrates our fifth summer hosting free movies under the stars in Riverdale Park East in downtown Toronto. Our first event was created to spend a night with friends in our local park with a great film. Our small idea has turned into five summers of great films, great times and fundraising efforts for local kids organizations. 

The Movies In The Park mission is to offer amazing, zero-cost nights out in the city. Friends, families, dates, groups and nice dogs are always welcome. We encourage picnics, making new friends and singing along with soundtracks. Come get outside in this beautiful park and enjoy free movies under the stars!

 Movies In The Park also functions as a local childrens' chairty fundraiser and awareness campaign. We use our big screen to share information about our great partners. This year, we are supporting The Toronto Kiwanis Boys and Girls Club http://www.believeinkids.ca/ and Art City Toronto http://artcitytoronto.ca/

Both of these organizations support local kids in their endeavors to succeed through education, creativity, security and community. The success of this campaign will determine the funds we donate to these organizations. 

We also use our big screen as an opportunity for YOU to spread the word about your business and/or campaign. Check out some of our perks and see how you can get involved. 

We are using IndieGoGo to raise funds to pay the hard costs of these events. Costs include the City of Toronto event permits, movie screen rental, licensing and screen and sound set-up. 

The Impact

Five summers in we are seeing the fruits of our tenacity. Movies In The Park is growing and hosting over a thousand people at each event. We are very proud and committed to keeping these movie nights alive. 

Without the required funds we will have to cancel our events this summer and disappoint our Movies In The Park community. We would also lose a valuable opportunity to spread the word about the great work happening with our charity partners.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our cost for one event evening is $2500.00. 

This covers the City of Toronto permit, screen rental and delivery, technicians, the film license, and the event insurance. 

The money raised here will go directly to paying the bills. All funds raised above our hard costs will go directly to our charity partners. There is no Movies In The Park middle-(wo)man. 

We need you and your friends and their friends and their networks to support us so we can keep these events going.

Other Ways You Can Help

Support our cause by helping us get the fundraising word out!

Come to our events! 

Follow us on Twitter/Instagram - @moviesriverdale

Like us on Facebook - www.facebook.com/pages/Movies-In-The-Park/20266

Visit our Blog - https://moviesinthepark.wordpress.com

story:
Albert Gozlan, Maestro de Kabbalah, en su voluntad de difundir los Secretos del Cielo y acercar los conocimientos de Kabbalah y meditación kabbalística a todo el mundo para mejorar sus vidas propone organizar varias conferencias al año en distintas ciudades, por lo que apela a posibles patrocinadores o sponsors para apoyar la organización de dichos eventos.


Video de la última conferencia que tuvo lugar en Miami (Junio 2015)

Difusión gratis de Secretos de Torah


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

  • Necesitamos recaudar 17.000 Euros para organizar una conferencia (aforo 500 personas). Esta cantidad servirá para cubrir los gastos de alquiler de sala con equipo de sonido y video, los gastos de hotel y estancia, así como los billetes de avión y desplazamiento de nuestro equipo. 

    La recaudación que se obtendrá mediante las inscripciones a la conferencia (con precios muy asequibles) y ventas de libros, serán ingresos netos para nuestra asociación sin ánimo de lucro (Asociación Yehiel), que a su vez servirá para promocionar más difusión de Secretos del Cielo vía internet y en otros países.

  • El Sponsor beneficiará de la repercusión mediática de la conferencia que está patrocinando, con su logo y nombre presente in situ en la conferencia. El Sponsor nos entregará todo el material publicitario para colocar en el evento, así como una nota de prensa y fotografías, para adjuntar a nuestros canales de difusión y promoción previos al evento. Cada conferencia se realiza con un auditorio mínimo de 500 personas, y se difunde posteriormente de manera gratis por varios canales de televisión de Estados Unidos y Sud América, por nuestro canal de Youtube que tiene más de 7.000.000 de minutos de visualizaciones mensuales, y casi 500.000 reproducciones mensuales con una progresión del 25% cada mes!!! Un verdadero fenómeno reflejo de la necesidad de la gente de buscar respuestas y soluciones a los problemas de su vida para alcanzar la verdadera felicidad.
  • En caso de no lograr la recaudación completa de estos fondos, la cantidad recaudada se destinará a la Asociación Yehiel para la difusión gratuita y traducción a varios idiomas de los videos de enseñanza de nuestra escuela.

El impacto

Cada conferencia que hacemos aumenta considerablemente el alcance de la difusión de esta enseñanza y ayuda a más gente a cambiar sus vidas para mejor. 


Los testimonios nos avalan

Los testimonios de las personas que han estudiado ya los conocimientos que difundimos y han practicado las meditaciones kabbalísticas son maravillosos y se pueden consultar en nuestro canal de Youtube o en nuestra web:

VER TESTIMONIOS

Más información y cursos gratis en:

www.kabbalahmashiah.com

YouTube Kabbalah Mashiah

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si no puedes colaborar económicamente, eso no significa que no puedas ayudar:

  • te pedimos que difundas este mensaje a tus familiares y amigos, y que compartas nuestros videos de YouTube
  • puedes hablar de ellos, publicarlos en tu Facebook, Twitter, Google + etc..
  • danos un Like/ Me gusta en Facebook Kabbalah Mashiah

Gracias por tu ayuda

story:
Donate by October 8th to launch the new Robbin Mackbee Firefighter Youth Academy in Vallejo


In 1991, a group of Richmond firefighters noticed a disturbing trend of violence in their community. As firefighters in urban environments, they responded to increasing numbers of medical emergencies that resulted from acts of violence. Far too often, it was young African-American males who were both the perpetrators and the victims of violence, suffering serious injury and death.

As first responders, firefighters had a chance to build on the community’s trust and to prevent future violence. The idea of the Firefighter Youth Academy was born. The academy’s purpose is simple: to share the firefighting career and provide professional guidance and life skills to any young teenagers at risk of social, economic, or academic failure. The first Firefighter Youth Academy was founded in Richmond, California over 20 years ago, and has helped to change the lives of the youth cadets it has mentored.

Today, retired Battalion Chief Byron Berhel of the Richmond Fire Department, one of the founders of the Richmond academy, is on a mission to bring this successful youth mentoring program to new communities, starting with Vallejo. Berhel is the founder and CEO of a non-profit called Solutions for At Risk Youth (SFARY) that is partnering with the Vallejo Fire Department and Vallejo Unified School District to bring the Firefighter Youth Academy to this new community.

The new Robbin Mackbee Firefighter Youth Academy in Vallejo is named in honor of a fallen Vallejo Fire Department hero. Robbin lost his life 35 years ago in the line of duty while fighting a grass fire. Known as “Robbie” to friends and family, he was the youngest ever engineer in the Vallejo Fire Department and was also a positive community role model who spent time tutoring and mentoring youth at the local Omega Boys and Girls Club in Vallejo.

Starting October 3rd, the academy will launch a six-week program that will provide youth with mentorship from local firefighters, teaching them the importance of academic achievement, community service, and self-discipline.

With your donation, you can honor Robbie’s memory by helping to support the new Robbin Mackbee Firefighter Youth Academy in Vallejo, giving local high school students the opportunity to participate in the academy.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to build our academy in Vallejo. Each Saturday morning for six weeks, the youth “cadets” will meet to learn new skills from firefighters. The academy will provide food, uniforms, and other training materials to the cadets. Your donation will help to cover these costs for our young cadets.

To thank you for your support, we have created some unique giveaways:

  • A shout-out on social media thanking our donors
  • “Our Hero” wrist bands
  • Firefighter Youth Academy t-shirts
  • An AAA first aid kit
  • A tour of the new academy

Our Impact: Mentoring Youth and Changing Lives

The Firefighter Youth Academy model has already been successful in Richmond on many levels. A majority of cadets continued their education beyond high school and several graduates of the program went on to become successful, professional firefighters. Rico Rincon, a current Captain in the Richmond Fire Department, started out as a cadet in the Richmond Youth Academy years ago.

Overall, academy participants increased their grade point average while decreasing their school absenteeism and discipline referrals. Parents and caregivers also reported better behavior at home. With school districts facing tight budgets, the Firefighter Youth Academy gives at-risk high school students an opportunity for a better future.

Risks & Challenges

The Firefighter Youth Academy model depends on local fire departments to be willing to go above and beyond and volunteer their Saturday mornings to help mentor local youth. In addition, community support keeps costs low through donations of time, skills, and funding.

The organization is set up to succeed.  At its helm, Byron Berhel is a retired Battalion Chief with 30 years of experience as a firefighter, strong connections, and personal knowledge of the intricacies of the fire service, and was one of the founders of the Richmond Firefighter Youth Academy.  He has assembled a strong Board and leadership team, the members of which have years of experience successfully operating youth development and mentorship programs.

Other Ways You Can Help

We thank you for supporting the Robbin Mackbee Firefighter Youth Academy. Every dollar will help, and if we exceed our goal, we will put the money toward expanding to new communities in the Bay Area and around the country in the future. We’re already starting to plan for a full nine-month program in Vallejo starting in March of 2016.

Remember, there are even more ways you can support us:

  • Tell your friends and family about our fundraising campaign for the Vallejo academy
  • Post our campaign to Facebook and like our Facebook page at facebook.com/firefighteryouthacademy
  • Visit our website to learn more at www.firefighteryouthacademy.org

Thank you!

In 1991, a group of Richmond firefighters noticed a disturbing trend of violence in their community. As firefighters in urban environments, they responded to
increasing numbers of medical emergencies that resulted from acts of violence.
Far too often, it was young African-American males who were both the
perpetrators and the victims of violence, suffering serious injury and death.

story:
Capistrano Grind Skate Park, San Juan Capistrano, California

“Making a Dream A Reality”

We are so very excited about making a dream become a reality with the Capistrano Grind Skate Park in San Juan Capistrano, California.  The skate park has been a vision of the community and its members since 2007.  We have made great strides in the past 4 months with the help of many selfless individuals donating time, expertise and energy to make this happen!

The Capistrano Grind Skate Park will allow children and adults a place to skate legally and not violate the law.  The youth of the community will have a place to skate and avoiding breaking the law or getting into unnecessary trouble. The space and project has been approved by the City Council of San Juan Capistrano and we are looking to raise $1,000,000 to fund the building of the skate park to completion.

The new skate park will be a free-to-use, safe, inclusive and family orientated sports facility for users of all ages. The facility will be professionally designed and constructed by a company selected by the Capistrano Grind Skate Park Committee, with design input from local skate park users.

Skate parks are proven to increase health, well-being, community cohesion while reducing social exclusion and anti-social behavior. The skate park will not only benefit skate park users, it will enhance the town of San Juan Capistrano and will be an asset to the whole community!

We thank you in advance for your consideration of donating to our project.  It promises to be one of a kind and exceed all of our expectations!  Please join us in Making Things Happen in San Juan Capistrano.  Become a part of the excitement today of making a dream become a reality! 

Nathan K. Banda


“There are people who make things happen, there are people who watch things happen and there are people who wonder what happened.  To be successful, we have to people who make things happen”

story:
Who is Serenite Foundation? 

Founded in 2014, Serenite Foundation is a 501(c) (3) not-for-profit organization providing support to families dealing with pediatric cancer. Our services include meal delivery, transportation and academic support for siblings.  All of the families we support are receiving treatment at hospitals and live at or below the low-income status. For more information please visit : www.Serenite-foundation.org

Why we are raising funds?

Currently there are 30 families admitted in our local children's hospital  receiving treatment for various types of cancer. These families are from different areas of California or out of state, and are temporarily staying in a family house near  hospital for the duration of their child's treatment. 

We are seeking to raise 25K to provide a healthy end of the day meal to these families upon their return to the family house, after a long day at the hospital.  Any amount we raise will fully go to providing meals for these families. Your contribution will bring some relief to a parent going through a painful journey! 

We thank you for your support! Please share our campaign with your friends and family. 


Our goals in more detail:

The increasing number of kids diagnosed with cancer is alarming. That means more and more families are experiencing this painful ordeal, and they all face a potential melt down not only emotionally but financially. Although we won’t be able to solve the root cause of this issue, we are able to make a difference and give a helping hand. Your tax deductible donations, every single dollar of it, helps Serenite Foundation maintain  long-term viability in order to support families dealing with pediatric cancer.

Stretch goal #1: 

Once we reach $25,000, we will be able to deliver warm, fresh and healthy meals to 30 families for 6 months. By increasing the number of families served, we will be able to bring down the meal cost due to increased volume.  We have local vendors interested in helping us achieve this goal.  We will continue to support the current number of families being sponsored until this goal is met for expansion.

Stretch goal #2: 

Once we reach $80,000, we will further expand our services to provide meals to 50 families in two (2) different facilities.  Our ongoing strategy will be to reduce meal cost by partnering with a variety of locally licensed food providers, so we can expand our reach and support.

Stretch goal #3 

Once we go beyond $80,000, we will be able to expand our services by providing transportation to families whose child has developed a compromised immune system.  These children are put at risk every time they have to share a ride with other passengers in a van, and especially when having to use public transportation.  This transportation service would enable families to go back and forth to the doctors’ office and chemo infusion appointments, without worrying about exposing the children to viruses and germs that could be life threatening.  This is an important service since most families are not local, and renting a car for several weeks is costly.  With this funding, we will work to secure a local transportation company to assist us with rides or we will look for a small van donation to Serenite in order to provide these special patients a ride on an as needed basis.


Our meal delivery impact projection:

Reaching our $25,000 goal means that we will be able to deliver 3,120 meals for 6 months at the cost of $8 per meal .  That’s two meals  a week for 26 weeks. The cost of delivery is included as is the expense of a part time scheduler to coordinate the efforts between family house, vendors and patients. 

Reaching our $80,000 goal means that we will be able to provide support to an addition 20  families at the cost of $8 per meal .At this point, we will have maximized our ability to decrease the meal cost per the volume we have, and we will allocate remaining funds to rolling out our transportation plan. 

What do our families say about us?

" Dear Serenite foundation team,

Please accept our dearest appreciation and gratitude for our first dinner service we received on Tuesday night.

Having a family member who is dealing with a serious illness, a 6 years old and working long hours makes it very challenging to prepare dinner every night. It was great to come home to warm, delicious and healthy dinner waiting for us!! It made the night go much smoother and allowed for more quality time. 

Thank you again for your support and kindness !! "


Your contribution will enable us to: 

•  Provide dinner to all the families residing at the local  temporary family housing.

•  Provide transportation to the child with low immune system and ease the pain and stress of getting to appointments on time.

• Help sponsor an increases number of families who are  going through a tough and painful journey. 

Other Ways You Can Help

•  Please Donate! There are great perks for supporting our campaign.

•  Please Share! Crowdfunding campaigns work best when friends-of-friends get involved. 

•  Follow us on Facebook and use the #Serenitekids  to spread the word about our campaign to your networks.


FAQ

Q: Will my donations be tax deductible?

A: Yes! We are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, all your donations are tax deductible.Our EIN # 46-5618968

Q: Are the perks listed the only ones that will be available? 

A:  No!  Perks are revolving due to the generosity of our supporters and vendors.  These include limited edition artwork, special offers from authors to name a few.  If you would like to contribute “a perk” per your area of expertise, exposure or circle of influence, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Q: How do we go make arrangment to Maz Jobrani Show on the " I am an Angel" package?

A: It’s simple, look at his schedule here www.mazjobrani.com

Pick a show at a comedy club of your choice,  and email us the information.  We will send you the 4 tickets, which includes being directed to the VIP Backstage lounge where you’re sure to have an amazing time mingling with Maz, getting  your book signed and, don’t forget to take that selfie!!


Q: When should I expect my Longeva Skincare products for the " I make a difference " package ?

As soon as we receive your information, one of our dedicated staff will contact you directly to make arrangements for mailing  your gift  to you right away.

www.longeva.com


Q: What's the book " Alley of Love and Yellow Jasmine"? 
A: Oscar nominee and Emmy Award–winning actress Shohreh Aghdashloo shares her remarkable personal journey—from a childhood in the Shah’s Iran to the red carpets of Hollywood—in The Alley of Love and Yellow Jasmines, a dazzling memoir of family, faith, and hope.


Q: What should I expect at my appointment with BlacMera Fashion Designer for the " "I am a Celebrity" ?

A: Whether you are male or female, you will enjoy being treated like a STAR in this unique opportunity to have a 1:1 with a celebrity fashion designer!!  You will learn everything you need to know about colors, shapes and designs that suit you best.  Be prepared for a personalized and custom fitting of one of her dresses or Men’s shirts. While the cost of the dress or shirt of your choice is not a part of the perk we offer, please enjoy the complimentary gift bag chosen for you.  And, don’t forget to have lots of FUN learning how to be the BEST you!


Q: I Need to know more about the book " LIFE"

A: This book is a compilation of photographs chronicling  lives the Author Yuliana Candra, encountered during her travels over a span of 10 years. It includes the best of her photo journal shot in various remote locales in 20 countries. She captured candid stills of her subjects as they celebrated momentous events in their lives or as they simply tended to their daily chores.    


Q:What is Batteriser?
A: Batteriser is the world's first micro-thin sleeve that slips over your batteries and instantly extends their life by up to 8x. The key is that most devices only tap a fraction of a battery's energy. Batteriser taps into the remaining energy that is usually thrown away. You will be getting a total of 16  AA Batteriser.
www.batteriser.com

Q: What do the artworks " Bird of Paradise" and "PATH" look like?

A: Here is the artwork, you can also see the artist's statement here:

http://www.yulianacandra.com

"Bird of Paradise"

"PATH"

Q: I love what you are doing! How can I help?

A: The quickest and easiest way to help us right now is support us with your generous donation! We also welcome help in many other ways as well:

1.  Share this page with your family and friends, including a personal message describing why the campaign is important to you!

2.  Follow us on  Facebook and use the #Serenitekids  to spread the word about our campaign!

Q: Who made your AMAZING campaign video? 

A: We're so glad you asked! We owe our fantastic video appeal to Onyx Pictures and Jeff Martin for his amazing voice! www.onyxpic.com 

Q: Is shipping included in the perks?

A: Yes, if you live in the US. However, for international donors, please add the specified shipping after you choose your perk.

Q: I bought a perk to help with the fundraiser, can I give more?

A: Yes! There is an option at checkout to add more to your contribution. Thank you!

Q: What if I want to donate but don't want a perk?

 A: We appreciate your support for our campaign and we welcome your donation even if you do not wish to pick a perk. That just means 100% of your donation will go directly to the families dealing with pediatric cancer.  Serenite thanks you for your support

Q: Can I donate via check?

A: Yes! Please make check payable to Serenite Foundation.  Remember, your contribution is  tax deductible since we are a registered 501(c) (3) .

In the memo line of your check, please write "Indiegogo Campaign" so will ensure your money is earmarked for the campaign. Our address is:

851 Burlway Road, Suite 708 
Burlingame, CA 94010

We appreciate your support so much. As a grassroots campaign, by definition we owe any future success to you.

Thank you!

In memory of Little Regina who inspired the creation of Serenite Foundation.

Regina Tan ( 1999-2007)

glad you asked! We owe our fantastic video appeal to Onyx Pictures and Jeff
Martin for his amazing voice! www.onyxpic.com 

Q: Is shipping
included in the perks?
A: Yes, if you
live in the US. However, for international donors, please add the specified
shipping after you choose your perk.
Q: I bought a
perk to help with the fundraiser, can I give more?
A: Yes! There
is an option at checkout to add more to your contribution. Thank you!
Q: What if I
want to donate but don't want a perk?
 A: We appreciate
your support for our campaign and we welcome your donation even if you do not
wish to pick a perk. That just means 100% of your donation will go directly to the
families dealing with pediatric cancer. 
Serenite thanks you for your support
Q: Can I donate
via check?
A:
Yes! Please make check payable to Serenite Foundation.  Remember, your contribution is  tax deductible since we are a registered
501(c) (3) .
In the memo
line of your check, please write "Indiegogo
Campaign" so will ensure your money is earmarked for the campaign. Our
address is:
851 Burlway
Road, Suite 708 
Burlingame, CA 94010
We appreciate
your support so much. As a grassroots campaign, by definition we owe any future
success to you.
Thank you!
In memory of Little Regina who inspired the creation of Serenite Foundation.
Regina Tan ( 1999-2007)

story:
Who We Are + What We Do

Emergent Ground is a social justice initiative that integrates art and design to bring about positive transformation in the built environment through youth-centered education and community-based projects. We envision youth and communities of color at the forefront of building a more socially-just, peaceful, and ecologically-viable world.

Our arts and design programming has real-world relevancy by working with youth to create innovative solutions for real community needs.  We partner with public schools and community organizations to deliver integrated arts and design programming to youth - primarily youth of color, ages 14-24, from disenfranchised communities.  Youth work hands-on - in the studio and in the city - drawing, mapping, and model-making.  They engage in the process of making, thinking critically, and re-making to visually communicate their unique ideas.  

Our curriculum is highly adaptable and aims to build skills incrementally, with the goal of youth envisioning, proposing, and ultimately building interventions in the urban landscape, as well as create pathways to new career and higher education opportunities - especially in the fields of architecture, landscape architecture, urban design, and public art.

Why This Matters Now

National studies show that arts education in schools confers lower dropout rates, fewer behavioral issues and increased overall academic performance.  Additionally, a June 2015 study by the University of Chicago shows that instilling young adults with a sense of agency and place in their surroundings greatly influences success.

The built environment has a major impact on how we feel, how we interact, how we see ourselves and our communities reflected in our surroundings. The overall organization, spatial qualities, and material details of the built environment are reflective of the worldviews of those who designed it.  Having equal access to participate in shaping our surroundings and the systems we live in is foundational for social justice.  Currently, the art and design fields shaping our built environment - especially architecture, landscape architecture, urban planning, and public art - lack diversity.

What We Need

Your support will help Emergent Ground deliver programming to high school aged youth in Oakland, California. In order to continue to run  programs throughout the 2015-2016 school year, we need to raise $45,000 by mid-October. Your generous donations will cover costs such as:

  • Art and design materials
  • Stipends for youth to participate in our after school program
  • Facilitation of workshops
  • Recruitment of mentors in the fields of art and design
  • Ongoing curriculum development
  • Community showcase of youth work at the end of each semester
  • Healthy snacks for the youth (brain food!)

At Emergent Ground, we are committed to responsible growth.  As artists, designers, and teachers, it is sometimes easy to volunteer to do things we love without compensation. However, while keeping our overhead costs low, Emergent Ground is committed to paying our instructors for their time in order to keep our work sustainable, energized, and fair. We have already applied to a range of national and local grants for 2016-17 — but in the meantime we need your help NOW to continue our programs this Fall!

The Impact

The impact will go far beyond the number of students enrolled in programming - many will positively impact their communities with the skills acquired.  Youth ideas become built projects, potentially impacting whole communities for years to come.

Over the next three years, Emergent Ground will expand to run ongoing programs in four to five low-income schools in the Oakland Unified School District.  

To find out more about Emergent Ground, please visit our website at www.emergentground.org.

THANK YOU!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share this campaign by email, Facebook, Twitter or any social media you like best.
