story:
Short Summary

The objective of this campaign is to raise funds for the production and printing of the second episode of Artery Wars ("Attack of the Worms"). This comic will use colorful graphics and simple text to address the dangers associated with soil parasite infections and what can be done to avoid them in vulnerable communities. Copies will be distributed in the municipal schools of Santa Luzia do Itanhy, one of the poorest counties in Brazil. The campaign will also help fund the translation and printing of both issues into English. CentroNia, a non-profit organization in Washington, DC, will help us distribute the English version in local schools to increase awareness among students about the environmental health hazards hat children their own age face across the world.

Sample Page From First Issue


         Sample Page From First Issue


Problem:
Iron deficiency anemia is the world’s greatest nutritional disease, affecting 30% of the world’s population. This disease is linked to cognitive development deficiencies in children, which can have lasting consequences in their health, ability to learn and economic development as adults. Iron deficiency anemia develops due to several causes, and lack of proper nutrition is one of the most common ones. In more vulnerable areas, this condition is exacerbated by infectious diseases like malaria and soil parasites, among others. In Santa Luzia do Itanhy, one of the poorest counties in Brazil, the average rate of students with Iron Deficiency Anemia reaches an alarming 32%. 


Sample Page From First Issue:           


The Solution:

IPTI and several stakeholders such as doctors, nurses, nursing technicians, students and health agents, developed and implemented a social technology in the form of a comic book to reduce the prevalence of anemia in schools. The comic book, Artery Wars, was firstly distributed to 5000 children and their families in Santa Luzia do Itanhy and nearby towns, reducing anemia prevalence to 6.5%. The first episode was called "Invisible Sabotage", which incorporated public health solutions to recognize and fight anemia. 

The second episode, "Attack of the Worms”, will address the issues and dangers associated with soil parasite infections and what can be done to avoid them. We foresee to see a similar impact as we had with the first episode. These episodes will be distributed among students in developed countries to raise awareness of the implications of soil parasites for nutritional health in vulnerable populations. Bringing awareness to these students can help bridge the gap between underserved child and their counterparts, and help build a bridge among diverse community to create a more mindful generation.

The creation of the book was conducted by Luca Fontes, a 16 years old teen together with 8 other students from the community.



The Price

Total: $14,200


Perk Displays




Other Ways You Can Help
Do more than just donate: spread the word! Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends about this campaign. It's a good cause that really needs the support!

story:
Our aims

Many of us have seen the terrible pictures on our news feeds and we are now aware of the plight of the refugees in Calais. We have set up this page to raise funds so that we can purchase and distribute blankets, nappies, first aid kits, shoes, waterproof clothing and sanitary items. We will also be distributing small teddies to the many children who are in the camp. All your money will go to purchasing the items, we will not use any of the funds for our own costs. We will provide invoices and receipts and upload them for total transparency. We won't take a penny. In addition we will be photographing our journey and keeping a video diary so that our supporters can be kept up to date every step of the way.

Our first trip will be Saturday September 12th.                                                                  Edit: Our first trip will now be Sunday September 13th.

Our second trip will hopefully be about a fortnight after that.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone will be able to donate goods or money. If you still wish to help us in other ways then please do share our indiegogo and facebook links on your social media profiles. If you have any questions you can also email us at tocalaiswithlove@gmail.com

Thank you!

story:
What makes this school so special?

The Tarqumiya Center for Children with Special Needs is a unique joint initiative of Palestinians, Israelis and Americans. Its purpose is to provide essential services to children with special needs in the Palestinian village of Tarqumiya and the surrounding villages that are in need of these essential services. Tarqumiya is a Palestinian town situated west of Hebron, 3 km from the Israeli border with a population of more than 20,000 people and no facilities for children with special needs. This means children need to travel outside of the community for services or often stay at home. This has direct financial impact on these already marginalized families, resulting in at least one parent that cannot go out to work.

This is a community driven project!

Tarqumiya community members attended a Global Village Square sponsored by the Center for Emerging Futures.  There they met some Israelis and together formulated the idea for this school. In addition to funding the start of this school, your donation will result in many people in the community volunteering their time, expertise, material and passion to bring this center to life. It is a community effort for the community.

Who are we?

Azhar Al-Ghad (Flowers of Tomorrow) is a Palestinian non-profit established by residents of Tarqumiya, to develop services and facilities for children with special needs, their families, and the surrounding community.

A group of caring Israelis who saw a need and felt drawn to help their friends is a partner in this project.

CEF (the Center for Emerging Futures) is a USA non-profit that brings Israelis and Palestinians together to build sustainable partnerships. It has been supporting Azhar Al-Ghad's efforts from the day the idea from the center was born. *


Be part of the change!

We need an initial sum of $60,000 to get this first year of the project up and running.  This amount will provide a year of services for 10 children between 3-6 years old. It will directly impact 10 families or close to 70 people!

But this is only the beginning... We believe that once this school goes live, many potential donors will want to contribute and be part of the change, grow the school and bring a future of hope to these special kids and families.


Where will my donation go?

All funds raised will go toward the following:

  • Renting the space
  • Renovating the space and making it accessible
  • Paying salaries to teachers and assistants
  • Covering costs of transportation for the kids 
  • Covering costs for lunch and snacks
  • Covering other on-going costs such as electricity, water etc.
**

What happens if we do not reach our goal?

With your generous help we believe we can reach our goal.  However if we don’t reach our goal, any funds raised in this campaign will go to the Azhar Al-Gahd association and will be used exclusively to help children and families with special needs.

We would love to give you a gift!

We deeply appreciate your contribution and wish to show it by giving you one of our very special gifts. See the Perks section for the gifts for each level of contribution. 

Frequently Asked Questions:

What is CEF’s role in this project?

The Center for Emerging Futures (CEF) -  has spent the last 11 years in Israel and Palestine facilitating gatherings of Israelis and Palestinians designed to help them rediscover their shared humanity and see if there are joint projects they might want to work on together.

When self-managed groups grow from these meetings and demonstrate leadership that is a partnership and shares ownership of the vision CEF becomes a support to the project, particularly in the field of project and often some limited start-up funds.

CEF expects that long term funding will come from both the Palestinian Ministry of Education and grant makers in US, EU and Middle Eastern institutions.  CEF has learned that those bigger funders want to see a start-up that is active on the ground and shows existing community support.  For these reasons CEF is assisting the local non-profit society established in Tarqumiya to raise funds for this pilot project.  Teacher and staff training is being offered to Tarqumiya teachers by both Israeli and Palestinian experts in the field through another grant from the EU that has already been received by another West Bank school, in part through CEF efforts.

http://www.emergingfutures.org

Is $60,000 enough to run a new school?

No, not by itself. Additional funds totaling $25,000 have been raised through other grants.  More importantly, it should be understood that these funds being raised are to start a small school with state-of-the art treatment and education that can be provided now in an area with almost no other resources.  There are potential funders who have expressed interest in considering support for a school with 100+ students and a $250,000 budget once early evidence of need and an ability to respond to the need is established.

How will the Indiegogo money be spent?

Approximately $25,000 will be utilized to upgrade a facility (that cost is low because of the combined efforts of Israeli and Palestinian volunteers) and this  $60,000 will fund operations for a limited number of students during the first year. Concurrently, the Tarqumiya society will be raising the much greater funding needed to gradually build enrollment to 100+ students.

Is this project for real?

Yes!  Grants from the EU for teacher training including Tarqumiya teachers have been received.  In addition to $10,000 awarded by CEF, the Australian government recently announced a $15,000 grant for the pilot project.  Funding this school is a key component of the long-term goal for the folks from both sides of the conflict who know how important it is to these children.


* CEF is a nonprofit institution registered as 501(c)(3) in the United States. All donations by USA citizens are tax deductible. 
**All funds for this Indiegogo campaign will be collected by CEF on behalf of Azhar Al-Ghad and used solely to fund the 

Tarqumiya Center for Children with Special Needs.

story:
Important Announcement: Referral Contest

Between December 1 and 15, we are having a contest to reward the person who brings the most visits to our campaign page through social media. The prize will be a like-new collectible copy of the original U.S. edition of John Paul I's book Illustrissimi. We’ll announce the winner at the close of the campaign on December 16.

To count as a referrer, you must have contributed at least $5 to the campaign (so we will have your contact info if you win). Anyone who has contributed since the beginning of the campaign is eligible, though the counting of referrals only begins on December 1. All you have to do is promote our campaign with Indiegogo’s share tools while logged into your Indiegogo account. If you don’t have an account, you can sign up for free. The share tools are located on the left of the campaign page. Being logged in makes it possible for us to track your referrals. So you have two weeks to make a difference!

Update, December 16: I had planned to announce the winner today, but none of those who promoted our campaign also made a donation. Instead, we will award the book by a drawing among all those who have donated since the start of the campaign -- plus, we will be including all those who donate through our website through December 31. We'll announce the winner there. Thanks to all our contributors for their generosity!

The Power of Numbers

A Lonely Struggle

For a long time, I thought I was the only person who remembered Pope John Paul I. When Cardinal Albino Luciani was elected in 1978, I was immediately moved by his serenity and joy, his smile and his wonderful catechism lessons. I read everything I could about him, even after he died so suddenly, just a month into his promising papacy. I continued to study his life, learning Italian and ordering his books from Italy, in order to be able to read his writings.


Then when the furor broke out over the Pope’s death in 1984, with the publication of In God’s Name by David Yallop, I thought I was the only one in the English-speaking world who remembered what John Paul I was really like, and who could refute David Yallop’s ridiculous theory that the Pope was murdered. That my first visit to Italy to research, to my translating John Paul I’s writings into English, and years of fruitless struggle to get a publisher interested in publishing them or the biography of him I was writing.

Meeting Friends

What helped me more than anything else was discovering that there were other people who felt the same about John Paul I as I did. Over the years, in addition to meeting the Luciani family and some of the late Pope's co-workers, I met the Seabecks, the founders of The Missionary Servants of John Paul I, with whom I finally got some of Luciani's writings published in The Smiling Pope in 2003. I met many ordinary people who loved him through e-mail, social media, and my blog. I also met Mo Guernon and Paul Spackman, who had both written about our Pope. Paul is the author of God’s Candidate: the Life and Times of John Paul I, and Mo Guernon has written articles and is also working a biography, to be called Love Is a Journey: A Portrait of Pope John Paul I.

What We Found We Could Do Together

In 2012, Mo, Paul and I got together with a few other people to organize a conference called “The True Pope John Paul I,” which was held in New York to commemorate the centenary of his birth. Participants included the Pope’s niece, Pia Luciani, Loris Serafini, a local historian from John Paul I's home town of Canale d'Agordo and Stefania Falasca, who wrote the Positio for his beatification process. We learned many new details about his life, and found out some important information about his death from Pia and from Fr. Joseph Curran,  who was in Rome at the time, and had a very lively discussion of the murder theory. A local TV station did a great story about it (see the video above).  Read our latest press release with many fascinating revelations from the conference.

That was when we saw the possibilities for a Pope John Paul I Association.

We incorporated as a non-profit in New York 2013.  Our purpose is:

1. To spread accurate knowledge of the life, writing, and spirituality of Pope John Paul I through means such as publications, conferences, workshops, the media and internet and to promote the cause for his beatification and canonization.

2. To provide a means for those of any faith who are interested in the purpose of the association to obtain information and to network with each other.

We did lots of planning and discussion, and slowly built our website. We have met new people, including some in different parts of the world who want to join or even start branches of our Association in their own country.

See what the power of numbers can do?

Taking our Work to the Next Level

Now we are ready to expand our work to meet the new interest, and the power of numbers can work again -- with your help.

Here’s what we need money for and how we will use the donations we receive:

  • To prepare the 2012 conference papers for publication, including copy-editing and proofreading of the text, and sound editing of the conference audio.
  • To pay for legal advice on our structure and by-laws and the necessary fees for applying for 501c(3) status with the IRS,
  • To pay some outstanding bills.
  • To maintain and develop our website, i.e. adding the ability to sign up as a member, listing of upcoming events, user forums, etc.
  • For future activities, including conferences, speakers, videos, publications, etc.

Together we can rescue John Paul I’s memory.

Even if you can't contribute a large amount financially, you can still help us enormously by spreading the word about our campaign. E-mail people, put a link on your blog or web site, and use our social networking tools on the left of the page. There are even such old-fashioned methods as chatting on the phone and (gasp!) talking in person.

I hope to have some fun here, so stay tuned for some surprises. In a week or so, I hope to debut here the first part of a video I’m making on John Paul I.

John Paul I and the Jubilee Year

The Jubilee Year of Mercy called by Pope Francis, has many people discussing the meaning of this virtue. John Paul I’s teaching on mercy is gaining increased attention as the Church approaches the Jubilee Year, including an article by famed Vaticanist Andrea Tornielli.  So the Pope John Paul I Association has started a petition asking Pope Francis to “proclaim and promote the Magisterium of John Paul I on Mercy during the coming Jubilee Year, and encourage the study of his works.” It says, in part:

“In his audiences, Papa Luciani taught the world how to cultivate faith and hope in childlike humility, the better to trust in God’s mercy. Earlier in his letter to Jesus, he had said: ‘Your whole manner is that -- this is my impression -- of someone more concerned with the suffering that sin produces in the sinners than the offense it gives to God. When you are instilling the hope of forgiveness, You seem to say: “You can't even imagine the pleasure that your conversion gives me!”’ (Illustrissimi)

“Most famously, he stressed the maternal quality of God's mercy: ‘God has such tender love for use, even more tender than the love that a mama has for her children, Isaiah says.’(Sept. 13th audience). ‘Little children, when they are sick, have one more reason to be loved by their mothers, and so do we: if we are sick with wickedness, if we have gone astray, then we have one more reason to be loved by the Lord.’ (Sept 10th Angelus).

You can read the whole petition and sign it here.

(Update: the petition ends Dec.16)
story_txt:
Important Announcement: Referral Contest

Between December 1 and 15,
we are having a contest to reward the person who brings the most visits to our
campaign page through social media. The prize will be a like-new collectible
copy of the original U.S. edition of John Paul I's book Illustrissimi. We’ll announce the winner
at the close of the campaign on December 16.
To count as a referrer, you must have contributed at least
$5 to the campaign (so we will have your contact info if you win). Anyone who
has contributed since the beginning of the campaign is eligible, though the
counting of referrals only begins on December 1. All you have to do is promote our
campaign with Indiegogo’s share tools while logged into your Indiegogo account.
If you don’t have an account, you can sign up for free. The share tools are
located on the left of the campaign page. Being logged in makes it possible for us to
track your referrals. So you have two weeks to make a difference!
Update, December 16: I had planned to announce the winner today, but none of those who promoted our campaign also made a donation. Instead, we will award the book by a drawing among all those who have donated since the start of the campaign -- plus, we will be including all those who donate through our website through December 31. We'll announce the winner there. Thanks to all our contributors for their generosity!
The Power of
Numbers
A Lonely Struggle

For a long time, I thought I was the only person who
remembered Pope John Paul I. When Cardinal Albino Luciani was elected in 1978, I was immediately
moved by his serenity and joy, his smile and his wonderful catechism lessons. I
read everything I could about him, even after he died so suddenly, just a month
into his promising papacy. I continued to study his life, learning Italian and ordering his
books from Italy, in order to be able to read his writings.


Then when the furor broke out over the Pope’s death in 1984,
with the publication of In God’s Name
by David Yallop, I thought I was the only one in the English-speaking world who
remembered what John Paul I was really like, and who could refute David Yallop’s
ridiculous theory that the Pope was murdered. That my first visit to Italy to
research, to my translating John Paul I’s writings into English, and years of fruitless
struggle to get a publisher interested in publishing them or the biography of him I was
writing. Meeting Friends

What helped me more than anything else was discovering that
there were other people who felt the same about John Paul I as I did. Over the
years, in addition to meeting the Luciani family and some of the late Pope's co-workers, I met the Seabecks, the founders of
The Missionary Servants of John Paul I, with whom I finally got some of Luciani's writings published in The Smiling
Pope in 2003. I met many ordinary people who loved him through e-mail,
social media, and my blog. I also met Mo Guernon and Paul Spackman, who had both written about
our Pope. Paul is the author of God’s Candidate: the Life and Times of John Paul I, and Mo Guernon has written articles and is also working a biography, to be called Love
Is a Journey: A Portrait of Pope John Paul I. 
What We Found We Could Do Together

In 2012, Mo, Paul and I got together with a few other people
to organize a conference called “The True Pope John Paul I,” which was held in
New York to commemorate the centenary of his birth. Participants included the
Pope’s niece, Pia Luciani, Loris Serafini, a local historian from John Paul I's home town of Canale d'Agordo and Stefania Falasca, who wrote the Positio for his beatification process. We learned many new details about his life, and found out some important information about his death from Pia and from Fr. Joseph Curran,  who was in Rome at the time, and had a very lively discussion of the murder theory. A
local TV station did a great story about it (see the video above).  Read our latest press release with many fascinating revelations from the conference.
That was when we saw
the possibilities for a Pope John Paul I Association. 
We incorporated as a non-profit in New
York 2013.  Our purpose is:
1. To spread accurate knowledge of the life, writing, and 
spirituality of Pope John Paul I through means such as publications, 
conferences, workshops, the media and internet and to promote the cause 
for his beatification and canonization. 
2. To provide a means for those of any faith who are interested in 
the purpose of the association to obtain information and to network with
 each other.
We did lots of planning and discussion, and slowly built our website. We have met new people, including some in different parts of the
world who want to join or even start branches of our Association in their own
country.
See what the power of numbers can
do? 
Taking our Work to the Next Level
Now we are ready to expand our work
to meet the new interest, and the power of numbers can work again -- with your
help.
Here’s what we need money for and
how we will use the donations we receive: 

To prepare the 2012 conference
papers for publication, including copy-editing and proofreading of the text,
and sound editing of the conference audio.
To pay for legal advice on our
structure and by-laws and the necessary fees for applying for 501c(3) status
with the IRS, 
To pay some outstanding bills. 
To maintain and develop our website,
i.e. adding the ability to sign up as a member, listing of upcoming events,
user forums, etc. 
For future activities, including
conferences, speakers, videos, publications, etc.

Together we can rescue John Paul I’s
memory.
Even if you can't contribute a large amount
financially, you can still help us enormously by spreading the word about our
campaign. E-mail people, put a link on your blog or web site, and
use our social networking tools on the left of the page. There are even
such old-fashioned methods as chatting on the phone and (gasp!) talking in
person.
I hope to have some fun here, so stay tuned for some
surprises. In a week or so, I hope to debut here the first part of a video I’m
making on John Paul I. 
John
Paul I and the Jubilee Year

The Jubilee Year of Mercy called by Pope Francis, has many people
discussing the meaning of this virtue. John Paul I’s teaching on mercy is gaining increased
attention as the Church approaches the Jubilee Year, including an article by famed Vaticanist Andrea Tornielli.  So the Pope John Paul I Association has started a petition asking Pope Francis to “proclaim and promote the Magisterium of John Paul I
on Mercy during the coming Jubilee Year, and encourage the study of his works.”
It says, in part:
“In his audiences, Papa Luciani taught the
world how to cultivate faith and hope in childlike humility, the better to
trust in God’s mercy. Earlier in his letter to Jesus, he had said: ‘Your whole
manner is that -- this is my impression -- of someone more concerned with the
suffering that sin produces in the sinners than the offense it gives to God. When
you are instilling the hope of forgiveness, You seem to say: “You can't even
imagine the pleasure that your conversion gives me!”’ (Illustrissimi)
“Most famously, he stressed the maternal
quality of God's mercy: ‘God has such tender love for use, even more tender
than the love that a mama has for her children, Isaiah says.’(Sept. 13th
audience). ‘Little children, when they are sick, have one more reason to be
loved by their mothers, and so do we: if we are sick with wickedness, if we
have gone astray, then we have one more reason to be loved by the Lord.’ (Sept
10th Angelus).
You can read the whole petition and sign it here.

(Update: the petition ends Dec.16)

hey--

We've distributed 2,200 of these in the last 5 days. We've managed to create a bit of a buzz on campus, especially after NYU Welcome Week staff took diso guides from freshmen at the Presidential Welcome, telling them they couldn't enter if they had one. 

We've gone $400 out of pocket so far to do a 2nd printing and we would love to do a third. Please help us out. 

Here is a .pdf of what we would get printed: https://nyudisorient.wordpress.com/

Thanks!

story:
My name is Gerald and I am about to embark on my most ambitious educational challenge yet: a two year full time MA at the Royal College of Art in London. The RCA is ranked #1 place to study art in the world according to The Guardian, and I have a place on their Performance Pathway Course - a pioneering dedicated MA towards one of the most contraversial and contemporary genres of Art today: Performance.

It has been one of my goals ever since I started on my career as an Artist to study at the RCA, and now I have the chance to take advantage of first class tutor support and facilities, great creative community and the biggest resource - London itself. 

But there is one problem. One year at the RCA costs £9,000 for UK/EU residents per year. I have been lucky so far, I have had bursary support from the College and will receive a £3,000 discount of the total cost. This takes the cost down to £6,000. I have raised £3,000 from my work and support from family. Now I need your help for the rest. 

£3,000 will allow me to get through the first year of my course. It sounds a lot, but with small donations we can make it. It is a small price to pay for the teaching and study time I need to achieve my goal. Just think of what any person can gain if they have the best equipment, guidance and connections - only the sky is the limit.

But that is not all. For those of you who do donate, I will send you work that I have made specially to raise money. Please see the perks to check what you will receive. The more you can give, the greater the gift in return. 

Thank you all for viewing.

story:
The Short
Do you know about conflict in Myanmar/Burma?  Good news!  There is a cease fire in place!  We should take advantage of the cease fire and move forward to a better situation for others.  We aim to stengthen the economic situation of people in Myanmar/Burma through developing an agriculture business, but we need to work out the details.  This project is to test what options will work and how do we make things work. 
We want to create business for people to earn and bring money into the area, and we will need to test these business ideas out.  
Agriculture development, farmers who have been subsistence farmers want to grow more, enough to sell.  
We want to test ideas out on how to make that happen.  Will option A or option B work? 
I am a veteran who after finishing school fled to hide at Missoula valley in the mountains.  As part of my time in Thailand, I worked with Design and Eliyah.  These men are involved with education and medical treatment with refugees.  We want to create a business partnership working with local farms to modernized farming techniques and increase selling power.  We will test this out on a farming site and use the test site to make food for workers at health clinics.  From what we learn we can move forward to creating business for farmers.  
The Plan
Since conflict has happened farming land still lays fallow.  Plots of this land belong to certain families.  Working with a family we would clear, plant a plot of land, and give the rice to local health clinic workers.  The land would be cleared using a chain saw, weed trimmer, and tractor, slightly different from the traditional slash and burn technique.  A transplanter would be used for planting as opposed to the traditional broadcasting method.  Transplanting has higher efficiency in labour and seed usage.  The crop would be harvested with a combine, and processed with drying racks.  Tradition is not entirely a bad thing as modern techniques in neighboring areas have created problems with dependency on fertilizers and pesticides.  I do not need my farmers twitching and alternates will have to be worked out.  This project is work and involves much coordination.  

The Location
The project will occur in Dooplaya District, Karen State of Myanmar.  Why there?  They asked for it.  And this location is far enough from urban locations to avoid rapid shifts in political unrest.  In conversations with people in this area, the topic of funding came up as it often does.  Recommendations were made for making business instead always seeking donations.  These people want to be entrepreneurs but need the help to get started.  While I am asking for donations now, it is a move to avoid donations later. 
Advantages with this location include ready work force, limited military attention (KNU headquarters is located in the North), 1-2 day journey to almost all needed parts of the supply chain, local approval/request, witnessed coordination between different political organizations, distance from the ocean to limit storm effects, and local "get it done" attitude among local populace. 
Disadvantages about this location are distance to any form of infrastructure (healthcare, shipping, energy, retail, clean water, etc), higher temperatures compared to northern growing areas, limited growing space, and no skiing is available. 
Thanks to the KHRG for allowing this map to be used.  Their website can be found at www.khrg.org. 

The Timeline
The project is planned to start in mid November of 2015.  Much of the beginning should involve negotiation that will pave the way for future ventures.  Purchasing of equipment and certain supplies would occur at this time as well.  December would be excellent time for clearing operations as this is the dry season with cooler temperatures.  This should continue through to February 2016.  March should be a good time to work on using a tractor to scape the land.  Since land has been previously farmed this should not be to difficult.  May and June will be time for planting starts and tilling the ground.  July will be the month for cycling the flooding of the paddies.  Rice should grow steadily into August.  With a final harvest time of September.  If this seems rough, that is because the schedule is very rough. 

The Budget
An expected minimum of expenses for the Test Project fits into four categories; tools/machinery, travel, lodging, and technology. 
Tools/machinery   $7,250.25
Travel                        $2,795.71
Lodging                    $1,315.29
Technology             $1,790.00
Total trip                $13,151.25
Perk items              $1,643.91
Project Total         $14,795.16
The requested amount is $15,000 to provide a slight buffer for unexpected costs. 

The Techniques
What needs to be tested?  Things we will focus on testing or answering are communications, shipping/transportation, and modernized farming.  This a very remote location that does not have infrastructure.  We need to use actual methods of communication to accomplish a task.  While use of a BEGAN satilite transmitter maybe an effective way of communicating from this type of location, it costs too much to operate.  Talking over ideas on communication has sounded great in the past but we need to work out reliable systems to communicate back and forth. 
Shipping/transportation is difficult in a remote location.  That is part of the definition of a remote location.  We aim to create systematic processes for shipping goods and transporting people to and from locations.  While this may sound simple to most people, a location with limited access and a history of violence it is a lot of work.  We will work this out. 
Modernized farming entails the use of farm machinery and application of the system of rice intensification.  Most hilltribe farmers do not use machinery as it is expensive to purchase and operate.  When asked if they would use machinery if they could access it most answered "yes".  System of rice intensification is a method of planting rice differing from regular or traditional ways of planting.  It varies from region to region but follows 5 primary elements.  Those 5 elements are careful leveling/scaping of the rice field, early planting of single seedlings at wider intervals, moistening soil instead of saturating, regular weeding and tilling, and use of organic fertilizers.  Check out the information from Cornell University about this methodology (http://sri.ciifad.cornell.edu/aboutsri/methods/index.html). 

I wanted to get this announcement open and will post more information about the project as we go.

IMPORTANT

Once you have contributed, please go to this link and complete the required information..

https://igrowglobalteam.wufoo.com/forms/z1fb5lm...

This iGrowGlobal Team fund will go towards the Ad Campaign for our 30 second "it" video (currently being edited) which will be promoted on both Facebook and YouTube aggressively over the next 6 months. 

The campaign will reach GLOBALLY and bring in "it" users which will be distributed through our COOP to each person based on the number of shares in the COOP they have purchased. The more shares you own, the more time your "it" link will be on the rotator.

This will be an ongoing campaign and contribution will continue through the next 6 months. Based on cost comparisons recently done, we feel we have enough funds right now to reach 1 million people on YouTube with our video. We are expecting to reach hundreds of thousands of views every month for the next 6 months!!! 

This is a HUGE movement that we are kicking off now so we can dominate the FB and YouTube space as a team, before others catch on and try the same thing. If you are serious about building your iGrow Network business big, then lets team together and leverage our resources! 


10$ = 2 shares
50$ = 15 shares
100$ = 40 shares

Thank you for all your support!

story:
St. Ignatius Church Youth Ministry

We are the Youth Ministry of St Ignatius Church, Kelana Jaya, Malaysia. We started in 2005, when about 20 youths were selected to facilitate the very first Youth Rally, a youth camp for those aged 13-17 from the local parish. Since then, we have trained about 20 young people every year to be facilitators for the Youth Rally, who outreach to the young people at the rally through the use of drama, dance, song and other methods. At the same time, we build them up as young leaders of the church and mold them to be strong characters with their foundation in Christ and the teachings of the Catholic Church. Next year, we are going to send about 30 pilgrims to World Youth Day, which is held in Krakow, Poland.

Briefly, World Youth Day is the single biggest gathering of Catholic Youths from around the world. There will be many activities during that time such as sharing from different youth groups, talks from international speakers, catechism from various religious and speakers, musical concerts from renowned Christian bands and also we get to meet the Holy Father, Pope Francis. This will be an amazing experience for the pilgrims who are going and we want to bring something back to share with the Youth Ministry. 

What are we asking for

This year, 2015 we will be celebrating our 10th year anniversary. We want to use this amazing milestone to seek donations for our yearly activities such as formation programs, reaching out to those less fortunate & community building. At the same time, we will be producing a commemorative booklet for this event to thank all those that have helped us in the past 10 years.

For those in Malaysia,

It would be easier to donate locally to the team rather than using Indiegogo because our currency (Ringgit) is in such a weak position now. If you would rather send it through a local bank, please contact Shamus Siau (siauks@gmail.com)

using Indiegogo because our currency (Ringgit) is in such a weak position now.
If you would rather send it through a local bank, please contact Shamus Siau
(siauks@gmail.com)

story:
In December 2015, I'll be travelling back home to Cape Town, South Africa for the first time in 10 years to visit a close childhood friend and her adoptive/foster family. 

I've watched from afar with admiration as Sylvia has dedicated her life to giving abused and abandoned children a safe and loving home in her home. For the past 17 years she has fostered over 80 children as their parents could not look after them. The state can only give a very small amount of funding and Sylvia needs donations to be able to continue to provide a safe and loving environment for these children.

Some of Sylvia's foster children were abandoned at birth by their families. But with her love and care, they flourish and grow and are adopted by other families.

Some of the children she has taken in are viewed by society as “unadoptable” because of grave health problems such as foetal alcohol syndrome, HIV, TB or brain damage. Sylvia has 9 children living with her long-term because her great heart will not allow them to live in institutions or on the street.

Sylvia's House provides a loving, stable, family environment that allows these children to thrive and enables many of these children to overcome their poor start in life. Many go on to achieve the sort of success we wish for our own children.

Sylvia tells the stories of 2 of the children currently living with her:

Daniel's Story

“Daniel was found on a field in the early hours of the morning with his umbilical cord still fresh and intact. He came to me meowing like a kitten because his voice was exhausted from screaming. As soon as I held him and fed him he slept calmly on my body. His eyes were infected (apparently from birth mother's syphilis). From day one in my home, Daniel was loved, nurtured and adored and he grew into a beautiful little toddler, then into a little boy who could beat adults at chess! Hours were spent on developing his brain with games and puzzles which he loved. Daniel is now a confident, kind hearted young man at a prestigious high school for academically gifted children. He excels at maths, as well as being talented at sports, but his main passion is chess. His future is bright.”

Bradley's Story

“Bradley's mother was using and dealing drugs when she was pregnant with him. She would tell people that she was trying to kill the baby inside her but it would not die. Not long after, the local hospital called to say that she had given birth on the street. But the combination of the abortion attempts and the drugs in the womb meant that doctors said his brain was too badly damaged for him to ever learn much or behave normally.

Life with Bradley has been challenging but slowly, with lots of love and support, things have improved. The ‘weird baby with clenched fists and an angry unresponsive face” has become the well-mannered, goal-driven son that I live with now. He still struggles a bit emotionally and feels overwhelmed easily, but he is now functioning normally, learning normally and goes to a very good high school. Next year he will choose whether he wants to study an academic career or a skills based career.”

Sylvia's House

The welfare system in South Africa is overwhelmed so foster parents need to find much of their own funding. People like Sylvia rely heavily on donations to provide food, therapies, education and a loving home for children who need it.

By giving children like these a stable and loving start in life and by believing in them and supporting them to overcome the challenges they face, Sylvia's House helps these children to lead lives filled with hope rather than despair.

Please help Sylvia to changes children’s stories from hopeless to wonderful.

Sylvia Frank’s Foster Care 
104 Miller Street, Gordon's Bay, 7150 
Mobile: + 27 (0)84 547 0078

Where children know they are safe!

story:
The Leadership Development Resource Weekend

LDR is a network of men and women dedicated to equip and encourage black leaders in various gospel-shaped ministries. We meet together every year to:

  • Engage the core concerns of African American communities
  • Experience robust theological training and renewal
  • Connect young people to mentors in the faith
  • Create space for dialogue about race and justice issues

LDR '15 is our fifth annual conference. This year's theme is Orthodox Activism.

Our vision for this year's LDR Weekend is an extensive discussion on the church's responsibility in social justice issues. We are excited that local congregations and Covenant Theological Seminary will be hosting us September 4-6 in Saint Louis. We would appreciate your support as well. 

Budget

Our hosts have generously offered to provide facilities at no cost. We need help in order to do the rest:

  • Conference Materials:  $2,000
  • Meals:  $3,000
  • Travel assistance for presenters and non-local registrants: $5,000

Conference registration rates are $50 for general and $25 for student admission, which will help in providing honorarium to our presenters. So your support goes a long way in making this conference all inclusive.

  • No donation is too small: every dollar will help us to cover vital parts of this conference.

Our desire is to gather 300 potential and current leaders of various backgrounds and ages. Will you join us in this effort to encourage ongoing multi-ethnic leadership AND raise up the next generation?


Benefits

LDR weekend is a unique opportunity to learn from and about African Americans in ministry. Our presenters are experienced men and women committed to faithful action in eliminating divisions of color and class. While this event is intended to address people who work and live in black communities, people of all ethnic backgrounds are invited to attend.

The weekend also includes youth activities, led by local youth ministers. Young people from 7th to 12th grades will participate in youth-focused events on building trust across racial and generational divides. Engaging young people is essential to our vision of equipping leaders for future generations. 

A few features of LDR 15:

  • Preaching and teaching from Dr. Thurman Williams, Dr. Sean Michael Lucas, Dr. Carl Ellis, Jr., K. A. Ellis , Dr. Mike Higgins, Dr. Vince Bantu and more!
  • Worship led by St. Louis City Mass Choir
  • Youth Summit for ALL young people, grades 7-12th
  • Prayer service and ample fellowship time
  • Free housing and childcare - first come basis


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, please support us in other ways:

  • Spread the word ~ Visit ldrweekend.com and invite friends
  • Give your time ~ Click to see our Volunteer Opportunities

Contact our local LDR coordinator for more information:

Michelle Higgins, michelle@southcitychurch.com

story:
Our Second stretch goal is the Phase Two of our Tuition block (fundraising now) for a total campaign target $150,000

Our fundraising campaign goal of $150,000 will help us reach our goal of  $ 250,000 to completing phase two of our school block  but have a long way of  realising our ultimate goal of $ 1 Million which will help us complete the school 's infrastructure with appropriate facilities to lead our community into the future.

.......................................................................................................................................

Faith Ventures Christian Academy is an innovative independent school in Kenya, East Africa, that incorporates the Accelerated Christian Education (ACE) curricular to create inspired students. Help us complete the model school of engaging, experiential learning in Kenya that will serve as a model ACE center in the country and impact our local communities and generations to come.


Be part of our future! Support Faith Ventures Christian Academy as we establish a model program and school that inspires students to engage in their local and global communities. Your funds will help us secure the space to expand and continue contributing to a new breed of young and growing community leaders through the second phase of our campus build.

Tucked within the city of Nairobi , Kenya,  Faith Venture Christian Academy is the pioneer center for the ACE curricular in Kenya. Nairobi, Kenya’s capital city, is the most dynamic city which is also known as the "green city in the sun" for many reasons.  It is the only city in the world to boast a 12,000 hectare park, teeming with wildlife, and right on its doorstep. It's old enough so you can feel its past and multi-ethnic enough so you can experience Kenyan culture, yet it's modern enough to get Internet access.

It's a city that blends people from all cultures and walks of life.  This wild-to-Sky Corridor is what we at Faith Ventures Christian Academy believe to be unsurpassed natural learning environment. It is a region-wide classroom that ignites the excitement of learning by allowing students from pre-grades 1 to 12 to discover the interconnection between what they learn in class with the environment and the community.

Our curriculum is like no other; the core curriculum is an individualized, biblical-based, character-building package geared to meet the learning needs of individual children.


It is uniquely and proudly regional while remaining focused on the core academic student needs to excel in post-secondary pursuits and beyond.  We emphasize an experience-based education, where each student’s imagination and curiosity propels the development of more advanced communication, creative problem-solving, critical thinking, and collaboration skills. In other words, students open their minds and sharpen their thinking by getting their hands dirty.

Whether the student is a high achiever, a moderately paced learner or a slow learner, our programs begin at the exact level determined by the child’s ability. This is individualization, making it possible for each student to master the subject matter before moving on. And such mastery is the foundation upon which all future learning is built upon.

Our difference is not in what we teach, but how we teach it. We don’t isolate learning. We move it beyond the classroom.

Faith Ventures Christian Academy is a unique endeavor that nurtures students' respect, appreciation, and vision for the wild-to-Sky region that is our capital city, Nairobi, while instilling in them the academic, environmental, technological and economic competencies required for the 21st century. The end results for the program are individuals equipped with the right attitudes and skills needed for success in their tertiary studies. Besides, students learn values and concepts considered fundamental to meaningful interpersonal relationships and productive learning to becoming life shaping influences.

            


Faith Ventures Christian Academy is independently operated and privately funded by parents, but we are most definitely community minded. We emphasize that student involvement in community and environmental issues is essential for progress in a changing economy and society. Our understanding of local, regional and international communities provide the foundation of how our students can positively impact the world around them.

Our aim is not just to educate students, but to involve them in multiple activities that benefit the environment and community at large by volunteering in ways that reach beyond the classroom walls.

Involving students in their community not only builds character, it makes life better for those around them.

   

The special combination of academics and methodology based on physiological development patterns and biblical principles provides for mastery learning, critical analysis, conceptualization, cognitive reasoning and life.

Faith ventures Christian Academy will produce highly motivated, free-thinking and involved graduates, broadly connected to their community, who possess the skills and vision needed to ensure the region’s success well into the future. These are homegrown leaders whose deep understanding of the people and place of the wild-to-Sky region are committed to ensure the sustainability of our environment and robustness of our economy. It is with this understanding of the local community that FVCA students can venture to new places, engage with new cultures, and share creative and innovative ideas that make a difference to the lives of the people they meet.

   

From the Nairobi National park to the miles of trails along the richly forested river banks of Karura forest through the coffee plantations that line up the expansive Kiambu County and the UNEP complex at Gigiri in Nairobi;  this is our learning environment, and we are most fortunate to have it on our doorstep. Faith Venture Christian Academy is equally committed to providing students with a solid, rigorous academic foundation.

Until now, we have been almost entirely funded by private donations and student tuition, and have received exceptional support from parents and local businesses. However our enrollment has continued to grow over the years with the lower entry level intake outgrowing  the present school facilities. Our lower entry and upper grade classes currently share classrooms for lack of learning centers resulting to bigger size classes which hamper the individual pace and growth of students.

FVCA now has a growing list of students stretched through to three years waiting list and we have outgrown the classroom space currently available to us at all grades.

Our affiliation with Trinity Fellowship, a non-denominational Christian Organization in Nairobi, remains solid and they have generously offered to lease land to FVCA that keeps us on the campus. The school requires raising funds to build classrooms, sporting and creative arts facilities, hire teachers and staff and acquire resources to meet the growing student demand for the ACE programs in Kenya at large.

However, our immediate urgent need right now is to raise funds to complete phase two of the school building block by end of year 2015 in order to accommodate students at grades 10 and 11. This extra block will create room for the lower entry 'tiny bees' and those students on the school waiting list.

....................Below is the current tuition block that we intend to replace through your kind contribution in this campaign...........................................................

                                                        

                   ....................Proposed Tuition Block.............................


School Building Rendering - Aerial View

Site Plan Rendering-Front View

An artist impression of the complete school project

Faith Ventures Christian Academy along with our students, staff and supporters are committed to building a world- class learning environment right here in Garden estate, Nairobi, to serve as the model ACE learning center in Kenya and beyond.

Your financial support – small or large - could ensure that the target is met.



Education impacts all of us. FVCA has learned from countless educators, education systems, educational and scientific research to adopt a cohesive program that benefits students, the community, and the world around us -- today and into the future; the ACE program.

Your support of innovative educational programs becomes part of the massive shift in education in this corner of the world. We teach our students that every individual has the power to make a difference in the world. Your support shows how true this can be.

Even the smallest donation means a lot to our students. And if you cannot help by giving towards this campaign, you can assist by spreading the word to your family members, friends and colleagues everywhere. We need your help!



Painting and wood carvings

Masai handcrafted picnic spread



Nairobi national park

The perks offered are listed on the right column of the page. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Our Contacts
Mobile: +254 735 190 198.
Email: info@faithventuresacademy.com

story:
The Goal:  

Its no secret that the Earth's surface is mostly ocean. We on land are surrounded by mysteriously powerful bodies of water, full of life. Unfortunately 95% of our oceans remain unexplored, and we plan to slowly change that through citizen science. By funding our private ROV, you are contributing to the exploration of the coastal waters of the Northern US (an area that larger science foundations have not thoroughly mapped).  


The Bigger Picture:

Project Sentinel will involve and stimulate the public's scientific interest. We hope to revive and improve the citizen science movement, where everyday people can perform experiments and exploration to produce data and results. By bringing research back into the public domain, the scientific community will diversify and grow!



What we need for the ROV:  

The $3000 needed for this project will go towards the following:  

$1500 for 6 deep water thrusters (to control the vehicle)

$500 for various circuit components  

$1000 for surface control equipment and cameras

Note: A project like this that only requires $3000 is an amazing opportunity, as some ROVs cost hundreds of thousands or more***  



How you can help:  

Share this project with your friends and families and contribute if you can! Not only am I passionate about this project, but I am looking to expand it in the future. Our final frontier is here at home, under thousands of feet of water.  

THANKS TO ALL OUR CONTRIBUTORS -- You will be recognized


IF YOU HAVE QUESTIONS: LEAVE A COMMENT!

All comments help us improve!
This [below] was a frame test we looked at a while ago, our new design is bigger, better, faster and stronger!

story:
Kinderen in Kenia hebben (school)truien nodig!

  • Mijn naam is Frouwke Jager, ik ben heel erg goed in het breien van leuke dingen voor mijn familie en kennissen en doe dit altijd met plezier. Nu zag ik de actie voorbij komen van stichting Eboo waarmee ik met mijn talent andere mensen kan helpen die veel behoefte hebben aan zoiets simpels als een trui.
  • Het is nu zo dat ik niet over de middelen beschik om al het benodigde materiaal te kopen, dus wil ik met u de afspraak maken om de inleg te verdelen, u doet een bijdrage voor minimaal 1 trui en ik ga hem breien, zo helpen we allebei een beetje!
  • Samen zorgen wij er dan voor dat kinderen in Kenia gewoon naar school kunnen, in hun (verplichte) uniform en dat ze een kwalitatief goede trui hebben waar ze lang mee vooruit kunnen.

We zijn 240 Euro nodig om 20 truien te maken.

  • Per trui slechts 12 Euro (!)
  • Ik ga dus als een gek 20 truien breien voor (31-12-2015)
  • Ook al redden we het uiteindelijke doel niet, voor elke €12 die ingelegd wordt, kunnen we al één kind gelukkig maken.

De andere kant

Samen kunnen wij iets betekenen voor deze kinderen wat we zelf waarschijnlijk nooit nodig hebben gehad, zij zullen niet een goede nieuwe trui dragen zoals jij en ik, tenzij iemand ze hiermee helpt. Samen kunnen wij dit gaan doen!

We zullen iedereen op de hoogte houden van de ontwikkelingen en foto's van de truien op social media plaatsen!

Ik doe dit naar aanleiding van deze campagne:

https://www.facebook.com/events/1621593808053790/
story_txt:
Kinderen in Kenia hebben (school)truien nodig!  Mijn naam is Frouwke Jager, ik ben heel erg goed in het breien van leuke dingen voor mijn familie en kennissen en doe dit altijd met plezier. Nu zag ik de actie voorbij komen van stichting Eboo waarmee ik met mijn talent andere mensen kan helpen die veel behoefte hebben aan zoiets simpels als een trui. Het is nu zo dat ik niet over de middelen beschik om al het benodigde materiaal te kopen, dus wil ik met u de afspraak maken om de inleg te verdelen, u doet een bijdrage voor minimaal 1 trui en ik ga hem breien, zo helpen we allebei een beetje! Samen zorgen wij er dan voor dat kinderen in Kenia gewoon naar school kunnen, in hun (verplichte) uniform en dat ze een kwalitatief goede trui hebben waar ze lang mee vooruit kunnen.
   We zijn 240 Euro nodig om 20 truien te maken.  Per trui slechts 12 Euro (!) Ik ga dus als een gek 20 truien breien voor (31-12-2015) Ook al redden we het uiteindelijke doel niet, voor elke €12 die ingelegd wordt, kunnen we al één kind gelukkig maken.    De andere kant Samen kunnen wij iets betekenen voor deze kinderen wat we zelf waarschijnlijk nooit nodig hebben gehad, zij zullen niet een goede nieuwe trui dragen zoals jij en ik, tenzij iemand ze hiermee helpt. Samen kunnen wij dit gaan doen!
We zullen iedereen op de hoogte houden van de ontwikkelingen en foto's van de truien op social media plaatsen!   Ik doe dit naar aanleiding van deze campagne:

https://www.facebook.com/events/1621593808053790/

story:
The Carter Foundation

On February 7, 2015 my water broke. I was only 19 weeks pregnant. Despite overwhelming pressure from my medical team, I refused to "terminate the pregnancy." I made it all the way to 23 weeks pregnant and I went into labor. The hospital refused to stop my labor, My son was born on March 3, 2015 and died minutes after his birth. I kept a blog throughout the entire ordeal, and I wrote a letter to my son every day. My goal is to start a non-profit organization that focuses on assisting families that are dealing with infant or child loss, and to fund research to help babies survive at earlier gestational ages. Please consider making a donation for all of the little babies of the world.

A Little More Detail

To expand upon what I stated above, my goal is to assist families that are grieving the loss of an infant or child. No family should have to worry about how they are going to pay for their child's funeral. No family should have to settle for a cheap coffin because they simply don't have the money for a nicer one more befitting their angel. That is where we want to come in. But more than that, we would like to fund research into developing even smaller intubation tubes to attempt to save these angels' lives at gestational ages that aren't possible at this time because the neonatologists simply don't have tubes small enough.

The Impact

No family should ever have to face the loss of their infant or child. It is a pain that cannot be described. I know, because I lost my son. I want to be able to have a hand in preventing other women from experiencing the same pain. I need for my son's life to have meant something to the world, because his life meant the world to me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate (and I understand that sometimes you just can't!) please consider visiting my blog (it is ad supported) and sharing this on your Facebook, Twitter, or via email. The more people that see this, the better chance we have of meeting our goal. Thank you so much for reading this.

HopeForLittleBabies.com

story:
Where albino body parts fetch big money, albinos still get butchered

In East Africa, people born without pigment in their skin are thought to possess special powers, but not in a good way. Superstitions feed myths that albinos are ghosts, sorcerers or demons who have been cursed and, when hunted and killed for body parts, bring good luck to others.

As a result, many people with albinism are living in abject fear. Some no longer dare to go outside, and children with albinism have stopped attending school.

Albinos in Tanzania and Malawi are at an increased risk. Already this year, some have been kidnapped, dismembered and turned over to witch doctors. Some suspect it may only get worse.

The United Nations believes the recent surge in attacks may be associated with the upcoming elections, as politicians have been known to seek out seers who use albinos’ body parts to predict the future. They think it will improve their chances on election day. In the past, politicians have been suspected of playing a part in the murders.

A complete set of body parts from an albino, including “all four limbs, genitals, ears, tongue and nose,” can bring in up to $75,000 on the black market, according to a report by the International Red Cross.

For years, superstitions have incited ritual attacks against albinos. Witch doctors use their body parts in potions to bring good fortune to those who are willing to pay for it, according to the U.N. Human Rights Council. “Some even believe that the witchcraft ritual is more powerful if the victim screams during the amputation, so body parts are often cut from live victims, especially children,” the report said. 

In Malawi, an 11-year-old girl was kidnapped by her uncle, who was told he could get $6,500 for her body, according to the U.N. commission. That same month, two other albino children were abducted, and a 68-year-old woman was found dead and dismembered. Six attacks have been reported this year in the country.

Eight attacks have been reported in Tanzania since last fall. In December, a young albino girl went missing and was never found. In February, a 1-year-old albino boy was taken from his home and, days later, his body was found with the arms and legs severed. Earlier this month, police reported a 6-year-old was attacked in his home while he was sleeping. His mother was hacked with machetes, and the boy’s hand was cut off.

WE NEED YOUR HELP NOW

We are trying to raise $5M to assist the Albinos of East Africa in the following ways:

  • Money for Modern Prostheses for the Amputee Survivors.
  • Funding for Physical Therapy for Amputee Survivors.
  • Funding for Relocation to Safe Havens.
  • Funding for Assistance Grants to Acquire Job Skills.
  • Funding for Orphans and Widows who have lost Family.
  • Funding for Shelter Homes to House the Victims.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please get the word out that PEOPLE DON'T EAT PEOPLE!

story:
Help us build minimalist Roman Legionary themed training facilities!
 
Our mission is to educate people in the art of lifestyle simplicity, building camaraderie, and focusing on health and fitness. 

 

Have you ever been a part of a great team and felt that sense of bonding with your fellow participants, but when you left you found yourself wanting more?  Does the need to belong to something great still resonate within you? 

If this is you, then you have found a home in the Legionary Code community. A place where experiences and friendship are built and valued.

Come join us in rebuilding the glory of Rome, make lifelong friends, learn new skills and get fit.  Simplify your life the Roman Legionary way and focus on experiences over consumerism and commercialism. 

                                                     <-- Our Goal -->

Our initial goal is to acquire land and purchase building material for a Legionary Code Outpost.  As we gather more funding, we will fortify our positions and expand to new locations. We are starting near Houston, Texas, but plan to expand and grow the empire.  We will build it, so you can come!

We are a veteran owned and operated non-profit with a 501(c)(3) designation, so all contributions come with a tax write-off. 

 

Legionary Posts will have ranges for archery, javelin, siege equipment, pioneering projects, and much more.  Are you training for an obstacle course race?  Come train as you will fight with us. 

 

We will teach engineering and building techniques to build our posts and equipment for the ranges; fostering engineering knowledge with practical projects helps to build skills that can be used to transform our communities.

 

  

 All donations will go toward acquiring land and building materials for the Legionary Posts to further practical education, unconventional amateur sports and all around fitness.  

 

This is all possible with your help.  Please donate today!

Vis et Veneratio

 
Special thanks to Mariusz Kozik for allowing us to use his art!

story:
THE FUNDRAISER WAS SUCCESSFUL, BUT NOT THROUGH INDIEGOGO. WE RECEIVED A PRIVATE CONTRIBUTION OF 100 000 SEK FROM A DONOR THAT WISHED TO REMAIN ANONYMOUS.

WE THANK EVERYONE THAT MADE THIS EVENT A GREAT ONE AND FIRST OF IT'S KIND


Cannabis.se | Svenska premiären av The Culture High


Swedish screening of The Culture High with special guest Adam Scorgie + ongoing fundraiser for "Mary & I"

Wally Johnson is a Swedish comedian, actor/film maker and cannabis activist that decided to make a first of it's kind documentary on the impact the criminalization of cannabis has had on Swedish society. 



Sweden has always been well know to the rest of the world as a progressive, forward nation, bound to protect human rights and fight injustice on all aspects of life. Yet, Sweden harbours one of the most repressive and destructive drug policies in the Western world. With that comes a stigma and an entire society that is brainwashed into "Reefer Madness" maners and also ignorantly proud of their lack of knowledge when it comes to drugs. 

Cannabis is still considered a slippery slope to heroine addiction in Sweden and even with harsh fines and potential prison time for soft drugs, such as cannabis,  Sweden still has roughly 500 drug related deaths annually and a current spice (synthetic cannabis) epidemic. A direct result of the Swedish criminalization of cannabis.

Sweden, a nation of 9,5 million inhabitants has roughly the same amount of heroin addicts as The Netherlands (ca, 17 million), even though The Netherlands has one of the more liberal drug laws in the world. How is that possible?



Wally Johnson is hoping to do with Mary & I, what Adam Scorgie did with award winning The Union and the critically acclaimed The Culture High . 

As part of Mary & I, Wally received the honour of flying Adam Scorgie over to screen his movie in Malmö, Sweden April 19th, 2015. This is an exclusive visit that will be part of Wally's documentary to raise awareness of the effects prohibition has had on Sweden. The event will be open for everyone to attend, though seats will be limited.

"Mary & I " go to World Cannabis Conferences Indiegogo campaign

As explained in Wally's previous (and successful) fundraiser, because of the stigma cannabis has in Swedish society, Wally has not been able to find any traditional funding for Mary & I. Institutions finding loop holes to not support "A Hippie project" and production companies loving the idea, but being afraid to lose future gigs because of affiliation with a "weed movie". So far the documentary has been sponsored merely by Wally's own funds and now recently, the successful Indiegogo fundraiser. 

Stuck between a rock and a hard place, Wally decided to take a page out of Scorgie's book and also make a fund raiser. Wally is once again, humbly, seeking your support to keep pushing this documentary forward. 

Your support is incredibly valuable to us! <3

By donating to this cause, you will be directly responsible of funding two very important aspects of this project.

                      


Out of the $8000, roughly $5000 will go towards securing  Adam Scorgie's visit, Q&A and screening of The Culture High. That includes travel & accommodation for Adam to Malmö from Calgary. That also includes us renting a theater that can host 100-200 people. Equipment + staff so we can record and live stream the event. Of course, part of those funds will go towards travel and accommodation for our other guests that will be attending the panel discussion. 

Moderator: Ehsan Noroozi, (journalist, Stora Radiopriset)


So far, these guests has confirmed their attendance.

- Ted Goldberg (Sociologist and author of "Legalisera Narkotika?")


- Jens Waldmann (Tattoo artist and convicted medicinal cannabis grower)



- Annika Rosengren (Chairman of the Swedish Drug Users Union/Svenska Brukarföreningens Anhöriga)


- Nelly Mathilda Fredlund (Cannalisörerna)


- Danielle Wendin (Leende Bravaden, Whatever Floats Our Boat)


- Khodr Mehri (Danish cannabis activist)


And of course, Wally Johnson.

THE SECOND important part you will be funding, is the ongoing production costs of Mary & I until Wally manages to secure a producer. Costs such as travel, accomodation, video recording & editing, merchandise, web building and of course: marketing

Perks! So many sexy, cool perks! 

This time around we will offer a bunch of unique, cool perks. These perks will be available, to different extent, all until the end of April!

Perk examples.

$10 A personalized ”Mary & I” profile picture, with YOUR name that you can proudly display on Facebook to show that you supported this event and the documentary!


$50 Signed (optional) ”Mary & I” t-shirt


$140 Personalized Mary & I hoodie with YOUR name, embroidered on it. 


$160 Special edition, signed by Adam Scorgie, embroidered The Culture High hoodie. Available in all Nordic flag colours, including Scania and Christiania!

ALLA MINA KAMRATER PODCAST PERK
A visit to "Alla Mina Kamrater" podcast could catapult the documentary in such way as it could attract potential investors and of course create more interest and hype for a movie that a lot of people want to see. 




The fundraiser will continue until the end of April, so please keep donating.

We're really coming up slightly short here in order to not seem greedy, we appreciate EVERYONE'S hard earned money and support. Thus not wanting to come off as money mongers, $8000 will bring us just to the next level. We want to make it clear that you're not just GIVING us money, we are WORKING for your money.  

Your donations are appreciated and incredibly important. This fundraiser will continue even after the April 19th (Adam's visit) so please keep donating beyond his visit by continuing buying perks.

Risks & Challenges

No matter what, we will bring Adam over here for a screening of The Culture High. 65% of the $8000 will be enough, however in order to make the best out of Adam's visit, Wally needs to be able to pay his camera crew in order to incorporate that material into the documentary. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the living crap out of this fundraiser link, please! Thank you in advance!

Leende Bravaden
Avkriminalisera Cannabis
Svenska Brukarföreningen
Fria Fröet
Cannalisörerna
