story:
Hello everyone,


My name is Kevin Anglade. I am the Founder/CEO of a small publishing press called Flowered Concrete. As a publisher, we release and publish the works of many up-and-coming authors (including myself) that write in many various genres such as mystery, thriller, drama, detective fiction, graphic novelty and many, many more!

The reason behind this campaign is to provide the opportunity for my fellow team members and myself to make an appearance at the book festival which will be the first inaugural festival of its kind in the borough of Queens which already has a diverse population and as well as a vibrant multi-cultural presence.

To those of you that are able to contribute to this campaign, you would be helping out in an enormous kind of way.

Firstly, your financial assistance would allow us the great opportunity in exhibiting at the book festival.

Secondly, it would allow us to showcase our company and as well as make book lovers aware of our Flowered Concrete brand.

If there is one thing that I have learned while upstarting and running this company over the past three years is that building a fan base or an awareness for a brand is hard, and so, I honestly feel as if with the help of you guys, you can help us get there by giving us that extra push that we so desperately need. The most important aspect of our publishing press is that we are attempting to not only entertain and captivate the minds of our potential readers, but it is also our greatest of hopes that we will educate them as well. Basically, Flowered Concrete is trying to change young lives with literature one human being at a time and so what better way in getting there by possibly having a chance in attending the first ever Queens Book Festival at Citi Field in New York City?!!

Find us online at http://www.floweredconcrete.net for more info on who we are and what we do as a small publishing press. If you aren't sure then, you can also visit our blog at http://www.floweredconcrete.com



What We Need & What You Get


  • For this festival, we need $1,000 dollars in order to find ourselves as participating exhibitors at this event. First and foremost, $750 of the dollars earned will be allocated to our event registration fees which includes:

One (1) 10 x 10 E-Z UP White Tent

One (1) Table: 8' Banquet (30"x96") (without linen) w/ 2 Chairs

Secondly, $200 dollars will go towards the creation and printing of a booth banner with company logo and as well as I.D. passes for me and my fellow team members.

Lastly, the final $50 dollars will go towards our parking fees/passes for the day. Although we are a small publisher, we plan on bringing our fair share of books to the book festival, therefore, it is imperative that we are able to have reserved parking in order for us to carry our loads of promotional materials to this event.

  • Everyone that participates and makes any sort of contribution (whether big or small) will be receiving signed free copies of our books throughout the remainder of the year. One of our authors by the name of Kevin Eleven will be releasing his second detective fiction novel (currently untitled) this summer in July, therefore, what better way to show our thanks during our book launch than to provide you all with autographed copies of his new book for FREE?!

  • Also, everyone who contributes will also be sent free downloads of short-stories and other bonuses courtesy of Flowered Concrete and in December, our very own Alton Taylor is releasing a noir crime-thriller of his own called "Yelloworld". Therefore, to wrap up the year, everyone that participates in this fundraising campaign, will also receive free e-book copies of that novel as WELL!!!

  • Now there is a great possibility that we may find ourselves unable to reach our goal and if we don't, the $1,000 of funds provided by you all will still be put towards the book festival and the remainder of what's needed will be split in four equal ways between me and my remaining team members:
Kevin Anglade (Me) (Founder/CEO/Publisher)
Mia Hill (Public Relations/Media)
Alton Taylor (Lead Art Director)
Roy Diaz (Videographer)


The Impact


  • We feel as if this project is valuable towards you, the contributor and as well as the world because it is important to sustain and grow healthy readers/thinkers that will one day grow up to help leave the world in a much better way than which it was found.
  • Through literacy and cultivating imagination, readers will be able to succeed in life as they realize their actual potential while reaching for greatness in whatever it is that moves them within their daily lives. Therefore, it can only happen if we all pitch in for this to actually come into fruition.

  • We know that many may view this campaign as a plea for money that will aid in sparking a "big break" or a big-time gimmick in seeking attention for quick changed fame, however, this is most certainly NOT the case!!! Flowered Concrete (the name of our publishing press) is a metaphor within itself. The name equates to growing literature one rose at a time. The "rose" that we are speaking of metaphorically is YOU, the human being. Therefore, for any and everyone that is exposed to our literature, we are growing literature, expanding minds and also changing the world one reader (human being) at a time.

Risks & Challenges

  • There is a possibility that we may face obstacles and challenges along the way. For example, there is a strong chance in that we are able to attend the book festival and somehow it does not end up being the success that we thought it could be.
  • For example, people may not want to engage themselves in conversation with us or they may find us flat-out uninteresting and boring (although here at Flowered Concrete, we are ANYTHING BUT BORING!! Check out our YouTube channel to see for yourselves).
  •  Also, there is a possibility that we may not be able to make money off of our materials (books, posters, artworks). However, what qualifies us to overcome these hurdles is that we have hosted other events in which we've sold our books or partook in showcases that allowed us to sell our books and as well as pitched our brand. However, those did not work to our favor as we would have hoped they would.
  • Therefore, going forward, we plan on solving and overcoming these past hurdles by being in attendance at the book festival itself!!! If there is one thing that I can say about our past trials and attempts at attending fairs or festivals is that we have never sold or appeared in any place as prestigious as an ACTUAL book festival!! Also, the attendance of families with teens and kids is perfect for our company as the youth are our target audience. If there is one thing that I can definitely say is that we have never gotten the chance to display our works in front of youth, therefore, the Queens Book Festival would be a great attempt at exhibiting an succeeding!!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • For those of you that can't make a monetary contribution, just even spreading the word about this campaign would mean so much to us!
  • Also, if you think our campaign is worthy enough of a possible contribution, please be sure to use the sharing tools on our campaign's page and as well as this site in order to increase the awareness of the campaign itself. The Queens Book Festival takes place on Saturday, June 20th, 2015, and we are hoping that you all will partake in helping us get there.

Find Us Online At:

www.floweredconcrete.net (Website)
www.floweredconcrete.com (Blog)
www.facebook.com/FloweredConcrete (Facebook)
www.twitter.com/floweredlit (twitter)
www.instagram.com/floweredconcrete (instagram)
Google + & YouTube: Flowered Concrete

- Flowered Concrete

"Dream for Anything, Reach for Everything"
story_txt:
Hello everyone, 

My name is Kevin Anglade. I am the Founder/CEO of a small publishing press called Flowered Concrete. As a publisher, we release and publish the works of many up-and-coming authors (including myself) that write in many various genres such as mystery, thriller, drama, detective fiction, graphic novelty and many, many more! 
The reason behind this campaign is to provide the opportunity for my fellow team members and myself to make an appearance at the book festival which will be the first inaugural festival of its kind in the borough of Queens which already has a diverse population and as well as a vibrant multi-cultural presence.
To those of you that are able to contribute to this campaign, you would be helping out in an enormous kind of way. 
Firstly, your financial assistance would allow us the great opportunity in exhibiting at the book festival. 
Secondly, it would allow us to showcase our company and as well as make book lovers aware of our Flowered Concrete brand.
If there is one thing that I have learned while upstarting and running this company over the past three years is that building a fan base or an awareness for a brand is hard, and so, I honestly feel as if with the help of you guys, you can help us get there by giving us that extra push that we so desperately need. The most important aspect of our publishing press is that we are attempting to not only entertain and captivate the minds of our potential readers, but it is also our greatest of hopes that we will educate them as well. Basically, Flowered Concrete is trying to change young lives with literature one human being at a time and so what better way in getting there by possibly having a chance in attending the first ever Queens Book Festival at Citi Field in New York City?!!
Find us online at http://www.floweredconcrete.net for more info on who we are and what we do as a small publishing press. If you aren't sure then, you can also visit our blog at http://www.floweredconcrete.com 

   What We Need & What You Get   For this festival, we need $1,000 dollars in order to find ourselves as participating exhibitors at this event. First and foremost, $750 of the dollars earned will be allocated to our event registration fees which includes: 


One (1) 10 x 10 E-Z UP White TentOne (1) Table: 8' Banquet (30"x96") (without linen) w/ 2 ChairsSecondly, $200 dollars will go towards the creation and printing of a booth banner with company logo and as well as I.D. passes for me and my fellow team members.Lastly, the final $50 dollars will go towards our parking fees/passes for the day. Although we are a small publisher, we plan on bringing our fair share of books to the book festival, therefore, it is imperative that we are able to have reserved parking in order for us to carry our loads of promotional materials to this event.Everyone that participates and makes any sort of contribution (whether big or small) will be receiving signed free copies of our books throughout the remainder of the year. One of our authors by the name of Kevin Eleven will be releasing his second detective fiction novel (currently untitled) this summer in July, therefore, what better way to show our thanks during our book launch than to provide you all with autographed copies of his new book for FREE?! 


Also, everyone who contributes will also be sent free downloads of short-stories and other bonuses courtesy of Flowered Concrete and in December, our very own Alton Taylor is releasing a noir crime-thriller of his own called "Yelloworld". Therefore, to wrap up the year, everyone that participates in this fundraising campaign, will also receive free e-book copies of that novel as WELL!!!

 Now there is a great possibility that we may find ourselves unable to reach our goal and if we don't, the $1,000 of funds provided by you all will still be put towards the book festival and the remainder of what's needed will be split in four equal ways between me and my remaining team members:

story:
Benefiting: Janata Higher Secondary School and Shree Sundar Suryodaya lower Secondary School.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/janata/

Although it has been only 2 weeks since the massive 7.8 Richter scale earthquake hit Nepal, the area was jolted by another devastating M 7.3 quake east of Kathmandu. One of the hardest hit is the Kavre district, located close to the capital city of Kathmandu. The first deadly Himalayan earthquake took more than 8000 lives, and the death toll is still increasing. Thousands have been injured resulting loss of their loved ones. This campaign is not to talk about the destruction that earthquake has made but to especially conduct an effort towards rebuilding remote public schools.

Our purpose is to raise adequate donation for rebuild the two Public School (from where we graduated) in Hokse Bazar which is completely demolished due to massive earthquake. Hokse is a small village in Kavrepalanchok, Nepal located in 51KM (32 Miles) East of Kathmandu Valley (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hokse_Bazar). More than 1,500 students are affected due to the aftermath created by the earthquake. The currently planned fiscal goal is not adequate to reestablish the infrastructure completely, therefore we believe it may light up the spirit of the poor children, teachers and their parents. A small contribution can also play a vital role in a big situation like this. An achievement of further smaller goals can be a greatest attempt in accomplishing the bigger goal.

Just to provide perspective on overall destruction on village – The devastating earthquake of 7.8 magnitude followed by countless aftershock (less than 7.8 magnitude) resulted about 5,000 casualties and 1,000 residents to be demolished. As the Monsoon season is on its way, all the earthquake victims currently enduring on the street must walk through a very challenging situation.

Since the first earthquake struck, we have been aiding the community disaster management team in our village to provide an immediate relief.  At this point we truly believe it is time to start the rebuilding process. The public school is one of the area which needs to be addressed soon. If not large number of students will be out of school without proper education.

Therefore, at this point All your donation, small or large, can make a huge difference on poor Kid's life.  Every dollar, every penny will be hugely appreciated.  

We will assure that all the donation collected will be directly transfer to the affected school. We will be continually informing all the donor about the rebuilding effort. Also, we will keep updating the difference you made in people’s lives with your Small Donation.

Please feel free to contact us if you have any queries regarding rebuilding effort.

Thank You

story:
Together, we’ve achieved what no other US development program has.

60 wins a year on average, for the past five years

12 US Junior National Championship Titles

15 riders named to the World Championships (the most of any junior team)

14 top-10 finishes in World Cups and the World Championships

And the first US Junior Woman ever to win a World Cup.

The Whole Athlete Development Program has created an undeniable momentum in producing top-level US riders and shown that it can identify and nurture the next generation of world-class professionals. It’s time for the next step in our evolution as a team. We’d like for you to join us.

A Winning Partnership

The team is a non-profit program of the Velo Development Foundation, a 501(c)(3) charitable organization. Donations to the Velo Development Foundation are tax-deductible. Contact your tax advisor to determine the full benefits of your gift.

Our Mission

A Junior/U23 development program, the Whole Athlete/Specialized Team has a simple mission: to invest in the future of our youth and the sport of cycling by developing young athletes at the regional, national, and international levels with dedication, integrity, and fun.

Racing by the Numbers

Each year, our talented riders compete at the highest levels of the sport both nationally and internationally. This kind of commitment takes resources and we are deeply grateful to the many sponsors who have supported us. But we need your help to take it to the next level.

Corporate sponsorship contributions make up roughly 30% of the team budget. The other 70% comes from the generosity of individuals like you.

Here's a breakdown of how our budget is distributed:

28% Race event expenses
25% Mechanics/ Staff
20% Travel scholarships/ Coaching
20% Equipment & Team Clothing
4% Admin
3% Media/ Promotion 

The Next Step

The cost of event participation is ever increasing, especially as our athletes gain international success. Additional funding will allow us to hire an additional staff member and provide greater support to the athletes who need it most.  We are at a crossroads given our budget limitations. 

And what if we fundraise above our current target? The next step would be to provide more opportunities for U23 riders trying to bridge the gap between the elite Junior ranks and a Professional career.  In addition, we would like to offer more development camps for riders throughout the US.

Please consider a gift to support elite junior development in 2015 and beyond. Your investment in the future of cycling will help nurture the next generation of US talent.

Thank you!

story:
Update:

Although our campaign is officially closed, it is still possible to donate to our cause!  Please contact harry.choee@dugsischolars.org for more details.  Thanks for your support!

What is Dugsi Scholars?

Dugsi (pronounced DOOG-see) is the Somali word for a traditional schoolhouse, literally translating to "shelter from the wind."

In a country racked with political and social instability, Dugsi Scholars strives to empower Somali high school students who are dedicated to their communities.  We hope to provide these students access to quality colleges and universities around the world.

We believe that education is a key pathway to developing Somalia's future.  Since the civil war and subsequent collapse of state, Somali higher education has suffered from a variety of factors: infrastructural problems, poor funding, and understaffing, among others.

This summer, Dugsi Scholars will be hosting its inaugural seminar program in Hargeisa, Somaliland.  Fifteen Somali students will participate in a residential program that will familiarize them with international college application processes, prepare them for college, and critically engage them about the meaning of leadership and community membership. After the summer, the Dugsi Scholars team will engage in long-distance mentorship with these students as they continue their journey as students, college applicants, and citizens.

How will the funds be used?

The money we raise will go towards the following expenses

  • Airfare and lodging for 6 mentors
  • Logistics when in Somaliland
  • Utility costs and boarding for 15 students
  • Advertising and fundraising
  • Books and other curriculum related material

Our Curriculum:

The Dugsi Scholars curriculum has three major goals.  

1.  Educate students on international college systems and the application processes.

2.  Familiarize students with the academic rigor of a college environment.

3.  Empower students to contribute to their own communities. 

Camp participants will be entering the eleventh grade.  We believe this is the ideal age to introduce students to alternative options for their higher education. Students will have time to shape their pivotal years in high school, in accordance with their personal goals. The bulk of our work lies in orienting students to have options for higher education outside of Somalia.

Our four-week residence program relies on a on a discussion-based seminar model to better facilitate dialogue between students.  Our curriculum centers around the theme of community membership and leadership.  We hope to explore what it really means to serve one's community.  Daily discussion will revolve around a diverse reading list heavily influenced by Afrocentric writers.  We will also provide individual mentoring services during and after the residential program.  The college application process is a journey we will take step by step with our students, as we develop strong relationships with the next generation of Somali youth.

Other ways to help:

Spread the word! You can share this page, our website, as well as our Facebook and Twitter pages below.

story:
Hi everyone!!

Our names are Alessia, Lauren, Olivia and Ellarie and over our spring break this March we all traveled to The Exuma Islands in The Bahamas. On our trip, we met a 19 year old young man named Axel Goodman known as “AJ”. AJ works as a bartender at the Chat 'N' Chill, a restaurant and bar on Stocking Island (see picture in our photo gallery).

One day, while we were ordering lunch at Chat 'N' Chill, we noticed a sign (see picture in our photo gallery) that immediately caught all of our attention. The sign said that AJ had been accepted to Toronto Airways flight school starting Fall, 2015. The problem is that AJ cannot attend flight school without raising $40,000 by this August, 2015. AJ has already raised $25,000 and still needs to raise $15,000.

AJ was born in Nassau, Bahamas and moved to The Exumas when he was about 9 years old to be closer to his grandparents who live on the island. Since grade 5, AJ has held many different jobs in order to have his own spending money for necessities such as school supplies.

AJ has been working at the Chat 'N' Chill since he graduated from L.N. Coakley High School in the Spring of 2014. He works alongside his older sister Kendra. He also has a younger brother and sister.

AJ knew he wanted to become a pilot ever since he was 13, when his mom’s friend, who was a pilot, started bringing him on his sea plane around the island. He fell in love with flying and dreamed of one day becoming a commercial airline pilot for Bahamasair.

AJ has big dreams for the future. Even though his main goal is to become a pilot, he hopes to do something bigger later on incorporating his two passions. AJ is a great cook and one day hopes to customize a airplane and turn it into a restaurant in the sky.

We believe in AJ and hope you will too. AJ knows that going to Toronto for school by himself when he has never been to Canada before is a big step yet he is prepared and has a plan. After graduating from the year and a half flight program, he already has a job set up with Porter Airlines in Toronto.

All monies raised on Indiegogo will be in an account payable directly to the flight school for AJ’s tuition. Any donation small or large will help AJ’s dream come true!!

story:
Well groomed. Well read.™ | BarbershopBooks.org

More than 85% of black male 4th graders in the United States are not reading on grade level.

Reading proficiency is an essential skill for success in the 21st Century. Children spend their first few years of school learning to read and around 3rd grade, students begin reading to learn. Students who are not proficient in reading by 4th grade struggle academically and are much less likely to graduate from high school. 

The Challenge

A disproportionately high percentage of black children live in book deserts, where libraries, bookstores, and reading material at home are scarce. In some poverty stricken communities there are as few as one age appropriate book for every 300 children.

Few diverse books are published each year that reflect the culture and reading interests of African American children, especially boys. Adding to these challenges, many early childhood classrooms do not incorporate black boys' reading preferences and too few teachers are responsive to young black boys' individual learning needs.

Far too many black men are missing during the critical period for reading acquisition (pre-K to grade 3). Less than 2% of U.S. teachers are black males and a majority of black boys live with single-mothers.  Black men’s absence from black boys' early reading experiences is significant. Recent social psychology research demonstrates that encouragement and modeling from relevant same-sex role models can improve a one's attitude, perceptions, and confidence.  

Young black boys' current reading attitudes, behavior, or ability are not fixed, but malleable and highly susceptible to positive influences - Barbershop Books is proof.

An Innovative Solution 

Barbershop Books is a community-based literacy program that creates child-friendly reading spaces in barbershops for boys ages 4-8. This innovative program works to improve boys' access to engaging books and increase the amount of time boys read for fun. 

Unlike literacy programs based in schools, libraries, or community organizations, Barbershops Books brings children’s books into a male centered environment. It connects barbers and parents to the early reading experiences of young boys in a positive and culturally meaningful way. Currently, we have reading spaces in  six NYC barbershops, reaching more than 240 boys annually.


A window decal at the entrance of participating barbershops reminds patrons about the children's books inside. Each reading space includes a colorful 2 ft by 2ft book sling filled with 15 curated titles that appeal to boys, especially reluctant readers. The book sling is prominently displayed near a seating area and in large shops, the reading space includes a small bright-yellow chair.  The books used for the program change annually and  target boys ages 4 to 8 for two main reasons: (1) this age range represents a critical period for reading acquisition and (2) barbershop observations revealed that young boys are most likely to engage with books in a barbershop setting. Older boys and men are usually on cell phones, watching TV, or talking to other guys in the shop. 

Barbershop Books in the Press

         

        


#FundBarbershopBooks - Perks


$10 - BB Suporter: 

  • Includes website credit. Your name will be added to http://barbershopbooks.org/supporters to 

$25 - Book Buddy Package:

  • Includes website credit
  • Two-sided Barbershop Books Bookmark (Give a child their first bookmark)
  • Barbershop Books Comb 

$50 - Book Advocate Package:

You receive the previous perks  (see above) + more cool stuff:

  • Barbershop Books T-shirt


$80 - Book Superstar Package:

You receive the previous perks  (see above) + more cool stuff:

  • Book mention: your name will be listed as a donor inside one children's book in a Barbershop Books reading spaces 
  • $5 off a haircut at Harlem Masters Barbershop (NYC)

$100 - Book Champion Package:

You receive the previous perks  (see above) + even more cool stuff:

  • In addition to helping children read, Barbershop Books Founder, Alvin Irby, is a professional comedian. He's signing 200 copies of his comedy album. Get a copy before they run out.

$250 - Reading Advocate Package:

You receive the previous perks  (see above) + even more amazing stuff:

  • Frederick Benjamin Invigorating Cleanser Shampoo  
  • Frederick Benjamin Invigorating Moisturizer Conditioner 

$500 - Reading Superstar Package:

You receive the previous perks  (see above) + more fabulous perks:

  • Frederick Benjamin Full Line: Invigorating Cleanser Shampoo, Invigorating Moisturizer Conditioner, Daily Hydrator Styling Creme, Sleek Water Pomade

$1000 - Reading Champion Package:

You receive the previous perks  (see above) + even more fabulous perks:

  • Bevel 5-part shaving system: Bevel Brush and Bevel Razor + 1 Month Supply of: Bevel Blades (20), Bevel Priming Oil, Bevel Shave Cream, and Bevel Restoring Balm 

The Impact

Easy access to reading materials, regardless of children’s reading ability, increases the amount of time children read for fun. This campaign will help create 100 reading spaces in barbershop across America this year. Making culturally relevant, age appropriate, and gender responsive books easily accessible for black boys has an immediate positive impact on their reading behavior (boys read in the barbershop for 10-30 minutes while they wait for a haircut). 

Research from the U.S. Department of Education shows that students who read for fun once or twice a month have significantly higher reading scores than students who never or hardly ever read for fun. The one to two trips that many young black boys make to the barbershop each month can lead to significant reading gains. 

Origin Story

One day  Alvin Irby, the creator of Barbershop Books, was getting a haircut in a barbershop across the street from PS 69, the elementary school in the Bronx where Mr. Irby taught 1st grade. A few minutes into his haircut, one of his 1st graders walked into the barbershop and plopped down on a sofa. The 7-year-old boy stared out the barbershop's large window for 10 minutes with a bored look on his face and then he began running around the shop. As he watched the boy's antsy behavior, Mr. Irby thought to himself, “He really should be practicing his reading right now. I wish I had a children's book with me for him to read.” It was at this moment back in the spring of 2009 that the idea for Barbershop Books was born.

How Will Your Donation Be Used?

Your donation will help Barbershop Books create the inventory we need to distribute 100 reading spaces to barbershops, reaching approximately 4,000 boys. 
  • 6000 engaging children's books (initial book set + replacement books)
  • 100 colorful book slings
  • 100 large Barbershop Books posters
  • 100 Barbershop Books window decals
  • Packaging (outside NYC)
  • Shipping (outside NYC)
We will select barbershops in NYC and in other U.S. cities throughout the United States in which to implement Barbershop Books this year. Please visit our website to recommend barbershops in your community. 

$100,000 Stretch Goal

Once we reach $100,000, we will be able to distribute 200 reading spaces to barbershops, reaching approximately 8000 boys.  

What We Need to Scale Nationally 

Measuring Program Outcomes

Initially, Barbershop Books will track the number of reading spaces we create annually in barbershops to determine how our program is impacting black boys' access to age-appropriate books. 

Once we secure additional funding, we will develop a Barbershop Books mobile app that gamifies reading for boys, making it fun and competitive. This innovative app will incentivize children to engage with books and allow them to digitally track the books they read. Interested mobile app and game developers, coders, or software engineers, please contact us to get involved. 

The Barbershop Books app will produce actionable data about boys' book preferences and reading behavior that will help us to continually improve our program. 


7 WAYS TO HELP

1. Make a donation.  Your financial support will provide us the essential start up capital we need to grow and to bring Barbershop Books to your community. 

2. Recommend to bring Barbershop Books to your town or city. Click here to  recommend a local barbershop in your community. Also, don't forget to shout out your local barbershop and town or city in our comments section. 

3. Tell a friend or family  member. It truly takes a village to provide children with the support they need to be healthy and productive adults. Sharing the Barbershop Books indiegogo campaign can help bring Barbershop Books to your community. Share this short link: http://igg.me/at/barbershopbooks 

4. Connect with us on social media. Follow @BarbershopBooks on twitter and Instagram as well as like Barbershop Books on facebook. 

5. Share your favorite children's book. What was your favorite children's book? Is there a book your child forces you to read again and again? We are always looking for great books. Visit barbershopbooks.org  to recommend a book. 

6. Read our education blog.  We have lots to say about how to inspire children to read and learn. Our blog,Teaching Paraphernalia, offers practical reading-related tips and books recommendations for parents and educators. 

7. Inspire black boys to be life-long readers.  Take the boys in your life to a library. Purchase them books. Make time regularly to read to them. 

Answers For Your Questions

Can I write-off my contribution to Barbershop Books on my taxes?                

Yes.

Who took those amazing barbershop photos?                                                    

NYC-based photographer Kristine Brown took the barbershop photos featured in our campaign.

How much money from the campaign will actually be used for reading spaces in barbershops?            

With the exception of the Indiegogo-related fees, every dollar will be used for Barbershop Books reading spaces in barbershops.

What payment methods do you accept?                                                                

Indigogo accepts major credit cards.

Can I donate from outside the USA?                                                                      

Yes! 

When will my perk be delivered?                                                                                

We estimate that shipping will begin no later than July 2014.

Can I make a contribution over $10,000?                                                              

Yes. If you are interested in making a large contribution, please contact Barbershop Books at champion@readingholidayproject.org. We’ll connect you with a specialist at Indiegogo who will assist you.

Is shipping included for the perks? 

Yes, but international shipping costs more, so we provide add a little extra to your donation.

Is Barbershop Books a 501(c)(3) organization? 

Barbershop Books is the first program created and implemented by Reading Holiday Project, Inc., a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt literacy organization based in New York City.

I am a celebrity or public figure and I would like to endorse Barbershop Books. 

Please contact Alvin Irby.

Is Barbershop Books international?

Not at this time, but we look forward to growing. We welcome opportunities to collaborate with literacy advocates throughout the U.S. and around the world. We look forward to the day when all children read for fun.

My question wasn't answered here. Where can I get additional information?

Please feel free contact us at barbershopbooks.org with any questions you have. We'd love to hear from you.
story_txt:
Well groomed. Well read.™ | BarbershopBooks.org




More than 85% of black male 4th graders in the United States are not reading on grade level.
Reading proficiency is an essential skill for success in the 21st Century. Children spend their first few years of school learning to read and around 3rd grade, students begin reading to learn. Students who are not proficient in reading by 4th grade struggle academically and are much less likely to graduate from high school. 



The Challenge
A disproportionately high percentage of black children live in book deserts, where libraries, bookstores, and reading material at home are scarce. In some poverty stricken communities there are as few as one age appropriate book for every 300 children.
Few diverse books are published each year that reflect the culture and reading interests of African American children, especially boys. Adding to these challenges, many early childhood classrooms do not incorporate black boys' reading preferences and too few teachers are responsive to young black boys' individual learning needs.
Far too many black men are missing during the critical period for reading acquisition (pre-K to grade 3). Less than 2% of U.S. teachers are black males and a majority of black boys live with single-mothers.  Black men’s absence from black boys' early reading experiences is significant. Recent social psychology research demonstrates that encouragement and modeling from relevant same-sex role models can improve a one's attitude, perceptions, and confidence.  
Young black boys' current reading attitudes, behavior, or ability are not fixed, but malleable and highly susceptible to positive influences - Barbershop Books is proof.
An Innovative Solution 


Barbershop Books is a community-based literacy program that creates child-friendly reading spaces in barbershops for boys ages 4-8. This innovative program works to improve boys' access to engaging books and increase the amount of time boys read for fun. 


Unlike literacy programs based in schools, libraries, or community organizations, Barbershops Books brings children’s books into a male centered environment. It connects barbers and parents to the early reading experiences of young boys in a positive and culturally meaningful way. Currently, we have reading spaces in  six NYC barbershops, reaching more than 240 boys annually.


A window decal at the entrance of participating barbershops reminds patrons about the children's books inside. Each reading space includes a colorful 2 ft by 2ft book sling filled with 15 curated titles that appeal to boys, especially reluctant readers. The book sling is prominently displayed near a seating area and in large shops, the reading space includes a small bright-yellow chair.  The books used for the program change annually and  target boys ages 4 to 8 for two main reasons: (1) this age range represents a critical period for reading acquisition and (2) barbershop observations revealed that young boys are most likely to engage with books in a barbershop setting. Older boys and men are usually on cell phones, watching TV, or talking to other guys in the shop.

Imagine a World

WITHOUT
  • Transaction fees*
  • Any application forms
WITH
  • Instant and Secure transactions
  • Easy setup

*The average consumer spends $400 per year in transaction fees and inflated price to cover fees.

Free Transactions Now

with

Who Is pixxE.net ?

Damon Hunt — THE CREATOR 
Inventor, Likes to read LAW... yup. designed custom back and front end financial software. Built from scratch multiple companies.

Jamison Phillips — COMPUTER WHIZ
Web-developer, programmer, inventor. Has been programming financial systems for over 15 years, consulting for large financial firms.
Thatcher Stokes — MARKETING GOD
10 years in sales, marketing, customer relations and retention.  Accomplished public speaker and charitable fundraiser.
 

But We Want to Add More

We Need YOUR Help

TO
  • Build sexy apps
  • Support additional languages
  • Add more currencies, + gold & silver
  • Add additional features & functionality
  • Build community 
for a breakdown of the expenses, click here

pixxEs vs. Cash, Cards, etc...

pixxEs are faster, cheaper, and just generally terrific.

A pixxE is a digital picture. It is bartered for whatever you are looking to purchase. The pixxE's value never changes, it itself can be bought and sold by anyone or bartered directly for the goods; either way it is completely free between parties.

It's easier to use than cash, debit, credit, bitcoin, points... anything, because it has the best traits of all of them. 

Here's the gist: You buy pixxEs for $0.10 each. That money is held in secure bank accounts - 100% guaranteed.  The pixxEs you purchased can change hands hundreds, thousands, or even trillions of times for absolutely free. The foundation of the pixxE platform is that pixxE.net will always be able   to buy back every pixxE ever sold - FOREVER. (We do have a small 2% "buy back" fee, but hey we've got to generate revenue somehow).

Set Transactions Free

  • Bring an end to slow and painful transactions.
  • Save small businesses tons of dough.
  • Lightning fast transactions.
  • Open businesses quickly — It can take weeks or even months to set up credit card processing for some types of businesses.
  • POS on your phone, tablet & computer.
  • Make it easy to help out friends and family in other countries.

Get Perky !

Support our campaign. Help create a better world. 
So give us a high five, buy our perks, and tell your friends.

story:
What is the Women's Human Rights Education Institute?

(Traducción española sigue)

The Women's Human Rights Education Institute (WHRI) was co-founded by internationally renowned Costa Rican feminist jurist and Expert Member of the UN Working Group on Discrimination Against Women in Law and Practice, Alda Facio, and University of Toronto/OISE Professor of Adult Education and Community Development, Angela Miles. The purpose of the institute is to  offer international human rights training programs that help women's human rights defenders from around the world develop a practical understanding of the UN Human Rights system, learn how to apply a women's human rights framework to a multiplicity of issues, and develop the facilitation skills necessary for them to become human rights educators in their own regions and organizations. 

El Instituto de Educación de Derechos Humanos de la Mujer (WHRI) fue cofundado por Alda Facio, jurista feminista costarricense, quien es internacionalmente reconocida, miembro experta del grupo de trabajo de la ONU sobre la Discriminación contra la Mujer en la ley y en la práctica. Y por Angela Miles, profesora del Instituto para Estudios de la Educación de Ontario (OISE), Universidad de Toronto. El objetivo del Instituto es ofrecer programas internacionales e formación en derechos humanos. Estos programas permiten que los defensores de derechos humanos de las mujeres de todo el mundo logren desarrollar una comprensión práctica del sistema de Derechos Humanos de la ONU, aprender a aplicar el marco de los derechos humanos de las mujeres a una multiplicidad de temáticas y desarrollar las habilidades necesarias para que se conviertan en educadores de derechos humanos en sus propias regiones y organizaciones.

Since 2004, more than 500 participants have enhanced their capacities as women's human rights defenders through the WHRI training programs, which include (Desde 2004, más de 500 participantes han mejorado sus capacidades como defensores de los derechos humanos de la mujer, a través de los programas de formación WHRI, los cuales incluyen):

  • WHRI Intensive - A four- to six-week intensive institute that teaches the theory and praxis of women’s human rights; prepares participants to use the UN system and the CEDAW convention to support local, national and international level activism; develops facilitation and planning skills for executing workshops and training for others on women’s human rights; and explores women’s human rights as a visionary framework for integrative social, collective, and individual change.
    WHRI Intensivo     - es un curso de cuatro a seis semanas que enseña teoría y  praxis de los derechos humanos de las mujeres,  prepara a los participantes para utilizar el sistema de la ONU y la Convención CEDAW a fin de apoyar el activismo local, nacional e internacional. Desarrolla habilidades de facilitación,  planificación y ejecución de talleres de formación en materia de derechos humanos de las mujeres y explora los derechos humanos de las mujeres como un marco de trabajo visionario  para un integrativo cambio social, colectivo e individual.
  • CEDAW for Change - A seven-day institute focused on the UN Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW) and its core principles of non-discrimination and substantive equality. Participants engage in in-depth learning of the theoretical and analytical framework of the Convention, examine case studies that have come before CEDAW, and strategize on how to link their work to that of the CEDAW committee and a women’s human rights education framework.

    • CEDAW para el Cambio - es un curso de siete días centrado en la Convención de la ONU sobre la Eliminación de todas las Formas de Discriminación contra la Mujer (CETFDCM) más conocida por sus siglas en inglés (CEDAW) y sus principios fundamentales de la no discriminación y la igualdad sustantiva. Los participantes se involucran en el aprendizaje en profundidad del marco teórico y analítico de la Convención, el análisis de casos que se han presentado ante la CEDAW, estrategias sobre cómo vincular su quehacer con el comité de la CEDAW y el marco de trabajo de la educación en derechos humanos de las mujeres.

Listen to WHRI Co-Founder and UN Expert Member of the Working Group on Discrimination Against Women Alda Facio explain the origins and aims of the institute (Escuchar a la Cofundadora del WHRI y Miembro Experto de la ONU del Grupo de Trabajo sobre la Discriminación contra la Mujer,  Alda Facio. Quien explica los orígenes y objetivos de la institución):

The Women's Human Rights Education Institute is more than just a training program; it is a place where lifelong networks of solidarity-building, knowledge-sharing, and friendship are formed and nurtured. These networks create a backbone of support for the difficult and often perilous job of women's human rights defenders. By joining this campaign, you are becoming a part of a network of incredible, inspiring individuals working together to create a future global society free from gendered discrimination and characterized by true equality.

El curso de Educación en Derechos Humanos de la Mujer es más que un programa de estudios, es un lugar de construcción de solidaridad, intercambio de conocimientos y amistad, donde se forman y nutren redes para  toda la vida. Estas redes crean una columna vertebral de apoyo para el difícil y a menudo peligroso trabajo que realizan los defensores de los derechos humanos de las mujeres. Al unirse a esta campaña usted se convierte en parte de una red de personas increíbles e inspiradoras, que trabajan juntos para crear una sociedad global,  un  futuro libre de discriminación de género y que se caracterizado por una real igualdad.

    Help Us Provide Scholarships to Women Leaders from the Global South and from Indigenous Communities in Canada

    (Traducción española sigue)

    Our aim is to be able to offer full scholarships to all institute participants. Women who dedicate their lives to defending the rights of others often face significant daily adversity that affects their mental, spiritual and physical well-being. They also tend to have difficulties supporting themselves and their families financially. This is particularly true for those from historically discriminated groups, such as the Indigenous peoples of Canada. We do not want finances to be a barrier to attending this important course that is impacting women's lives around the world . That is why we wish to generate enough money to offer funding to all of the participants for the 2015 institutes, and to support the sustainability of the WHRI moving forward. 

    You can help us achieve that goal by contributing towards a general scholarship pool or by offering a scholarship in your name, or in the name of a person of your choosing, for either the full WHRI Intensive of for the CEDAW for Change Institute.  

    Here is a breakdown of the costs of funding a participant scholarship:

    WHRI Intensive
    Partial Scholarship: $5,000
    Full Scholarship: $10,000

    CEDAW for Change Institute
    Partial Scholarship: $1,000
    Full Scholarship: $3,000

    Any amount of contribution you make will go a long way to ensuring that participants accepted to our 2015 programs can attend, and to letting these women know that the international community stands alongside them.  

    As a way of showing our appreciation, those who contribute can receive any number of rewards, or "perks." These may include: a personal thank-you letter from WHRI Co-Founder and UN Expert Member of the Working Group on Discrimination Against Women Alda Facio; an eco-friendly tote bag with the WHRI logo imprinted on it; a customized USB containing CEDAW educational materials prepared by the WHRI team; a scholarship in your name or in the name of a person of your choosing offered to a participant in either the WHRI Intensive or in the CEDAW for Change Institute; and either a two- or five-night stay at Alda Facio's ecofeminist farm, La Quicona, in the beautiful, lush mountains of central Costa Rica. In addition, all donors will be acknowledged on the WHRI website and in our annual report.

    Please note that tax receipts are ONLY available to residents of Canada and must be arranged in advance of contribution. If you are a Canadian resident and would like a charitable donation receipt for income tax purposes, please contact us at heather@learnwhr.org before making a contribution. Further, if you are unable to make a contribution through PayPal or by credit card and need to donate by cheque or wire transfer, please also contact us directly to make arrangements. 

    Nuestro objetivo es poder ofrecer becas completas a todos los participantes del instituto. No queremos que las finanzas sean una barrera para asistir a este importante curso que está afectando la vida de las mujeres en todo el mundo. Usted puede ayudarnos a lograr ese objetivo al contribuir a un fondo general de becas u ofreciendo una beca en su nombre, o en nombre de una persona de su elección, ya sea para el curso Intensivo del WHRI o para el Instituto CEDAW para el Cambio.

    Cualquier contribución que usted haga recorrerá un largo camino para asegurar que los participantes aceptados en nuestros programas del año 2015 puedan asistir y permitirá que estas mujeres sepan que la comunidad internacional está con ellas.

    A fin de demostrar nuestro agradecimiento, quienes contribuyan recibirán diversas retribuciones o "beneficios". Estos pueden incluir: una carta personal de agradecimiento de la cofundadora WHRI y Miembro Experto de la ONU del Grupo de Trabajo sobre la Discriminación contra la Mujer Alda Facio, una bolsa ecológica con el logotipo de WHRI, un dispositivo USB personalizado que contiene materiales educativos de la CEDAW los que han sido elaborados por el equipo WHRI, una beca en su nombre o en nombre de la persona que usted haya escogido, ya sea para el curso Intensivo del WHRI o para el Instituto CEDAW para el Cambio y por último de dos a cinco noches en la granja eco feminista de Alda Facio, “La Quicona” que se encuentra en las hermosas y exuberantes montañas del centro de Costa Rica. Todos los donantes serán reconocidos en la web WHRI y en nuestro informe anual.

    Tenga en cuenta que los ingresos fiscales sólo están disponibles para los residentes de Canadá y se deben gestionar antes de la contribución. Si usted es un residente canadiense y desea un recibo de donación caritativa del Impuesto sobre Sociedades, por favor contáctese con nosotros en heather@learnwhr.org antes de hacer cualquier contribución. Además, si usted es incapaz de hacer una contribución a través de PayPal o tarjeta de crédito y  necesita hacer su donación a través de cheque o transferencia bancaria, por favor también póngase en contacto directamente con nosotros para hacer las gestiones pertinentes.

      The Impact Your Donations Will Have

      (Traducción española sigue)

      Your donations will make it possible for women leaders from economically, socially and politically marginalized communities to participate in the Women’s Human Rights Institute, after which they return to their regions and communities to share their learning. Every year, we receive dozens of applications from dedicated, inspiring women’s human rights defenders around the world who want to enhance their local and global advocacy work. However, due to financial constraints, many of them are only able to attend if they receive financial support. All donations will go directly to providing that support, allowing successful applicants to participate in a life-changing educational program that will ensure they are well equipped to use the UN Human Rights system to advocate for women's equality and a world free from gendered discrimination.

      Sus donaciones hacen posible que las mujeres líderes de comunidades marginadas económica, social y políticamente puedan participar en el Instituto de Derechos Humanos de la Mujer después de lo cual vuelven a sus regiones y comunidades para compartir su aprendizaje.

      Todas las donaciones se destinarán directamente a brindar este apoyo, que permitirá a los candidatos seleccionados participar en este programa educativo que cambia la vida, además de estar bien preparados para utilizar el sistema de Derechos Humanos de la ONU, abogar por la igualdad de las mujeres y de un mundo libre de discriminación de género.

      "The WHRI is a light that ignite lights in others to shine. My life and work for humanity has been radically changed positively since I attended the Institute. The Institute is a source to which I will always be proud to be identified with and I acknowledge it as the place where I was made fully awake to my potential as an activist." - Former WHRI Participant, Joy Onyesoh, President of WILPF Nigeria


      A Challenging Time for Women's Human Rights Defenders

      (Traducción española sigue)

      The global funding situation has shifted drastically due to a backlash against women’s movements and women's human rights work. Less funds are available at a time when, ironically, women's human rights and those who defend them are increasingly under attack. WHRI is working hard to ensure that these funding challenges do not sideline our efforts to support women leaders from places in the world affected the most.

      In such precarious times, your donations will ensure that a diversity of participants have access to the essential training provided by both the Women's Human Rights Institute Intensive and the CEDAW for Change Institute. Your donations will also help to ensure that the fight for women's equality and the end to all forms of discrimination against women is won. 

      La situación financiera a nivel global ha cambiado drásticamente debido a una reacción en contra de los movimientos de mujeres y del trabajo por los derechos humanos de las mujeres. En estos tiempos precarios, sus donaciones asegurarán que los diversos participantes tengan acceso a una formación esencial proporcionada tanto por el Instituto de Derechos Humanos de la Mujer, como para el Instituto CEDAW para el Cambio.

      Other Ways You Can Support Us

      (Traducción española sigue)

      If you are unable to contribute financially but would like to support the work of WHRI, there are many ways to help:

      • Share our campaign link with your friends, family, colleagues and other networks via email, social media or by word of mouth.
      • Tell people about the institute by sharing our website, Facebook page, Twitter account, or YouTube channel. 
      • Volunteer your time and services to support the institute's work. Get in touch to find out how you can get involved. 
      • Join one of our programs! We'd love to see you at our next WHRI Intensive or CEDAW for Change Institute.

      Your support means the world to us. 

      Si usted no puede contribuir económicamente, pero le gustaría apoyar el trabajo de WHRI, hay muchas maneras de ayudar:

      • Comparta nuestro enlace de la campaña con tus amigos, familiares, colegas y otras redes a través de correo electrónico, en las redes sociales o boca a boca.
      • Dígale a la gente sobre el instituto, compartiendo nuestro sitio web, página de Facebook, cuenta de Twitter, o el canal de YouTube
      • Ofrezca su tiempo y servicios para apoyar el trabajo del instituto. Póngase en contacto para averiguar cómo puede participar.
      • ¡Únase a uno de nuestros programas! Nos encantaría verlo en nuestra próxima WHRI Intensivo o CEDAW Instituto para el Cambio.

      Su apoyo significa mucho para nosotros.

What is the Women's Human Rights Education Institute?
 (Traducción española sigue)
The Women's Human Rights Education Institute (WHRI) was co-founded by internationally renowned Costa Rican feminist jurist and Expert Member of the UN Working Group on Discrimination Against Women in Law and Practice, Alda Facio, and University of Toronto/OISE Professor of Adult Education and Community Development, Angela Miles. The purpose of the institute is to  offer international human rights training programs that help women's human rights defenders from around the world develop a practical understanding of the UN Human Rights system, learn how to apply a women's human rights framework to a multiplicity of issues, and develop the facilitation skills necessary for them to become human rights educators in their own regions and organizations. 
El Instituto de Educación de Derechos Humanos
de la Mujer (WHRI) fue cofundado por Alda Facio, jurista feminista
costarricense, quien es internacionalmente reconocida, miembro experta del grupo
de trabajo de la ONU sobre la Discriminación contra la Mujer en la ley y en la
práctica. Y por Angela Miles, profesora del Instituto para Estudios de la
Educación de Ontario (OISE), Universidad de Toronto. El objetivo del Instituto es ofrecer programas
internacionales e formación en derechos humanos. Estos programas permiten que
los defensores de derechos humanos de las mujeres de todo el mundo logren
desarrollar una comprensión práctica del sistema de Derechos Humanos de la ONU,
aprender a aplicar el marco de los derechos humanos de las mujeres a una
multiplicidad de temáticas y desarrollar las habilidades necesarias para que se
conviertan en educadores de derechos humanos en sus propias regiones y
organizaciones.
Since 2004, more than 500 participants have enhanced their capacities as
 women's human rights defenders through the WHRI training programs, 
which include (Desde 2004, más de 500 participantes han
mejorado sus capacidades como defensores de los derechos humanos de la mujer, a
través de los programas de formación WHRI, los cuales incluyen): 


WHRI Intensive - A four- to six-week intensive institute that teaches the theory and praxis of women’s human 
rights; prepares participants to use the UN system and the CEDAW 
convention to support local, national and international level activism; develops facilitation and planning skills for 
executing workshops and training for others on women’s human rights; and 
explores women’s human rights as a visionary framework for integrative 
social, collective, and individual change.WHRI Intensivo - es un curso de cuatro a seis semanas que
enseña teoría y  praxis de los derechos
humanos de las mujeres,  prepara a los
participantes para utilizar el sistema de la ONU y la Convención CEDAW a fin de
apoyar el activismo local, nacional e internacional. Desarrolla habilidades de
facilitación,  planificación y ejecución
de talleres de formación en materia de derechos humanos de las mujeres y
explora los derechos humanos de las mujeres como un marco de trabajo visionario  para un integrativo cambio social, colectivo
e individual.



CEDAW for Change - A seven-day institute focused on the UN Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of 
Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW) and its core principles of 
non-discrimination and substantive equality. Participants engage in 
in-depth learning of the theoretical and analytical framework of the 
Convention, examine case studies that have come before CEDAW, and 
strategize on how to link their work to that of the CEDAW committee and a
 women’s human rights education framework.
CEDAW para el Cambio - es un curso de siete días centrado en la Convención de la ONU sobre la
Eliminación de todas las Formas de Discriminación contra la Mujer (CETFDCM) más conocida por sus siglas
en inglés (CEDAW) y sus principios fundamentales de la no discriminación y la
igualdad sustantiva. Los participantes se involucran en el aprendizaje en
profundidad del marco teórico y analítico de la Convención, el análisis de
casos que se han presentado ante la CEDAW, estrategias sobre cómo vincular su
quehacer con el comité de la CEDAW y el marco de trabajo de la educación en
derechos humanos de las mujeres.

Listen to WHRI Co-Founder and UN Expert Member of the Working Group on Discrimination Against Women Alda Facio explain the origins and aims of the institute (Escuchar
a la Cofundadora del WHRI y Miembro Experto de la ONU del Grupo de Trabajo
sobre la Discriminación contra la Mujer, 
Alda Facio. Quien explica los orígenes y objetivos de la institución):

The Women's Human Rights Education Institute is more than just a training program; it is a place where lifelong networks of solidarity-building, knowledge-sharing, and friendship are formed and nurtured. These networks create a backbone of support for the difficult and often perilous job of women's human rights defenders. By joining this campaign, you are becoming a part of a network of incredible, inspiring individuals working together to create a future global society free from gendered discrimination and characterized by true equality.

El
curso de Educación en Derechos Humanos de la Mujer es más que un programa de
estudios, es un lugar de construcción de solidaridad, intercambio de conocimientos y amistad, donde se forman y nutren redes
para  toda la vida. Estas redes crean una
columna vertebral de apoyo para el difícil y a menudo peligroso trabajo que
realizan los defensores de los derechos humanos de las mujeres. Al unirse a
esta campaña usted se convierte en parte de una red de personas increíbles e
inspiradoras, que trabajan juntos para crear una sociedad global,  un 
futuro libre de discriminación de género y que se caracterizado por una
real igualdad.

Any amount of contribution you make will go a long way to ensuring that participants accepted to our 2015 programs can attend, and to letting these women know that the international community stands alongside them.

In addition, all donors will be acknowledged on the WHRI website and in our annual report. 
Please note that tax receipts are ONLY available to residents of Canada and must be arranged in advance of contribution. If you are a Canadian resident and would like a charitable donation receipt for income tax purposes, please contact us at heather@learnwhr.org before making a contribution. Further, if you are unable to make a contribution through PayPal or by credit card and need to donate by cheque or wire transfer, please also contact us directly to make arrangements.

completas a todos los participantes del instituto. No queremos que las finanzas

vida de las mujeres en todo el mundo. Usted puede ayudarnos a lograr ese
objetivo al contribuir a un fondo general de becas u ofreciendo una beca en su
nombre, o en nombre de una persona de su elección, ya sea para el curso
