story:
Why Should You Care: Overview

At FuzeUs, we strongly believe that empowering young women and girls is a key step in breaking the cycle of poverty and gender inequality around the world. There’s no better way to accomplish that than by giving more girls the opportunity and the support so that they can go to AND stay in school to champion them to eventually become role models and great heroine!

Gonzo Soccer is a nonprofit that we’ve been working with for a while that we think has the potential to really make a difference in the agenda to empower girls, gender equality, and leadership but they need your help! That’s why we started this Indiegogo campaign, to raise awareness for their cause and get them the support they need.

Help send these young at-risk, underprivileged girls to an amazing leadership camp to make them strong community leaders for the future.  Please continue reading for further details!


The Issue

Across much of the developing world, by the time she is 12, a girl is tending to the house, cooking, cleaning and she is less likely to be vaccinated, to see a doctor, or attend school, compared to her male counterpart. Too often, a family values a daughter less than a son, not seeing the benefits of educating her when they could just have her work at home. The odds are constantly against her.

We’re here to change that with your help.

Who Are We?

We’re FuzeUs!

FuzeUs is a social-sharing and collaboration platform that works to deepen the connections between nonprofits and the individuals (like you!) and the communities that support them. We help you find, share and care more about the good happening in the world by giving you the platform and tools to turn your voices into action.

By providing in-depth data and analytics to non-profits and cause-marketing campaigns for corporations to truly understand their audience and consumer base, we make sure every single dollar and minute is being used with 100% efficiency and productivity. Our GOAL is to change the world by turning philanthropy into a science, and making DOING GOOD, fun, engaging and easy for everyone to do!

What’s this Indiegogo Campaign for?

At FuzeUs, we strongly believe that empowering young women and girls is a key step in breaking the cycle of poverty and gender inequality around the world, and there’s no better way to accomplish that than by giving more girls the opportunity and the support so that they can go to AND stay in school to champion them to eventually become role models and great heroine!

Gonzo Soccer is a nonprofit that we’ve been working with for a while that we think has the potential to really make a difference in the agenda to empower girls, gender equality, and leadership but they need your help! That’s why we started this Indiegogo campaign, to raise awareness on their cause and get them the support they need.

Why Should You Care? (Why Invest in Girls?) Part 2

70% of the children NOT in school around the world are girls. That’s about 65 million girls. Without education, girls are more likely to marry young, have children early, and spend their life in poverty, with a lack of gender equality and leadership skills for their future. Over 51 million adolescent girls between the ages of 15 and 19 are already married. Of course, younger mothers are at a much higher risk of complications during childbirth and pregnancy and the lives of the mother and the child are in danger.

Just by keeping them in school beyond 7th grade, girls would be more likely to marry 4 years later and have an average of 2.2 fewer children and send them to school, less likely to die in pregnancy and childbirth, and more likely to have healthier children. AND when girls and women earn income, they are likely to reinvest 90% of it into their families. They buy books, medicine, and bed nets. For men, that figure of reinvestment is only between 30-40%.

Despite this truth, less than 2 cents of every development dollar goes to girls…and roughly 9 of 10 youth programs are aimed at boys.

BUT you can help turn the tide for gender inequality. Ultimately, you would be a champion to help Gonzo Soccer help these girls find their voices as young women and as future leaders, and support their continuing education in becoming the leadership of tomorrow. By contributing what you can, YOU can help empower at-risk girls and have a hand in turning them into strong women who can become champions of their communities and role models for future generations.

A Little Bit about Gonzo Soccer

Gonzo Soccer was founded by Monica Gonzalez, former captain of the Mexican National Women's Soccer team. It is a year-round girls’ soccer and leadership academy for underprivileged girls that began in the US in 2009, which has now expanded to Mexico and 5 cities in Colombia. The goal is to reach more marginalized young women that are at risk of “falling through the cracks.”

On top of giving the girls elite soccer training by experienced and dedicated coaches and role models, the academy also provides an hour-long session of tutoring and academic counseling before or after training. In Mexico and Latin America, they provide intensive English classes through a partnership with the US Embassy. Gonzo also connects girls with scholarships to attend private schools in hopes of eventually earning college academic or athletic scholarships.

Lastly, the academy provides valuable life skills training on topics such as goal setting, team-building, leadership, body image, dangers of drugs and alcohol use, bullying and violence in school, and forming good habits. The academy even conducts seminars for parents to educate them on themes like proper nutrition, study habits, exercise and education so that they can be the role models and heroes to empower these young girls.

Why we need YOU.

Today, we’re trying to raise money for 35 Gonzo girls and several coaches from their locations in Colombia, Mexico and the US, to Chicago for a meet and greet with the Chicago Red Stars and then to a 5-day leadership retreat this summer (2015) at a renowned summer camp in Wisconsin. The funds will go to fees for the summer camp program, travel (transportation) and insurance.

Show the girls you care, and help us spread the word! (Even if you can’t contribute!)

What are you funding?

At the retreat, the girls and coaches will be able to partake in intensive leadership meetings, special classes in a variety of topics such as public speaking, conflict resolution, and ROPES courses led by distinguished guests. They will also be attending a community outreach workshop with bilingual mental health practitioners and mentors who work with affected youth in the Chicago area.

The girls will also have a “meet and greet” visit with the Chicago Red Stars players where they will have a chance to talk with players and coaches and meet great female role models. (such as US Olympic Team midfielder Laurie Chalupny and Canadian National Team Captain Karina LeBlanc).

Finally, the girls will be invited to share in a celebration event with local leaders, other youth and press to share about the program, Colombian culture and experiences.

The GOAL of the trip is not only to raise awareness and support for the program and the concept of Sport for Social Change and women’s empowerment through sport, but to show the girls a bigger horizon, and meet more female role models so that they can begin thinking of themselves as future leaders who can cross the boundaries of countries and be a champion for change.

What if you can’t contribute?

Share this campaign with as many of your friends as you can! Make a lot of noise! Who doesn’t love soccer AND empowering young girls??

What do you get in return?

In return for your contribution, you get warm and fuzzy feelings for making a difference! (We promise, it feels like nothing else!)

Alright, fine, fine, you get more than that for contributing.

Depending on your contribution, you could see yourself wearing a Gonzo Soccer branded T-shirt that we designed, some of our great FuzeUs Do Goodies, and even qualify for our social good clubs where you can get all sorts of great things.

Not enough to convince you to help us make a difference? Then, keep reading!

You’re Investing in THE Future

We have to help girls realize their potential instead of seeing them as dispensable or even worse, as prey. And by investing in girls’ education, society reaps the benefits from the skills she gains. It is the first step in creating the next generation of leaders. They are the key to breaking the cycle of poverty. In fact, you could even say that investing in a girl is investing in the future.

Why Sports? Why Soccer?

Sports is unifying. It can engage and bring the world together in a way only very few things can manage. It can promote understanding, tolerance, break down barriers and mobilize support for social causes. It is a universal language. It can overcome prejudices of race, background and gender.

It has proven to encourage students to stay in school and parents to get their children immunized. Today it is used effectively to promote HIV/AIDS awareness and has even helped drive global campaigns against child labor and landmines.

Most importantly, sport is also providing role models for empowering girls and women. The international success of female athletes are giving young girls new heroines, challenging the norm and helping girls recognize their own potential and ambitions.

Whether people in the US like it or not, soccer is the most popular sport in the world. You only need a ball and one other person to play after all! This allows the sport of soccer to be a perfect tool for diplomacy and opening avenues of dialogue on questions of culture and politics.

Gonzo Soccer is harnessing sports’ ability to be an agent of social change, to help these girls become empowered individuals who can shape their own community and the future for the better.

What happens if we go below or above the goal?

If we don’t reach the intended goal, the money will still go to fund the Gonzo Soccer programs so that they can reach more girls and give them a chance for a better education and future.

IF we go above and beyond our goal, all extra funds will either go to getting more girls to be able to attend the leadership retreat, or to fund other exchange programs that the academy has planned for their girls.

There’s always other things to be paid for such as equipment, uniforms, staffing and educational training costs that your help could fund!


Here are the 4 choices of shirts you can choose from:

#1

#2

#3

#4
story_txt:
Why Should You Care: OverviewAt FuzeUs, we strongly believe that empowering young women and girls is a key step in breaking the cycle of poverty and gender inequality around the world. There’s no better way to accomplish that than by giving more girls the opportunity and the support so that they can go to AND stay in school to champion them to eventually become role models and great heroine!Gonzo Soccer is a nonprofit that we’ve been working with for a while that we think has the potential to really make a difference in the agenda to empower girls, gender equality, and leadership but they need your help! That’s why we started this Indiegogo campaign, to raise awareness for their cause and get them the support they need.Help send these young at-risk, underprivileged girls to an amazing leadership camp to make them strong community leaders for the future.  Please continue reading for further details!The
Issue
Across
much of the developing world, by the time she is 12, a girl
is tending to the house, cooking, cleaning and she is less likely to
be vaccinated, to see a doctor, or attend school, compared to her
male counterpart. Too often, a family values a daughter less than a
son, not seeing the benefits of educating her when they could just
have her work at home. The odds are constantly against her. 

We’re
here to change that with your help. 

Who
Are We?
We’re
FuzeUs! 

FuzeUs
is a social-sharing and collaboration platform that works to deepen
the connections between nonprofits and the individuals (like you!)
and the communities that support them. We help you find, share and
care more about the good happening in the world by giving you the
platform and tools to turn your voices into action. 

By
providing in-depth data and analytics to non-profits and
cause-marketing campaigns for corporations to truly understand their
audience and consumer base, we make sure every single dollar and
minute is being used with 100% efficiency and productivity. Our GOAL
is to change the world by turning philanthropy into a science, and
making DOING GOOD, fun, engaging and easy for everyone to do!
What’s
this Indiegogo Campaign for?
At
FuzeUs, we strongly believe that empowering
young women
and girls is a key step in breaking the cycle of poverty
and
gender inequality
around the world, and there’s no better way to accomplish that than
by giving more girls
the opportunity and the support so that they can go to AND stay in
school to
champion them to eventually become role models and great heroine!


Gonzo
Soccer is a nonprofit that we’ve been working with for a while that
we think has the potential to really make a difference in the agenda
to
empower girls,
gender
equality, and leadership
but they need your help! That’s why we started this Indiegogo
campaign, to raise awareness on their cause and get them the support
they need. 

Why
Should You Care? (Why Invest in Girls?) Part 2
70%
of the children NOT in school around the world are girls. That’s
about 65 million girls. Without education, girls are more likely to
marry young, have children early, and spend their life in poverty,
with
a lack of gender equality and leadership skills for their future.
Over 51 million adolescent
girls
between the ages of 15 and 19 are already married. Of course, younger
mothers
are at a much higher risk of complications during childbirth and
pregnancy and the lives of the mother and the child are in danger.  

Just
by keeping them in school beyond 7th
grade, girls would be more likely to marry 4 years later and have an
average of 2.2 fewer children and send them to school, less likely to
die in pregnancy and
childbirth,
and more likely to have healthier children. AND when girls and women
earn income, they are likely to reinvest 90% of it into their
families. They buy books, medicine, and bed nets. For men, that
figure of reinvestment is only between 30-40%. 

Despite
this truth, less than 2 cents of every development dollar goes to
girls…and roughly 9 of 10 youth programs are aimed at boys. 

BUT
you can help turn the tide for
gender inequality.
Ultimately, you would be a
champion to help
Gonzo Soccer help these girls find their voices as young women and as
future leaders, and support their continuing education in
becoming the leadership of tomorrow.
By contributing what you can, YOU can help empower at-risk girls and
have a hand in turning them into strong women who can become
champions of their communities and
role models for future generations.
A
Little Bit about Gonzo Soccer
Gonzo
Soccer was founded by Monica Gonzalez, former captain of the Mexican
National Women's
Soccer team.
It is a year-round girls’ soccer and leadership academy for
underprivileged girls that began in the US in 2009, which has now
expanded to Mexico and 5 cities in Colombia.  The goal is to reach
more marginalized young women that are at risk of “falling through
the cracks.” 

On
top of giving the girls elite soccer training by experienced and
dedicated coaches and
role models,
the academy also provides an hour-long session of tutoring and
academic counseling before or after training. In Mexico and Latin
America, they provide intensive English classes through a partnership
with the US Embassy. Gonzo also connects girls with scholarships to
attend private schools in hopes of eventually earning college
academic or athletic scholarships. 

Lastly,
the academy provides valuable life skills training on topics such as
goal setting, team-building, leadership, body image, dangers of drugs
and alcohol use, bullying and violence in school, and forming good
habits. The academy even conducts seminars for parents to educate
them on themes like proper nutrition, study habits, exercise and
education so
that they can be the role models and heroes to empower these young
girls. 

Why
we need YOU.
Today,
we’re trying to raise money for 35 Gonzo girls and several coaches
from their locations in Colombia, Mexico and the US, to Chicago for a
meet and greet with the Chicago Red Stars and then to a 5-day
leadership retreat this summer (2015) at a renowned summer camp in
Wisconsin. The funds will go to fees for the summer camp program,
travel (transportation) and insurance.
Show
the girls you care, and help us spread the word! (Even if you can’t
contribute!)
What
are you funding?

At
the retreat, the girls and coaches will be able to partake in
intensive leadership meetings, special classes in a variety of topics
such as public speaking, conflict resolution, and ROPES courses led
by distinguished guests. They will also be attending a community
outreach workshop with bilingual mental health practitioners and
mentors who work with affected youth in the Chicago area.
The
girls will also have a “meet and greet” visit with the Chicago
Red Stars players where they will have a chance to talk with players
and coaches and meet great female role models. (such as US Olympic
Team midfielder Laurie Chalupny and Canadian National Team Captain
Karina LeBlanc). 

Finally,
the girls will be invited to share in a celebration event with local
leaders, other youth and press to share about the program, Colombian
culture and experiences. 

The
GOAL of the trip is not only to raise awareness and support for the
program and the concept of Sport for Social Change and women’s
empowerment through sport, but to show the girls a bigger horizon,
and meet more female role models so that they can begin thinking of
themselves as future leaders who can cross the boundaries of
countries and
be a champion for change. 

What
if you can’t contribute?
Share
this campaign with as many of your friends as you can! Make a lot of
noise! Who doesn’t love soccer AND empowering young girls?? 

What
do you get in return?
In
return for your contribution, you get warm and fuzzy feelings for
making a difference! (We promise, it feels like nothing else!)
Alright,
fine, fine, you get more than that for contributing. 

Depending
on your contribution, you could see yourself wearing a Gonzo Soccer
branded T-shirt that we designed, some
of our great FuzeUs Do Goodies, and even qualify for our social good
clubs where you can get all sorts of great things. 

Not
enough to convince you to help us make a difference? Then, keep
reading!
You’re
Investing in THE Future
We
have to help girls realize their potential instead of seeing them as
dispensable or even worse, as prey. And by investing in girls’
education, society reaps the benefits from the skills she gains. It
is the first step in creating the next generation of leaders. They
are the key to breaking the cycle of poverty.  In fact, you could
even say that investing
in a girl is investing in the future.


Why
Sports? Why Soccer? 

Sports
is unifying. It can engage and bring the world together in a way only
very few things can manage. It can promote understanding, tolerance,
break down barriers and mobilize support for social causes. It is a
universal language. It can overcome prejudices of race, background
and gender. 

It
has proven to encourage students to stay in school and parents to get
their children immunized. Today it is used effectively to promote
HIV/AIDS awareness and has even helped drive global campaigns against
child labor and landmines.
Most
importantly, sport is also providing role models for empowering girls
and women. The international success of female athletes are giving
young girls new heroines, challenging the norm and helping girls
recognize their own potential and ambitions. 

Whether
people in the US like it or not, soccer is the most popular sport in
the world. You only need a ball and one other person to play after

politics.

Soccer is harnessing sports’ ability to be an agent of social
change, to help these girls become empowered individuals who can
shape their own community and the future for the better.

happens if we go below or above the goal?
If
we don’t reach the intended goal, the money will still go to fund
the Gonzo Soccer programs so that they can reach more girls and give
them a chance for a better education and future. 

IF
we go above and beyond our goal, all extra funds will either go to
getting more girls to be able to attend the leadership retreat, or to
fund other exchange programs that the academy has planned for their
girls.

story:
Journal Junkies is a nonprofit writing center based in Springfield, Massachusetts, dedicated to empowering high school youth to explore their journalistic lens. We help teenagers understand that everyone has a story to tell, and every story has a right to be heard, including their own. We are dedicated to instilling courage, compassion, and confidence in the young people we work with every day.               

Who We Serve                                        

We have worked with a wide range of high school students in Springfield, MA and its surrounding communities. Students reflect the socioeconomic and multicultural diversity within the Western, MA region. All of our programs will always be offered 100% free to students, ensuring that those who need our services most – the students who are least likely to have a voice in their community – can participate.

Our Innovative Program                        

We will enlist the talent and support of local teachers, college students, fellow journalists and community volunteers. At our impressive 9,000 square foot downtown writing center in the heart of Springfield’s Tower Square, our 2015 students will have free after-school workshops and open writing hours each week. We will be sharing our space with The Tech Foundry, a nonprofit organization committed to working with students and residents to turn Western Massachusetts into a tech hub for the Northeast.

In our weekly after school sessions, our goal is to help our students prepare for and interview people ranging from community members to notable activists and celebrities. Students have a complete say in the kinds of stories they’d like to pursue. We also work with them to choose the type of media venue that is right for them, whether that is audio story telling, photojournalism or writing. All of our students’ work gets published on our blog and could also be publicized on local or national media outlets.

We are genuinely interested in listening to what our Journal Junkies have to say. We value their insights about their communities, their lives and the news they hear, watch, or read on their many mobile devices. We are never grading or judging. We are simply put, inspired by their voices and we think the rest of the world should hear them, too.

Interviews                                                 

During the summer of 2014, students interviewed a wide range of folks from everyday people in their community, to NBA legend Alonzo Mourning. With each interview, they learned that every person, no matter who they are or where they come from, has a story to tell. 

  • Alonzo Mourning: When the students interviewed NBA legend Alonzo Mourning, they learned that if it weren’t for his foster mom, he never would have graduated from college or made it to the NBA. Several of the students from this summer’s program live in foster care.
  • Sarah Concannon: In interviewing Sarah, a local artist whose project “The People in Your Neighborhood” is on display at Springfield’s Wood Museum, the students learned that each of their city’s 17 communities has a unique voice. They also asked Sarah many questions about what it takes to persevere as a working artist.
  • Bhuwan Gautam: A former refugee from Bhutan who lived in a refugee camp for 16 years, Bhuwan came to the United States in 2008 and holds a B.A. from Western New England University. He resides in Springfield currently. The students asked him many questions about survival and what it has been like coming to the city as a refugee.
Our 2015 Blog Will Feature:

  •  A recurring piece called “What’s that Junk?” Students will go out into the community and explore what appears to be a decrepit or abandoned building. Their job will be to find out the backstory, the life the buildings once had before they were forsaken.
  • Students will also write a feature series about a talented spray paint artist in Springfield whose work includes a large mural with the life size words: “What does it take to be a man?”
  • They will investigate a story in conjunction with our University of Massachusetts teacher volunteers about why the FDA is not disclosing certain information pertaining to a student research project.

Examples of Our Impact

Mystique Found Her Voice This Past Summer...

Mystique, otherwise known as Missy, announced one afternoon, “I have an important question for Alonzo Mourning.” This was the first time Missy found her voice that summer. She astounded us by not only asking an insightful question that NBA legend Alonzo Mourning himself complimented her on, but by being the ONLY student in our group who did not have stage fright the day of the interview and instead, grabbed the mic and spoke her mind.

Anya’s Unexpected Portrait.....

Anya, a girl who spoke of her love for painting, was selected by the artist we interviewed in the summer of 2014 to have her portrait drawn as a representation of the “Bay” community of Springfield. A life size portrait of Anya is now on display at Springfield’s renowned Wood Museum. Next to it sits a handwritten note colored with the dichotomy that is her city: she fears for Springfield’s gang ridden streets, yet can still feel the beating heart of its parades.

Learn more at www.journal-junkies.org.

story:
Hi there!

Have you ever wanted something really bad (at least as a kid)? And you were trying to get/earn/save money as fast and as much as you could so you could afford that "something"? Do you still remember the moment when someone saw how hard you're trying and decided to help you in your endeavour?
We are first Croatian national Ultimate team and we know exactly how you feel!! 
We have a really big goal we want to achieve - to participate in European Ultimate (frisbee) Championship 2015. in Copenhagen, Denmark, at the end of July, and we would like YOU to be that "someone special" who will help us to get there.
If you are still wondering what the Ultimate (frisbee) is, here is some brief info:
  • the best team sport you can possibly imagine
  • limited-contact team field sport played with a flying disc
  • whole idea of Ultimate is based on honesty and respect among players


  • NO REFEREES! - all misunderstandings and disagreements are solved between players involved
  • points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone
  • a stunning feature of the Ultimate is the "lay out", a horizontal dive to catch or block the disc (which simply leaves spectators breathless)


What We Need & What You Get

Although there are several things and ways you can help our cause, the main thing we need to make our dream come true is money. As it is stated, we need 5000$ or more for (about 300€ per player for low budget stay): 

  • Transportation (minibus)
  • Sleeping (camp expenses)
  • Training (field and cones)
  • Equipment (jerseys and discs)

  • If we don't reach our entire goal and have just part and decide not to go to EUC, we will use all collected money for developing youth ultimate!


The Impact - think globally, act locally!

Participation at a big tournament like European Championship has always been a big thing, no matter what sport we are talking about, especailly if a significant rank is achieved. Making this project real, participation of Croatian Ultimate team on EUC will not only benefit the players, but also the development of Ultimate in Croatia in general, making it even more appealing and interesting for all those who will come in contact with Ultimate for the first time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that's not the problem! We asked our parents the same question and mostly got the same answers... "We can't give you that money", but most of them really helped all other way that they could... so... Probably there is a way you could help us by just spreading the word around or introduce our quest to someone you think could be interested.

story: I will be using the money to pay down debt so I can start the non-profit I envisioned during my time at George Washington University, completing my Healthcare MBA. The organization is called Food for the Fight and specializes in meal delivery services for cancer patients. It will also provide education services for patients and their families on the importance of eating right during cancer treatment. I have lost many family members to cancer and want to build a support system among patients and families via a web/smartphone application. Food for the Fight made it to the finals at the GWU business plan competition but did not move forward. My passion for helping others is being dampened by the debt from student loans, something many graduates face. Help me reach my goal!

story:
Who We Are

Children Across America (CAA), a 501c3 nonprofit located in Milford, MA, is an organization dedicated to protecting children against preventable illnesses and giving underserved kids an opportunity to achieve academic excellence.

Since 2007, CAA has been working with local communities to ensure children in low-income families receive preventative medical care and also gain literacy and leadership skills they need to succeed in school and in life.

Help us make the DIFFERENCE in children's lives! Here's how you can support our campaign, to contribute or to buy a t-shirt, please follow these steps:

  • If you would like to fund our campaign and you don't want to shop, please select Contribute on the right hand side of the campaign.
  • If you want to buy a t-shirt, select a perk on the right hand side. If you would like to buy more than 1 t-shirt, please select the perk more than 1 time.
  • From here the page will lead you to provide your shipping information and payment details.
  • For your shipment you can pay via Paypal or your debit/credit card.
  • To choose a t-shirt size and color, please check the available colors and sizes under the t-shirt perks. Please let us know which color and size would you like to receive by sending an email to jstgermain@childrenacrossamerica.org.
  • The t-shirts will be on their way by October 1st.

Why We’re on Indiegogo


CAA is developing an innovative brand of imprinted t-shirts. These shirts will have people feeling new and Recharged! After delivering awesomely inspirational apparel, the profits from the campaign will go towards funding programs that are uniquely designed to empower children in communities across America. Wait, wait, wait! It gets better!

Recharge branded t-shirts are 100% cotton and will be made and screened right here in the USA. Aligning with the philosophies of CAA, much of the apparel produced alongside this campaign will also benefit other organizations. To do that, we are introducing a graphic tee from our 'Made in the USA' collection. For every one of these shirts sold, $5 will be donated to a local nonprofit organization that supports US Veterans. But we won’t stop there. We are working on several other concepts that are designed to help other nonprofits too!


We recognize that as CAA, we cannot successfully achieve our mission without the support of local communities. That’s why we decided to behave with the golden rule in mind. Treat others the way you wanted to be treated.

The bottom line is that you are recharging your local community by participating in this campaign. You deserve pats on the back in perpetuity.



The Master Plan to Recharge Local Communities

We are trying to get our largest program up and running by Summer 2016, the Summer Lunch and Literacy Program (SLLP).

For most of the children that receive free or reduced cost lunch during a school year, this is their most nutritious meal of the day. During the summer months, children are likely to go without this meal for 80 consecutive days.

These same children, usually living with their parents, don’t usually understand the value of a proper education. They are not encouraged to read or practice math over the summer. As a result, when they return to school in September, they take twice as long to reach their previous literacy level from June. 



We have a program that will solve that problem

The Recharge program is a major step in funding the SLLP and if you believe that this program is essential, then it’s time to do your best to support it.

The Recharge brand, established in 2015, designs clothes for people from all walks of life. If you are someone that appreciates putting on your favorite shirt for their favorite cause, then wow, you’re in the right place. Recharge believes that there are consumers out there that have a sense of pride knowing that their purchase is creating jobs in the USA. CAA is highly confident that people will back a brand that puts out great looking, feel-good inspirational wear. Not to mention that the majority of the proceeds go to supporting programs designed to empower people in need.

Other ways to recharge our smile:
 If you like our idea but can not contribute financially, that's ok, there are a few ways how you can help this campaign succeed:

•Please spread the word about Recharge to your loved ones, your family, friends, co-workers and to anybody who matters in your life

•Please also like and share our social media sites:

Facebook group: Recharge Graphics that Empower

Instagram: RECHARGELIFESTYLE

Twitter: CAAMass


Thank you for your help, our campaign would be not here without you! 


Q&A

How to contact us?

*If you have questions about a perk, about Children Across America or Recharge, please contact us at: jstgermain@childrenacrossamerica.org. Please let us know how you would like to be contacted and we will get in touch with you.

What are the t-shirts made of?

*All t-shirts are made of 100% cotton and will be made and screened in the USA.

Is it true that you offer 2 more designs in the Made in the USA collection?

*Yes, it's true, the Made in the USA collection has not only the US Army and Marine designs, we also offer the US Navy and the US Coast Guard designs. Which one do you pick?

What sizes of t-shirts are available?

*Ladies: S, M, L, XL

*Gentlemen: S, M, L, XL, XXL

*Toddler: 2, 4, 6 ages

*Youth: 8, 10, 12 ages

All the sizes and colors are also listed under the perks.

When do I get my t-shirt?

*T-shirts will be on the way by October 1st.

Is it possible to return the t-shirt?

*We would be sad to get returns but of course, is possible to return them if you are not happy with our product. Crowdfunders will be responsible to pay for th return fee.

To return, please send an email with your Full Name, Address (Street, State, Zip Code) to the following email address: rimre@childrenacrossamerica.org

Can I check your website?

*Our website, rechargelifestyles.com, is under construction but will be up shortly.  Until then, please Check out or Facebook group at: Recharge Graphics that Empower and please join the group. Learn what's going on in Recharge's world by following our tweets at our Twitter: CAAMass or check our images on Instagram at: RECHARGELIFESTYLE. We look forward to keeping you curious about our brand!

Who We Are
Children Across America (CAA), a 501c3
nonprofit located in Milford, MA, is an organization dedicated to protecting
children against preventable illnesses and giving underserved kids an
opportunity to achieve academic excellence.

Since 2007, CAA has been working with local communities to
ensure children in low-income families receive preventative medical care and also gain literacy and leadership skills they need to succeed in school and in
life.Help us make
the DIFFERENCE in children's lives! Here's how you can support our campaign, to
contribute or to buy a t-shirt, please follow these steps:


If you would
like to fund our campaign and you don't want to shop, please select Contribute
on the right hand side of the campaign.


If you want
to buy a t-shirt, select a perk on the right hand side. If you would like to
buy more than 1 t-shirt, please select the perk more than 1 time.


From here
the page will lead you to provide your shipping information and payment
details.


For your
shipment you can pay via Paypal or your debit/credit card.


To choose a
t-shirt size and color, please check the available colors and sizes under the
t-shirt perks. Please let us know which color and size would you like to receive
by sending an email to jstgermain@childrenacrossamerica.org.


The t-shirts
will be on their way by October 1st.

story:
The Heaven Primary School

We are Unite the World with Africa Foundation. Members of our team have been working and living in and out of Tanzania, East Africa, since 1991. We are a 100% volunteer team with a proven track record, and our work is to promote peace and prosperity for the world's poor through the provision & advancement of education, health and micro finance programs. 

The Heaven School is our opportunity to change lives. Heaven is operated by Sister Crispina Mnate and the St. Joseph’s orphanage in Kiserian village outside Arusha. Heaven is a private English school that is currently serving children in nursery through Standard 1 (~ages 5 to 8) in three classrooms. Crispina started the school to educate the nearly 50 orphans who call St Joseph’s home. St. Joseph’s receives children up to age 3 who have been abandoned or who have lost their parents, often due to HIV/AIDS.

While Crispina has been successfully running the Heaven Pre-Primary school for many years; St Joseph’s has not had the funds to build out a full primary school to Standard 7. As a result,the orphans have been attending a local private primary school that is expensive, poor quality and requires a treacherous 10 kilometer walk each way. 

What We Need & What You Get

To date Unite the World with Africa Foundation has invested $10,000 in the build out of Heaven through Standard 7, or about age 13. 

Empowers Africa has awarded us a $5,000 MATCHING GRANT to help complete the seven classrooms and outfit them with desks and chairs, blackboards and all appropriate supplies. Please help us here there.  

Donors will receive unique gifts from The Ashe Collection global marketplace as well as name recognition on a plaque on the wall of The Heaven School.

The Impact

Once completed, Heaven will:

* Provide a full 270 children, or about 30 per classroom, a safe, quality education and thereby a solid chance at a successful future.

* Create an income stream for the school and the orphanage by increasing the school’s capacity to receive outside tuition-paying students.

* Provide teaching and support jobs to surrounding community members. 

Risks & Challenges

The only risks to this campaign is the amount of time it will take to raise the funds necessary to complete the school. Our intention is to have the entire primary school complete by early September so that they can fill the classrooms not only with the orphans of St. Joseph's but also with paying students from the surrounding villages. This will help to ensure financial independence not only for the Heaven school but for the entire St. Joseph's center as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot share of your treasure, we invite you to share of your TIME and NETWORK. Please tweet our campaign. Share on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn & Tumblr. Help us to build and grow our UNITED FRONT against poverty, human suffering, ignorance, apathy and more. Join us in our commitment to service and transformation.

story:
Our Roots are in Disaster 

HELP International, an NGO that started in 1999, first began in response to Hurricane Mitch that hit Honduras and resulted in thousands of deaths and many lives left in shambles. After raising money and going down to help out, HELP Honduras was formed. Since then we have grown to reach many countries, changed our name to HELP International, and focused on sustainable development projects around the world. However, when disaster hits we know how devastating it can be to a community for months to come and how great the need for action and aid can be. Check out the above video of our Crisis Team last year that we sent to the Philippines for tsunami relief. 

What We Need 

We are asking everyone who sees this campaign to give. Give by sharing this post, give by donating what you would spend on lunch today, give by signing up to come with us. Call a friend who was feeling hopeless and looking for a place to donate where 100% of the funds will go to the people in Nepal who are in need the most. We are committed to seeing these funds put in the right place and are just needing a little help to HELP.

  • Any little bit helps the cause. The more individual donors this campaign gets the higher this platform will be ranked and the more eyes that will see it. Even a dollar can have an impact. 
  • Facebook this. Tweet this. Share this on Instagram and tag us @helpintl.
  • If you're interested in coming with us, we are recruiting a group to go to Nepal and distribute these funds as our Nepal Crisis Team here: https://helpinternational.wufoo.com/forms/2015-fall-nepal-crisis-team-application/

You can make the difference

Every good thing that HELP has done is because of our volunteers. We can't thank you enough for you time, your sensitivity to the people around you, and your brilliant ideas that turn into our projects. 

Please check us out at help-international.org and at our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/HELPIntl?pnref=lhc  to learn more.

story:
Our Purpose

One of the many plant species that need to be preserved.

Walter Prunzik
Hello my name is Walter Prunzik. On a recent visit to the rainforest of Ecuador, I came into contact with the Shuars, an indigenous tribe of some of the most beautiful people on Earth. The purpose of my visit was to do my own investigation into Ayahausca, also known as the Spirit Vine. The Spirit Vine has long been rumored to have many healing properties that the Western medical community does not recognize, healing such things as cancer, diabetes, high blood pressure, hyper and hypothyroidism, as well as repairing hearts, kidneys, livers, and any other damaged organs in the human body. I was introduced to a Shaman named Danielle. It didn't take me long to realize that I was in the presence of a very real and actual Shaman. It was only after Danielle felt comfortable with me that I was invited into his home and into his family. That is where this magical journey began and unfolded into a mystical once in a lifetime adventure of healing, friendship and love. 

Danielle and his wife Maria with me 
The Journey Begins
The days passed as I rested and Danielle appeared once again to inform me that he had decided to take me on as a patient and a student. We headed into the rain forest, stopping along the way to take pictures and rest. After a few miles of hiking a muddy trail deeper into the jungle, we walked into a clearing and the sound of incredible rushing waters. I was standing before one of the most magnificent waterfalls I had ever seen. It was here that Danielle informed me, through my interpreter, Ken Johnson, that I was now in the presence of the Spirit Water Fall, and that before I could meet Spirit Mother, I must first undergo a Spirit Cleansing Ceremony. I was told to undress. 

Ceremony at Spirit Waterfall

The Spirit Cleansing Ceremony was unique to me in many ways and quite profound. I had not heard of this before and no other Shaman I had interviewed ever mentioned it. Danielle told me it was time to begin a fast and to not eat or drink anything until the next evening. We spent the day in the jungle, Danielle educating me with a show-and-tell adventure of magical plants and their healing properties. As the sun began to set, Danielle led the way to the Sacred Ceremony Site.


The Doctor's Office

As we slogged to the end of a muddy trail, the rain forest yielded its canopy to a beautiful sunlit site. I gazed in awe at a beautifully manicured and very well built Ceremonial Village that had been in Danielle's family for many many years. This was the Scared Ceremonial Site that would become my home for the next few weeks. 
         The jungle comes alive at night with tree frogs, birds, and the many other unseen critters, and the orchestra begins to play the rain forest sonata that would lull me to sleep night after night. There was an excitement in their song I sensed. Although I didn't know it at the time, these critters of the rain forest would be my fellow passengers on my Ayahuasca flight. 
         Sunrise in the rain forest is very unique, casting beams and flecks of sunlight through the forest as it makes its morning climb, finally cresting the tree tops, bathing everything in her warm delight. It was the giggling of children that got me out of bed that morning, and as I stepped outside into the sunlight, I was greeted by shy smiling faces. Danielle's three daughters couldn't wait to play. 
The Ayahuasca Truth
I participated in five Ayahuasca ceremonies. I watched how the vine was cut and prepared and I also watched as it cooked all day long. The Ayahuasca Ceremony is traditionally performed at night. That night would be the first of five ceremonies. I had several health issues that, according to doctors, would not go away. After the fifth Ayahuasca ceremony, I was free from these perplexing illnesses. That is when I realized the value and the importance of these plants of the rain forest and the Shaman's centuries old knowledge and wisdom on how to use them. We simply cannot allow the destruction of this rain forest. We must preserve this culture and we must understand everything these Shamans know.                                                                        The devastation occurring in our rain forest is no longer a secret. These people, their lands, and their cultures are under constant threat. If we can save their culture, we can save them. The most serious of threats are lumber pirates, who are constantly illegally stealing timber and illegal gold mining. These two threats alone are causing irreparable damage to our rain forest. Without your help, this way of life will surely disappear, taking with it this valuable Tribal Culture. The more contact these people have with the outside world, the better their chances for survival, and the better our chances will be to understand these valuable plant medicines and this wonderful culture that uses them. 



Risks & Challenges

Danielle has conveyed to me through our interpreter, Ken Johnson, his desire to renovate the entire Sacred Ceremonial site and modernize it to a degree of comfort that would better suit doctors and patients from around the world, by adding more modern bathrooms, a sixteen bed lodge, two private lodges and a state of the art cultural center where these medicinal traditions can be taught to and researched by others. Our plan is to start construction on the road and the walking trails immediately. This will make it easier for the children to get to school and the mothers and fathers to get their goods and services into town. There is a fairly high unemployment rate among the indigenous peoples of this region. They are all anxious to get to work.                                                                                                                                     There are no risks involved in this project simply because this is a wonderful political climate and this project has been embraced by all. The only challenge is financial, and that's where you come in. Your donations will fund these projects one by one in a systematic plan that will ensure the thriving preservation of this culture and of these people and their way of life. All work on these projects will be videoed and posted for your viewing as well as an open invitation to all of our contributors to come here and experience this life and seek natural treatments for the many diseases plaguing the Western World, and learn these healing techniques for yourself.

Other Ways You Can Help

Our logistics plan will include a volunteer services department, which you will be able to sign up for and you will be welcomed into this community and volunteer for such positions as heavy equipment operators, plumbers, electricians, painters, roofers, window and door installers, carpenters, and landscapers. 

Based on our policy that anything is better than nothing, we ask that you share this information with your friends and families, share these links every chance you get, and call and write your representatives urging them to do whatever they can do to help save our rain forests, and preserve these irreplaceable and valuable cultures. Thank you for your time. Thank you for your donations. 

Walter Prunzik

As we slogged to the end of a muddy trail, the rain forest yielded its canopy to a beautiful sunlit site. I gazed in awe at a beautifully manicured and very well built Ceremonial Village that had been in Danielle's family for many many years. This was the Scared Ceremonial Site that would become my home for the next few weeks.          The jungle comes alive at night with tree frogs, birds, and the many other unseen critters, and the orchestra begins to play the rain forest sonata that would lull me to sleep night after night. There was an excitement in their song I sensed. Although I didn't know it at the time, these critters of the rain forest would be my fellow passengers on my Ayahuasca flight.          Sunrise in the rain forest is very unique, casting beams and flecks of sunlight through the forest as it makes its morning climb, finally cresting the tree tops, bathing everything in her warm delight. It was the giggling of children that got me out of bed that morning, and as I stepped outside into the sunlight, I was greeted by shy smiling faces. Danielle's three daughters couldn't wait to play. 








The Ayahuasca TruthI participated in five Ayahuasca ceremonies. I watched how the vine was cut and prepared and I also watched as it cooked all day long. The Ayahuasca Ceremony is traditionally performed at night. That night would be the first of five ceremonies. I had several health issues that, according to doctors, would not go away. After the fifth Ayahuasca ceremony, I was free from these perplexing illnesses. That is when I realized the value and the importance of these plants of the rain forest and the Shaman's centuries old knowledge and wisdom on how to use them. We simply cannot allow the destruction of this rain forest. We must preserve this culture and we must understand everything these Shamans know.                                                                        The devastation occurring in our rain forest is no longer a secret. These people, their lands, and their cultures are under constant threat. If we can save their culture, we can save them. The most serious of threats are lumber pirates, who are constantly illegally stealing timber and illegal gold mining. These two threats alone are causing irreparable damage to our rain forest. Without your help, this way of life will surely disappear, taking with it this valuable Tribal Culture. The more contact these people have with the outside world, the better their chances for survival, and the better our chances will be to understand these valuable plant medicines and this wonderful culture that uses them. 










Risks & Challenges
Danielle has conveyed to me through our interpreter, Ken Johnson, his desire to renovate the entire Sacred Ceremonial site and modernize it to a degree of comfort that would better suit doctors and patients from around the world, by adding more modern bathrooms, a sixteen bed lodge, two private lodges and a state of the art cultural center where these medicinal traditions can be taught to and researched by others. Our plan is to start construction on the road and the walking trails immediately. This will make it easier for the children to get to school and the mothers and fathers to get their goods and services into town. There is a fairly high unemployment rate among the indigenous peoples of this region. They are all anxious to get to work.                                                                                                                                     There are no risks involved in this project simply because this is a wonderful political climate and this project has been embraced by all. The only challenge is financial, and that's where you come in. Your donations will fund these projects one by one in a systematic plan that will ensure the thriving preservation of this culture and of these people and their way of life. All work on these projects will be videoed and posted for your viewing as well as an open invitation to all of our contributors to come here and experience this life and seek natural treatments for the many diseases plaguing the Western World, and learn these healing techniques for yourself.
Other Ways You Can Help

Our logistics plan will include a volunteer services department, which you will be able to sign up for and you will be welcomed into this community and volunteer for such positions as heavy equipment operators, plumbers, electricians, painters, roofers, window and door installers, carpenters, and landscapers. 
 Based on our policy that anything is better than nothing, we ask that you share this information with your friends and families, share these links every chance you get, and call and write your representatives urging them to do whatever they can do to help save our rain forests, and preserve these irreplaceable and valuable cultures. Thank you for your time. Thank you for your donations. 
Walter Prunzik

story:
Short Summary

My son, Audei, is eight years old and loves airports. Luckily we live close to Bush Intercontinental Airport in Houston and he gets a chance to visit it on a regular basis. He loves riding the inter-terminal train and visiting all the locations he has access to. He loves going on the parking garage roof to see the planes. He would love to go into the terminals, but I keep telling him we cannot unless we have a ticket.

Audei is also autistic and has trouble communicating due to developmental delays in speech and social skills. That means when Audei was first diagnosed he was completely non-verbal and would only communicate by pointing or other hand gestures. He would be in his own world most of the time, tuning out the rest of the world almost completely. Over the years we have seen some great improvements in these areas in spite of the fact he is still far behind his age equivalent for speech and social cognitive ability. He talks now in broken sentences and is eager to learn new words. He is also using more basic social skills including eye contact, how to greet people, be polite and other similar tasks we often take for granted. When compared to where he was and where he is now it's not hard to be proud of Audei's accomplishments.

Recently Audei participated in a Wings for Autism event sponsored by Arc. It gave him the opportunity to practice routine airport tasks like checking in luggage, getting his boarding pass, going through security checkpoints, entering a real passenger plane, and sitting through a practice "flight" (we also got a chance to explore the terminal away from the group for a bit). He was perfect the entire time. Too bad the plane didn't leave the ground or even taxi out of the terminal. Still this told me he was ready to fly on a plane, and I had to find a way to make it happen.

What I would like to do is take Audei on a one day, round trip flight to a nearby city. Austin is a good choice as I have friends there who can pick us up and we can spend a few hours in the city. The problem is we are set squarely on a middle class income with me being the sole provider. To accomplish this trip it would cost well over $400 for the flight alone. That's generally our budget for taking the entire family on a little vacation road trip. In other words the costs are prohibitive.

That's where Indiegogo comes in. If any of you are interesting in helping a father out with giving his son with special needs a really special outing we would greatly appreciate it.


What We Need

A round trip flight to Austin for the two of us will cost approximately $450. Since Indiegogo has a minimum of $500 the plan is to put the extra money toward a fun activity to take Audei to. In all honesty we can do this with about $250-$275 and I can take care of the rest. So any contribution level we get would make a difference.

If we go beyond our goals any additional money would still go back into this trip in various ways. Here are what I figured we could do with the extra money:

- $150 more would easily get us a hotel for the night and make the adventure even longer. An additional $50 on top of that would secure a rental car.

- $150 on top of that would pay for a nice outing to someplace like Six Flags Fiesta Texas or Schlitterbahn water park in San Antonio (just an hour and a half from Austin). Lots of options in the area to check out. 

- $400 more would bump up our tickets to first class. 

Getting my son on that plane and giving him a chance to see the world thousands of feet above the ground is the real goal here. All this other stuff would just be icing on the cake.



The Impact

I have noticed a few things in our frequent trips to the airport. On a practical end it's a great way to entertain him for the price of parking. More importantly I saw an excitement in him every time we went there. He is much more aware of the world around him. He was soaking up all the sites and exploring every corridor and floor he could get to. He started to talk more and even socialize from time to time with people we never met before. These little adventures to the airport were opening him up to a wider awareness.

This trip is the next logical step to expand on this experience, which will likely open up even more cognitive awareness in him. This will be our first father/son trip, and this will make a good transitional step. There is no telling how he will react when up on the plane (cabin pressure changes, being confined to the seat, etc), and seeing how he deals with a short flight will prepare us for dealing with longer trips.


Risks & Challenges

Since I am only asking for a leg up in the expenses for taking Audei to Austin the risks to success for that are minimal. Unless airline ticket prices suddenly spike in the next few months your funding will successfully get him in the air. If for some reason prices do spike I am committed to using the funds exactly as described and will do what I can to cover the rest of the expenses on our own.

story: Campaign Pitch
story_txt: Campaign Pitch

story:
Why do we need your time?

During the regime of the Khmer Rouge in Cambodia,up to two million lives were claimed between 1975 and 1979 in what would be one of the worst mass killings of the 20th century.

Since then, the Cambodian educational system was dealt a severe setback. The Khmer Rouge’s hatred towards the middle class and educated caused a wave of tortures and execution of people who were suspected of belonging in these groups, including teachers. After the fall of Cambodia’s capital, Phnom Penh, thousands were executed. The consequences of this civil war are still visible: the educational system is still not optimal and too expensive for many poverty-stricken families.

This is where we come into play. Our vision is to open new doors for students living in poverty. The low wages their families earn are not sufficient to pay for their education, resulting in a high number of children without education. With no prospects of an academic and/or professional career, these children turn to illegal activities in hopes of becoming “high earners”. With drug dealers, sex workers and gamblers as their role models, youngsters are enticed into emulating the people involved in such activities and will remain trapped in the cycle of poverty. 

“Education allows individuals to think and act ethically, independently and critically. Who knows best how Cambodia should be shaped in the future, how to look at the present and how to learn from the past?

Cambodians themselves.”

They know what is best for their country and what is needed for improvement. By learning from the past, they can improve the country’s current state and start developing for the future. By aiding them in this process, we want to help redeveloping Cambodia.

So how are we going to do this? Simply by offering them the right tools for them to excel academically.  Davit Seng, one of the founders of the project is heading for Cambodia for an internship. Next to his internship he wants to find new ways to help young children with their ambitious dreams. This requires a lot of courage and a good education. By offering them the tools they need for education and showing them the faith we have in them will give them courage to follow their dreams.

As a group of bright-minded, well-intentioned individuals, we plan to execute a small project that contributes to the Khmers “kaa aprom”ការអប់រំ a.k.a. education. Help is needed and we invite everyone who has always wished to offer opportunities to the ones without one. If you appreciate what we are doing and want to support us in achieving this goal, don’t hesitate to donate to our cause or ask about other ways of helping.

The tools of education

Offering free education in Cambodia is already a difficult task, and any support is necessary to maintain a qualitative free education.

There are many ways to support students in Cambodia such as providing quality lectures (English) or providing resources which is where we focus on. During this project we collect monetary and non-monetary donations, which we can donate in the form of supplies to the school in Cambodia. This will minimize the risk of donations disappearing into the wrong pockets. 

The tools of education that we require are:

 -Packs of writing equipment, 2 blue pens 1 black pen, 2 pencils, a set of coloured pencils, a sharpener, an eraser, a marker, a notebook and an etui.

- Study books, the study books we provide are, mathematics, History, Languages books (English and Khmer)

- Art supplies, painting equipment, finger paint equipment, an extended supply of colored pencils

-Desktop computers

Stretch Goal!

We believe that children also need their own time to play, a school is not only a place to study but also a place to come together and create friends with same interests. By providing extra entertainment such as  sports equipment, children will have more motivation to attend classes on a weekly base. 

If we are able to reach the following goals we shall donate  extra sports equipments to the school.

·  With a collective bonus of $500,- we shall add a soccer ball (donate to unlock)

·  with a collective bonus of $1000,-  we shall add a rugby set (donate to unlock)

·  with a collective bonus of $2000,- we shall add a volleyball set (donate to unlock)

·  with a collective bonus of $5000,-  we shall add something super special (locked)

The school in Peam village

All of the donated supplies shall be donated to a school in Peam village.located an hour away from Siem Reap. This school is used by more than 300 local children each week. The school provides English classes, what has resulted in children speaking English fluently with ambitious plans to continue their studies and pursue a career beyond anything they imagined possible. Your donation will not give them the tools for these children, but also promotes the importance of quality education by providing the Cambodian society with well-educated children with new hopes and dreams. 

Our goal

We hope to provide all the students with the basics needs to support them during education. Even if we are not able to reach our full goal, we shall instead of offering each student a set, distribute loads of writing equipment and study material what will be shared between the students.

When we do reach our goal or even exceed this, we shall start looking for another school with similar qualitative education to support even more students in Cambodia

The meaning of donating

What are the odds? The odds to live with all the rights, just given?

All the basic needs are just in arms reach such as water, food and shelter. To even have the right to free education, the right to health, the right to freedom and protection and the right for our own identity. For a Cambodian child it is farfetched.

For those who have all their rights, are more likely to be unhappy duo to the fast paced circumstances, there are so many things that they have to do due to the high social demands.

I believe that those who are unhappy are stressing too much and to focused on their expectations that they tend to forget to enjoy their unique journey towards their own goals and dreams. One way to find out how special the journey really is.  Is to pause for a moment and become aware of your own surroundings, while gazing around, understand why others are not able to follow the same path. `Thinking` about why others are not able to follow is not enough, you have to `feel` why. Why are they so far behind?
 Because their rights are not given to them, they do not even know how to claim their rights! Show your support and inspire and motivate the children in poverty!

Give them the courage to claim their rights, and pursue their ambitious dreams!
Give them the courage to stay off the streets, and shape their own future!

How to help?

As a young child, it is easy to have ambitious dreams. Some may be too ambitious, but with a lot of courage nothing is impossible in this world. We want to show them the light in the dark. Because being born in poverty does not mean that their fate and destiny is already decided. A leap of faith and a qualitative education brings them on the right track.

-Post on our facebook page why and how these students can achieve more with proper education, some of the best motivational posts will be edited in one of our promotional video's and will be written on a large poster which shall be given to the school to inspire students.

-Donate a supply of pens or school supplies, if you happen to have a quite of unused pens or pencils or any other school related materials which can help students in Cambodia contact one of our members to find new owners for your materials.

-any monetary donation is welcome for our project, the more students we can help the closer we get to a brighter next generation.

Don't forget to like and or share our Facebook page!
