Our lacking school-based sex education, which mandates the stressing of abstinence in over half our U.S. states, paired with our cultural knack for social stigmatization has made sure of it. As women are taught to be sexually receptive, passive, and submissive, or, to “Just take it”, men are being socialized to sexually take charge, to “know everything”, to be emotionally detached, or, to “Just fake it”.These socially-prescribed, gendered sexual roles puts everyone in an often non-consensual and terribly misinformed place with sex. Socially and formally, we are teaching both youth and adults to keep their mouths shut when it comes to sex, with our very masculinity or femininity at stake. Modern sex education - learned through media, peers and government-funded school-based sex education - is teaching youth to be silent about sex unless the word spoken is simply  “NO”. However, young people are saying yes to sex. 73% of adolescents are having sex by the age of 19 and about one in seven teens have had sex before their 15th birthday. This gap between youth’s lived experience and the sex education available to them shuts down any opportunity youth have to engage in a dialogue about the role of sex in their real lives with the information they need to make consensual choices for themselves and with their partners. And the impact of this matters:Approximately 8 in 10 teen girls and 1 in 3 teen boys who had sex at age 14 or younger report that they either didn’t really want to have sex at the time, or had mixed feelings about having sex at the time.
A majority (53%) of millennials say that high schools are not doing enough to address the issue of sexual assault. 
Women between the ages of 16 and 24 are 4x more likely to be raped than women in other age groups.
Approximately 1 in 8 lesbian women and nearly half of bisexual women experience rape in their lifetime.
Nearly half of bisexual men and 4 in 10 gay men have experienced sexual violence in their lifetime.
A staggering 64% of transgender people have experienced sexual assault in their lifetime.
Researchers found that among 12 to 25 year olds in the Netherlands, where sexuality education begins in primary school and includes topics such a sexual diversity & sexual assertiveness training, most say they had  “wanted and fun” first sexual experiences. 
In contrast, 66 percent of sexually active American teens surveyed said they wished that they had waited longer to have sex for the first time.
Four in ten millennials say that school sex education classes were not helpful to them in making decisions about sex and relationships.73% are having sex. But is it consensual? Consent is about arriving at and saying an enthusiastic yes. Consensual sex is sexual activity that occurs with informed, enthusiastic agreement between each partner involved. Consent is an active, ongoing process that can be revoked or revised at any time. Consent can only be achieved via conversation and communication, by asking for permission and being granted that permission verbally. Consent is spoken. Consent is informed. Consent is verbal.If the sex education taught in schools is teaching our youth to be silent and uninformed about sex, we are teaching non-consensuality to our youth. If we are denying our youth accurate information about sex, we are teaching them to make misinformed decisions about sex.When we teach youth to never ask questions about themselves or others in regards to sex, we are teaching them to “just take it” and to “just fake it”. Consent-based sex education can break this cycle.#FUNDCONSENT aims to raise money to teach consent-based sex education workshops to teenaged youth, with no cost to their hosting school or organization. Our initial $5,000 goal will fund a semester-long series of consent-based sex education workshops at Lighthouse Holyoke, a newly-established, self-directed learning center for teens in Holyoke, Massachusetts. If more money than the goal is raised, consent-based sex education workshops will be offered to other interested, local high schools and youth organizations which will be tailor-made to their specific, sex educational needs.What is Consent-Based Sex Education?Consent-based sex education understands that sex is about so much more than inserting a Tab A into a Tab B. Consent-based sex education believes that sex is about relating, negotiating, and setting boundaries; that sex is about emotions, identities, self-care and sexuality; and that sex is about so much more than just sex. Therefore, our sex education should be about more than just the risks of or abstaining from sex. Consent-based sex education believes youth are entitled to the accurate and honest information they need to make safe and healthy decisions about themselves, their sexual identities, and their sexual and romantic experiences. And that consensual skills will make a lifelong positive impact.(At a consent for youth workshop I taught earlier this year, a youth participant shows off her 'consent cookie' made during our sugary activity that helps bring to life consent strategies learned earlier in the workshop)The goal of every consent-based sex education workshop is to meet youth where they’re at in their lives and relationships in an approachable & appropriate setting to help them break down the linguistic, mental & emotional barriers standing in the way of creating a culture of consensual communication at their schools, in their peer groups and for their future sexual explorations.This integrative approach to youth sex education isn’t new and boasts some of the world’s best outcomes when it comes to teen sexual health, happiness and behavior. Yet this type of sex education is simply not funded by the U.S. government nor is it taught in our traditional schools. As a self-directed learning center, Lighthouse Holyoke is in a unique position to offer this (optional) type of sex & sexuality education to their teens. As an independently-funded non-profit, Lighthouse Holyoke is also enthusiastic and grateful for self-funded educators offering their services to their students.Who Am I?My name is Yana Tallon-Hicks and I am a sex & sexuality writer and educator living in Northampton, MA. My work centers around the belief that pleasure-positive & consent-based sex education can positively impact our lives and the world.After receiving my undergraduate degree in a self-designed major of LGBTQ, youth education & sexuality studies from Hampshire College in 2008, I was trained by Dr. Carol Queen & Dr. Charlie Glickman in sexuality education in San Francisco, CA. I’ve been writing & educating about sex and sexuality, for both youth and adults, ever since. In 2017, I will be awarded my Masters Degree in Marriage & Family Therapy from Antioch University in the pursuit of becoming a practicing sex therapist in the Pioneer Valley.I have years of experience working with teenaged youth in leadership positions, having worked as both the co-director for Rowe Center’s Senior High Camp & the Youth Director for the Unitarian Society of Northampton & Florence. I believe that young people who are empowered with accurate information about, and receive trusted adult support around, their own experiences will make positive choices for themselves and others in their own lives. My workshops for youth and adults work to create a welcoming & comfortable space to explore and learn about crucial aspects of our holistic, sexual selves, using humor, normalization & relateability as primary teaching tools. My workshops for youth are tailored to be approachable & age-appropriate and focus on essential components of healthy sexuality and relationships for young people including consent, communication, safer sex & body-ownership. You can find out more about me on my website, YanaTallonHicks.com.Where Does Your Donation Go?Besides scoring you some awesome, consent-promoting, sex-positive perks (consent postcards! consent patches! safer sex kits! books!), your donation goes towards…
workshop materials, including take-home materials for youth such as basic safer-sex supplies & continued education materials like information packets & books. 
work-hours devoted to developing & teaching these workshops to youth. 



I am a self-employed sex educator & writer and make a modest living teaching what I know, what I love & what is making a difference. My typical workshop fees cover materials, advertising, workshop development, and teaching time, with little left over for my living expenses. I teach many workshops pro-bono throughout the year. Your donations make it possible for youth organizations like Lighthouse Holyoke and others to hire me to teach these workshops, a fee that is often uncoverable by grants & specified budget-lines. Crowdfunding makes it possible for youth to engage with progressive, consent-based sex education that is unavailable to them via traditional government funding & schooling.Low on the Dough? Other Ways You Can Contribute:
SHARE this IndieGoGo Campaign with both your personal and social media networks.
Use the HASHTAG #fundconsent to bring attention to the Campaign on Instagram & Twitter.
Follow #fundconsent’s social media journey on Facebook/y.tallonhicks, Instagram @the_vspot & Twitter @the_valleyvspot.
DONATE workshop materials such as paper, markers, and safer-sex supplies (trusted distributors only). Email y.tallonhicks@gmail.com to request the entire wishlist.
Send KIND WORDS of encouragement to y.tallonhicks@gmail.com. Free, simple, yet go a long way.

Thank you for reading. Thank you for sharing. Thank you for funding better sex education for youth.




GRATITUDE TO THOSE WHO DONATED PERKS TO #FUNDCONSENT
Beautiful postcard art/design by Sarah Jane Young (sarahjaneyoung7@gmail.com).
Keep it Consensual logo design by Patrick MacDonald.
Keep it Consensual & Canines for Consent patches by babegangpatches.
SEX: A book for teens: An uncensored guide to your body, sex, and safety by Nikol Hasler.
Good Clean Love organic cinnamon-vanilla lubricant.

story:
The Issue at Hand

Starting in the 8th grade, 50% of young black men in New Orleans will drop out.  

This population is feeding our prison system. How can kids make better choices if they don’t see better examples standing before them everyday.

Teachers are some of the most influential people in the lives of a student. So why don’t we treat them that way?  In this city, less than 3% of teachers are black men.  


Who we are

Brothers Empowered to Teach Initiative’s (BE2T) mission is to close the achievement gap for at-risk students by inspiring and incentivizing men of color to choose education as a career starting in New Orleans. Our vision is to inspire all children especially those at-risk to drop out, to expand their vision of success and defy the odds.


In 2012, co-founders Kristyna Jones and Larry Irvin created Brothers Empowered to Teach out of a passion to change the trajectory of the lives of at-risk students in New Orleans. Larry's own experience as a young black man growing up in the city and the countless losses of friends and peers to drugs, the streets, or dropping out  is one of the drivers to its creation.  The difference between Larry and his peers and friends was that he went on to graduate from college.   We decided that the best way to affect that trajectory was in the classroom--where students spend 8 hours (or more) a day 5 days a week. 

  

The Solution

BE2T recruits men of color to consider education as a career and enter the classroom with the tools each man needs to be impactful and prepared for the rigors of teaching.

We do this two ways:

•  The BE2T Fellowship- The Fellowship program is geared toward full-time enrolled college students . Participants are eligible beginning Sophomore year to be a part of our three year fellowship program.  

 •  The Change Track— The Change Track is specifically for men of color who may have already had a career in another profession, are older students returning to school, or are looking to change from their current career to education.

We designed a program that directly aims to engage and connect black men to careers in education. We examined other teacher exploration and preparation programs and decided that in order to turn the face of teaching on its head (85% of all teachers, are white, female and from the suburbs) we needed to start earlier while young men are in college to connect them to the idea--and getting them to buy in to teaching. 

Both programs culminate in certification and readiness for the classroom. 


The Impact

Black men need to start investing in the education of black men.  Young men of color need to see more men who look like them in front of the classroom. Over the next 5 years you will see Brothers Empowered to Teach bring 100 men of color to careers in the education space in New Orleans alone. Men in the classroom can have a profound effect on the academic trajectory of their students. According to the Center for American Progress, the relationship between the presence of African American teachers in schools and African American students success  showed significant impact on "time out of school" (discipline actions like suspension) and the percentage of students placed in special education versus gifted programs.  

We did a pilot last fall to see if we could recruit young black men to consider teaching. Since then, 40 young men have showed interest. We were only able to accept 7. Three have applied for teaching opportunities. None of these men was considering teaching. Now they are in the classroom. 

And the schools in New Orleans wanted our candidates yesterday. 


Risks & Challenges

There are two issues that keep black men from choosing the classroom. Black men don’t consider teaching and the programs that are out there are too short and insufficient in preparing and attracting teachers that are culturally competent.  First we have to attach them to the work. And then we have to train them to have the confidence to be an incredible teacher.  We will need to re-brand education as a career. 

The other challenge is competition from larger teacher preparation and teacher recruitment programs. All of these programs are looking for solutions to attract greater numbers of people of color--especially black men--to the classroom.  These programs have struggled mightily to find a solution.

We have seen from our pilot that by starting early, with discreet exposure to working children we can have a better chance of connecting college men to working in schools. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us by:

  • Spread the word about our campaign - Indiegogo has some great share tools.
  • Share our work with young men you think would be interested in the program.
  • Send us stories about men of color in the classroom who inspire (or have inspired) you.

story:
On June 13-28 2015, Myself and 39 other members of my church will head to Pine Ridge, South Dakota, one of the poorest areas in the US.  On this mission trip we will be doing different work projects, vacation bible schools, and helping out at the local church.  We will also be giving a hand to the homeless by giving them care packages filled with food and clothing.  We are teaming up with an organization called YWAM to help organize our work projects.

For me, Thomas Johnson, this is my third mission trip, my first was when I was in middle school and we went to downtown San Diego to get rid of graffiti and reach out to the homeless.  This past Thanksgiving I went down to Mexico with RBCPC to Door of Faith Orphanage to do a Vacation Bible School for the orphans there.  

This will be another life changing experience for me and my fellow students and leaders to help serve the people of South Dakota who desperately need our help.

The goal above is my ticket to go on this mission trip, however if I reach my goal and you still want to put money into our cause, other students do require financial aid.  So the extra money will go toward another student like myself.

story:
About the Tibetan Lotus Sutra Translation Project

  • The Sugatagarbha Translation Group is a team of translators dedicated to translating the classics of Buddhist literature into English, mostly from Tibetan but also from Chinese, Japanese, Sanskrit and Pali. For more about our work, see our official website, Buddha-Nature.com (http://www.buddha-nature.com)  
  • This campaign is designed to raise funds for the project of translating the Tibetan version of the Lotus Sutra (Saddharma Puṇḍarīka Sūtra) into English for the first time. We feel this is an important endeavor which will have a profound impact on the study and understanding of Tibetan, Mahayana and East Asian Buddhism. 
  • The tentative title for the book is The Tibetan Lotus Sutra: Lotsawa Yeshe De's Translation of the Saddharma Puṇḍarīka Sūtra, 
  • Those who contribute to this project will be directly contributing to one of the most exciting translations of a Buddhist scripture happening today, a translation which will have a far-reaching effect on the study and practice of Buddhism for millions of people, long into the future.
  • Visit the official website for the Tibetan Lotus Sutra Project at http://tibetanlotussutra.blogspot.com

Goals & Sponsor Rewards 

  • We are seeking a total of USD $42,750 as a provisional estimated goal for the project. This comes to $75 per page for 570 pages in the Tibetan book we are using for the translation. This is actually a very low rate by general professional standards in the field; note that presently some major sutra translation projects are asking for a rate of $250 per traditional Tibetan pecha page, pages which are also smaller than the modern book pages we are working with here. However, this low rate will at least cover the basic costs of time required for the project: an estimated 2000+ hours of translation and research work. 
  • The money raised for the project goes to the members of the Sugatagarbha Translation Group, in particular to the Tibetan-English translators, who will be the main ones working on the project, but also to the Sanskrit and Chinese translators for their skilled assistance.  
  • Everyone who donates to the project will be named in the final published version of the book in a special 'Sponsor's Section', as well as on the project's website. 
  • Those who donate more than $100 have the option of making their own words of dedication to be included in the final published version of the book in a special 'Sponsors' Dedication' section. 
  • Those who donate more than $1000 have the option of including their photo and other information along with a special expression of thanks from the Sugatagarbha Translation Group in the final published version of the book in a special 'Main Sponsors' section.   
  • No funds will be wasted because we will continue with this project regardless of how long it takes to raise the necessary funds.  

The Impact of the Tibetan Lotus Sutra Project

The translation of the Tibetan version of the Lotus Sutra into English is monumental for many reasons:

  • The Tibetan version translated from Sanskrit by Lotsawa Yeshe De in the late 700s CE being available to the English-reading public will shed significant light on a much-ignored aspect of one of the most important, influential and popular Mahayana Buddhist scriptures, and will unveil 'the Tibetan side of the Lotus Sutra' to millions of people around the world.  
  • It will add greatly to the field of comparative studies of the Lotus Sutra for those who cannot read Tibetan, showing how it compares to the Chinese and Sanskrit versions. 
  • It will raise many questions and encourage research about how the Lotus Sutra may have influenced Tibetan Buddhism.
  • It will increase interest in the Lotus Sutra for the Tibetan Buddhist world, which may have a significant impact on various aspects of the traditions.
  • It will hopefully foster increased mutual interest and inter-religious dialogue between the East Asian (Chinese, Korean, Japanese) and North Asian (Tibetan, Mongolian, Bhutanese) Buddhist traditions. 
  • Most importantly, the translation of the Tibetan Lotus Sutra will increase interest and raise awareness about the Lotus Sutra throughout the world generally, and will thus contribute to the spread of its profound and inspiring teachings.   

Learn More about the Lotus Sutra 

  • The Wikipedia article (flawed as it is, it gives a general overview): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lotus_Sutra
  • A guide to Lotus Sutra resources available online by Venerable Kongmu: https://kongmu.wordpress.com/lotus-sutra-resources
  • A PDF of the translation from Kumarajiva's Chinese version by Tsugunari Kubo and Akira Yuyama (one of the best translations, the rest are listed below in our order of preference): http://www.bdk.or.jp/pdf/bdk/digitaldl/dBET_T0262_LotusSutra_2007.pdf
  • A PDF of the translation from the Chinese version by Burton Watson: http://www.english.fgs2.ca/sites/default/files/pdf/The%20Lotus%20Sutra.pdf
  • A PDF of the translation from the Chinese version by Bunno Kato: http://www.rk-world.org/publications/ThreefoldLotusSutra.pdf
  • In addition, the translations by Senchu Murano and Gene Reeves respectively (both from Chinese) are two of the better English translations. Here is a PDF of the introduction to Reeves' translation: http://www.wisdompubs.org/sites/default/files/preview/Lotus%20Sutra%20Book%20Preview.pdf 
  • For those who can read Tibetan, here is a PDF of the Tibetan version which we are translating: http://www.fodian.net/world/tibet/The%20White%20Lotus%20Sutra.pdf

Other Ways You Can Help the Project 

  • Share the link to this project on social media. 
  • Share the link to the project's website: http://tibetanlotussutra.blogspot.com 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this project with people who might be interested. 
  • Tell your friends and associates about the Tibetan Lotus Sutra Project.

The Wikipedia article (flawed as it is, it gives a general overview): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lotus_Sutra

A guide to Lotus Sutra resources available online by Venerable Kongmu: https://kongmu.wordpress.com/lotus-sutra-resources

A PDF of the translation from Kumarajiva's Chinese version by Tsugunari Kubo and Akira Yuyama (one of the best translations, the rest are listed below in our order of preference): http://www.bdk.or.jp/pdf/bdk/digitaldl/dBET_T0262_LotusSutra_2007.pdf

A PDF of the translation from the Chinese version by Burton Watson: http://www.english.fgs2.ca/sites/default/files/pdf/The%20Lotus%20Sutra.pdf

A PDF of the translation from the Chinese version by Bunno Kato: http://www.rk-world.org/publications/ThreefoldLotusSutra.pdf

In addition, the translations by Senchu Murano and Gene Reeves respectively (both from Chinese) are two of the better English translations. Here is a PDF of the introduction to Reeves' translation: http://www.wisdompubs.org/sites/default/files/preview/Lotus%20Sutra%20Book%20Preview.pdf 
For those who can read Tibetan, here is a PDF of the Tibetan version which we are translating: http://www.fodian.net/world/tibet/The%20White%20Lotus%20Sutra.pdf




Other Ways You Can Help the Project   Share the link to this project on social media. 
Share the link to the project's website: http://tibetanlotussutra.blogspot.com 
Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this project with people who might be interested. 
Tell your friends and associates about the Tibetan Lotus Sutra Project.

story:
The members of the robotics club of the Secondary Technical School in Sombor have been invited to travel to Archimedes, the 18th International Inventions and Innovative Technology Salon in Moscow, which will be held 2-5 April, 2015.

We have been informed by the Inventors Association of Vojvodina that the contest `Innovation Potential of Youth` will be held within the framework of the International Inventions and Innovative Technologies Salon Archimedes and that our students, members of the Robotics club, have been invited to participate in it with their award-winning project Robotic hand - The Thing.

The Secondary Technical School in Sombor is the largest school in the district. The Robotics club instructors Marijana Bogdanović and Srđan Pavić have had a lot of success and have won several awards at national and international events. During the past school year, the club was attended by six students: Nikola Trivić (now a successful student, a scholar of The Faculty of Computer Science in Belgrade), Dario Šarčević, Miloš Stambolija, Stefan Lančuški, Nitaj Ađanel and Zoran Popić. Working together they have created a robotic hand within the project Robotic hand- The Thing.


This project received numerous awards including the first place at the Festival of robotics and interface technologies "Robo-Int Invent" in 2014, the first prize at the Festival of student work of engineering schools in Vojvodina in 2014, the Gold Plaque at the Tesla Fest 2014. At Tesla Fest they received the diploma for the best innovative project by the University of Technology Volga in the Russian Federation.

The main aim of this club is to promote science and encourage creativity in young people. Due to fostering teamwork and acceptance of initiatives, the club is attracting more and more students (there are 12 members in this school year). In addition to these awards, the members of the club previously won other awards: the first prize at the Festival of Robotics and interface technologies "Robo-Int Invent" in 2013, the second place at the first Olympics of technical creativity of the young from South Eastern Europe in 2013, a student and an instructor received diplomas and awards for outstanding results achieved in competitions which was awarded by the Government of the Autonomous Province of Vojvodina in 2013.

We would be very grateful for your financial contribution to help cover the expenses of the trip to Moscow for our students and instructors who want to present the Robotic Hand at the "Innovation potential of youth" contest. Your financial assistance will help our students and their instructors to go to this prestigious competition.

Thank you in advance

story:
Nothing directly affects our health, wellness and longevity more than the water we drink, cook and shower with.

They're dumping what into our water ?!

Fluoride Chemicals (Hydrofluorosilicic Acid, Sodium Fluorosilicate and Sodium Fluoride), are Toxic Waste by-products from Phosphate Fertilizer/Aluminum Manufacturing, and classified as Poisonous, Highly Toxic, Hazardous Waste.

      

So corrosive it eats through concrete and Hazmat suits must be worn to handle it, yet it's still being sold to water departments and dumped into our water.                     We're told it's healthy for us to swallow in a glass of water but then again toothpaste companies are forced to warn us to call a Poison Control Center if we swallow the equivalent dose in toothpaste. ???                                                                                          

It's affecting everybody's health and well-being. Harvard School of Medicine links Fluoride to Reduced Children's IQ, Improper Brain Development and Cognitive Disorders. The Lancet Medical Journal classifies it as a Harmful Neurotoxin like Lead, Arsenic and Mercury. Studies link it to Thyroid, Kidney & Gastrointestinal        

Problems, Increased Bone Fractures, Pineal Gland Calcification, Accelerated Aging & numerous Degenerative Diseases.

Even top advocates admit its benefits are from topical application, not ingestion. Furthermore, its high toxicity to humans, animals & the environment far outweighs any remotely possible benefit from drinking it! It's thyroid suppressing effects made it an ideal prescribed drug for Hyperthyroidism in Europe and South America for decades. In essence, Water Fluoridation forces people to drink, cook & shower with toxic, medicated water, and, once in the water supply, it ends up in our fruit,     vegetables, processed food and drinks, tying into why 41% of American Children 

   age 12 -15 have Dental Fluorosis. If this is the visible outside clue of what Fluoride is doing to the body, what do you think is happening on the inside?                                                                                   

Would you agree this Highly Toxic Industrial Waste by-product has absolutely no business being Intentionally Dumped into the Water Supply of the People?

Even Salmon have the perceptive and discerning intelligence of avoiding fluoride...sadly to the point of endangering their own existence, as they will not swim upstream when fluoride ions are present in the river from fluoridated city water runoff or industrial pollution, and thus never complete their yearly breeding cycle.

 

 

How do we put an end to this?

Ending water fluoridation happens through "grass roots" efforts by the people working with City Council Leaders to STOP. Whether officials stop due to the         corrosion fluoride chemicals cause water pipes and infrastructure or because they realize it has the same corrosive effect on People and our Pets, the People have the power to make it happen.

Israel banned fluoridation. So have hundreds of cities worldwide.                 

Please help us make it happen in Austin, Texas.

                                 

   

How?

          

To get this message out to the masses, our goal is to raise over $10,000 to purchase plenty of network airtime to repeatedly air the "Help Get the F Out!" PSA (Public Service Announcement) on Television in Austin. The 60 second PSA with Actor/Environmentalist Ed Begley Jr., was created for Television to open

   people's eyes about fluoride's harmful effects on people and the environment. It also directs viewers to 3 important sites: a) FluorideAlert.org to get all the facts about fluoride, b) FluorideProtection.org to get everything they need to detoxify and

     protect themselves from Fluoride, and to c) FluorideFreeAustin.com, the Austin,Texas Fluoride Awareness Group led by Rae Nadler-Olenick and Linda Greene, who are leading the way to end fluoridation in Austin. In conjunction with this campaign launch, the PSA will be airing on the Dr. Oz show on KTBC Fox 7 everyday for 2 weeks in Austin. Your sponsorship will help us continually air this PSA on TV in Austin throughout 2015 to create more aware citizens to urge officials to end the fluoridation program. A victory in Austin will have a major domino effect for other cities getting this poison out of their community's water.                                                               
As a Thank you to YOU...
For your help we'll send you some great gifts, known here as "perks," that support overall health and well being... samples of all natural, fluoride-free toothpastes and oral care products, powerful, nutrient dense superfoods that support optimal health & help defend the body from fluoride, amazing all natural detoxification products, and other related gifts. 

Help make a lasting Impact in people's lives.

Awareness is key.Your contribution helps create awareness to change lives. Even if city officials delay ending fluoridation, the awareness created by continually airing PSAs on TV is sufficient to change people's lives. When people find out about fluoride and avoid it their lives change. For example, mothers who become aware                   may then consciously protect their children from consuming fluoridated water and products and thus allow their creative brains to develop their potential. The benefits to everyone are endless for creating more awareness and speeding the end of water fluoridation...less aging, less degenerative disease, less cancer, less birth defects. less neurological disorders, less bone disease, the list goes on and on.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially, please help by promoting the campaign through your social media outlets. Please share the PSA with people, please like the Help Get the F Out! Facebook page and share FluorideAlert.org and FluorideProtection.org with people. Thank you!

story:
Who We Are

TEACH is dedicated to preserving and cultivating an understanding of Afrikan and Afrikan-American lifestyles by presenting family oriented cultural and performing arts activities. TEACH is an outgrowth of Sudan Illustrators, Inc- a non profit organization. Sudan Illustrators, Inc. began in the early 1980's but later branched out under various entities including NGOMA In Motion (NIM) and the Progressive Emporium & Education Center which houses the Frances Jarnegan Afrikan-American Library. These entities have been combined under a co-ordinated umbrella of services now known as TEACH.

  • Our campaign seeks to raise $7,000 as seed funding to expand our work in the St. Louis metropolitan area.
  • We are  committed to the cultural education, upliftment and empowerment of the Afrikan-American community
  • With your help we will literally impact scores of families in our community

What We Need & What You Get

Through concerted efforts, TEACH members also sponsor educational, culturally enriching programming such as: Juneteenth ~ Afrikan Freedom Days activities, Masanyiko ya Utani, annual Kwanzaa programs, the Kwanzaa House at the Holiday Expo, community-based literacy activities, nutrition/wellness classes, Afrikan language classes, Afrikan folktale festivals, Afrikan drumming and dancing classes, youth leadership and organizing training, and much, much more.

For your much appreciated contribution you will receive our gratitude and  one of several perks including but not limited to gift certificates from the Progressive Emporium & Education Center, prominent mention on our website, invitations to our events and activities designed expressly for our donors


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may wholeheartedly support our efforts but may not be able to contribute at this time. There are other ways to help:

  • Ask your friends and family to get the word out about what we hope to accomplish
  • Feel free to share our campaign with your contacts on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google Plus and any other social network
  • Shop at Progressive Emporium & Education Center
  • Book NGOMA In Motion to perform for you or your organization

Again, we are eternally grateful for your help.  Asante Sana (Thank you very much)!

story:
Short Summary

Dr. Russell Johnson, a licensed psychologist, has worked with adolescents and adults on the autism spectrum for over 30 years. During that time he developed a program that helps those with ASD learn, remember, and incorporate positive social concepts and behaviors in their everyday lives. His program is called the ICONz® Curriculum and it uses Character Stories, Social Concept Cues and group interaction to teach those with ASD crucial life navigation skills.

This program has been very effective with individuals and with groups and has been implemented in middle and high schools in the Pittsburgh area with great success.

To make the ICONz® Curriculum even more effective, all it needs now is a series of graphic novels to reinforce what the students are already learning. That's where you come in.

We need your help funding the development of our first graphic novel.

Why a graphic novel?

There are relatively few strategies that really work when teaching social skills to those with autism, and the ICONz® Curriculum already incorporates almost all of them. However, since students with ASD tend to be highly visually oriented, comic books or graphic novels are especially effective teaching tools.

Our immediate goal is to produce a series of graphic novels that expand on the skills already taught through the ICONz® Curriculum but that can also be used as stand-alone materials by parents, teachers, social workers, counselors, and anyone else involved in the lives of those on the autism spectrum.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make our vision a reality, we will need a graphic artist and story editor who can bring the novels to life. After the artist and story editor have completed their work, there will be the added expense of publishing and disseminating the novel. The estimated cost for our first novel will be $5,000, which includes about $2,000 for the artist, $1,000 for the story editor, and $2,000 for publishing and dissemination.

Should we not meet our financial goal, the money you donate will go towards funding at least part of what we hope to achieve. 

We have special perks for everyone who contributes. Check them out on the right side of this page.

The Impact

The ICONz® Curriculum is already making a huge impact on students with autism. Consider what one parent has to say about how the ICONz® Curriculum has helped her son:

"This program has enabled him to recognize social situations that would typically be problematic and to participate more appropriately. I know this is just the beginning and he will continue to see positive results. My fear was that he was doomed to a life of social awkwardness and isolation. Every time he tells me how he succeeded in a social situation, I am reminded of how I felt when I saw him take his first steps. So obviously, I am a huge fan and extremely on-board with the ICONz® program."

-Sarah 

We can only imagine how much more impacting the Curriculum can be when we add graphic novels.

Risks & Challenges

Our main challenge right now is having enough funds to follow through with this venture. We realize we may not reach our goal, but every dollar you contribute counts towards our ability to help more and more children on the autism spectrum improve the quality of their lives. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you contribute financially or not, please help us by spreading awareness of the campaign. Share our campaign link on your Facebook page, Tweet about it to your Twitter followers and mention it on your blog. Reach out to others who might be interested in seeing us succeed in helping students on the Spectrum!

story:
What is Dream Clowd?

Dream Clowd is a Start Up that wants to modernize the way Anime is distributed to Spanish speaking audiences in North and South America. Anime has been available in the market since the 80's and streaming services have emerged only within the last decade but there is a lag in service for Spanish speakers, a problem that is key to our project. 
Our aim is to create the best Anime streaming service in Spanish in North and South America. 
  • Dream Clowd started at 3 Day Start Up (3DS) in Austin, TX.
  • We are bootstrapping this project and we need the help of people like you that are passionate about new technology. 

Help us kickstart our fundraising efforts by joining our campaign, sharing with your friends, and pledging your support.

What We Need & What You Get

Our project is in an early stage and  your support will go towards the following:
  • We are raising $100, 000 that will be utilized as seed funding for the project. 
  • Developing a better website that will host our streaming services. 
  • Paying for hosting fees. 
  • Patrons that contribute and register through Indiegogo.com  will  get early access to the service.
  • In addition to early access your contribution will grant you membership and special member discounts. 

The Impact

You have the potential to kick start a company. By signing up you will achieve the following:

  • Your donation will  speed up the launch date! Yay!
  • You will get into the VIP list
  • Meeting our fundraising goal will ensure the project remains on track.
  • By bootstrapping we eliminate the need to bring in 3rd parties that might not be beneficial to the project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are exited that you are interested in our company and thank you for your support. Here are other ways you can help:
  • Talk about us, tell your friends, and spread the excitement!
  • You can also share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter and don't forget to follow us for the latest updates. 

Thank you! :D

story:
Get the perks after this campaign closed on our new campaignpage! 

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/goggo-story-cards-developing-creativity/x/12298395


EVERYONE HAS A STORY TO TELL!

The Goggo Story Cards are an inspirational toolbox for creativity! It doesn’t matter if you are 4 or 40 – you will be just as excited to see how good a storyteller you can be if you just get a helping hand! With the practically unlimited combinations of cards the box will never run out of new thrilling stories while you, your family and friends develop your creativity skills!

ONE FOR ME - ONE FOR A REFUGEE CHILD. In order to spread the potential of the Story Cards to those who really would benefit the most, for every sold box of Story Cards, one will also be given to a refugee child. 

INVENTION FOR CREATIVITY. Working with non-formal eduction Åsa have seen that creativity can not only develop people, but ultimately even change the world – ranging from making children reflect on injustice to the toppling of dictatorships. But she realized that sometimes creativity needs a helping hand and so she developed the Goggo Story Cards as a way to practice creativity and grow in confidence. Since then she has teamed up with Ismet, a Bosnian designer and social entrepreneur, and for the last two years they have worked passionately with developing the perfect set!

How to do it? It's simple! You just flip a card from each category:  WHO; WHERE; WHAT and HOW to find the inspiration to make up your own story. Run out of ideas? Just flip the next card, and the next - or ask your friend to continue!  The box also comes with several instructions for creativity challenges; storytelling in group, charades, guessing games - all to stimulate creativity while having fun! 

"...but already after a few weeks on his space travel he began to feel lonely and decided to write a letter, as message in a bottle for outer space ...". How would you continue?


A TOOLBOX FOR CREATIVITY

The Goggo Story Cards Box (L)

A set of 140 cards in 4 categories inside a beautiful wooden box that will never run out of stories. The cards are ready but only with the funds raised in this campaign we will be able to produce the box and make this creativity tool a physical reality!

Travelpack: Goggo to go  (S)

This is a smaller version of the Goggo Story Cards with 52 cards in 4 categories - perfect for the bus ride! The travel pack is already in production and will make it out before Christmas to early backers!  



THE GOGGO VISION

A toolbox to develop your creativity! Every time you create a story your associations will come to you faster and your confidence will grow.

One box - several creativity games. Use the cards for with friends and family of all ages to do;

 · Storytelling challenges in a group

· Charades/pantomime

· Creating your own song lyrics

· Plot making for writing, film or cartoons

· Guessing games

· Creating your own game!

From passive consumer to active creator. Instead of listening to a story you start telling or playing it yourself. Instead of being bound by a book, the cards can be picked up and played with.

Minimalism for maximal creativity. To not hamper the creativity of the storyteller we made the cards minimalistic, without cultural references or too much individual character. We often made over ten versions of each card to get them just right! The cards are also language neutral as they only use images – only the instructions are in English (for now!)

Durability and usability. We want to put the cards in a wooden box to keep out on the sofa table all the time.  As it will last for generations, even if a card or two goes missing, it is good for the environment too!

An educational tool. Teachers, drama/music pedagogues as well as speech therapists, psychologists, team builders and evaluators have given us input along the way. Here a taste of the pedagogical potential of the Story Cards:

* Write a story from four Story Cards (Language teaching)

* In pairs, pick two “who” cards and make a story about friendship, injustice or bullying…. (Reflections on feelings, community etc)

The cards can also for example be used for icebreakers, address group challenges or evaluations.

One for me – one for you. Creativity and story telling is about sharing – which is why one set of 26 cards will be given to a refugee child for every package of Story Cards sold, starting with Syrian children coming trough Europe. The cards will be distributed starting from January 2015 and our first cooperation partner is a local Bosnian NGO where the Goggo Designer Ismet is active. 

RISKS

1. Will we manage to get the money together to produce a wooden box for the large version of the Story Cards and keep retail price low enough by a large production order quantity?

2. Goggo to go (S) will be sent to you 2 weeks before X-mas at the latest. If the postal service messes up delivery and it does not reach you in time for X-mas, let us know and we can send you a digital gift card in the meantime!

CROWDFUNDING FOR CREATIVITY

The Story Cards have got innovation funding, friends have donated their time and expertise and we have invested as much time, effort and money as possible. Now we need your help!

Help us spread this campaign by sharing it on social media and telling friends! Check out the perks and get inspired! 

And stay in touch! Don´t hesitate to contact Åsa on asa@gunven.eu.

THANK'S FOR JOINING THIS CAMPAIGN TO SPREAD CREATIVITY!

A special thanks goes to some special people that have made this possible:)

Thanks to Naida Begovic for contribution to illustrations, to Jasmin Tairovski for working on the wooden box prototypes, to Ida and Johan for film production and Cristofer Odqvist for sound! And all other friends for feedback, support and ideas!

those who really would benefit the most, for every sold box of Story Cards, one

have seen that creativity can not only develop people, but ultimately
even change the world – ranging from making children reflect on injustice to
the toppling of dictatorships. But she realized that sometimes creativity needs
a helping hand and so she developed the Goggo Story Cards as a way to practice
creativity and grow in confidence. Since then she has teamed up with Ismet, a
Bosnian designer and social entrepreneur, and for the last two years they
have worked passionately with developing the perfect set!

story:
What happens when we fail to help the most vulnerable youth in our community? We fail the future of our community, our children, and grandchildren. Flying Unlimited has worked hard over the last 15 years to solve this problem. Striving to offer youth programming to engage the next generation is amazing and exhilarating work. Time and time again, we see teens unable to participate, from families who simply cannot find the funding. As a company, we have offered countless scholarships to help. We are still unable to help as many teens as we would like.

The workshop operates at a cost of $157 per student per workshop day, which includes six months of accountability mentoring, and a healthy lunch for participants. Many families could use help from our community. In turn, you get to change the landscape of the future by igniting the next generation.  You will showing them the community cares, they are important, and they will not be forgotten. Together we can help 1000 teens to design a life they love.

Flying Unlimited Inc. is a social enterprise providing youth with a life changing workshop series called “Life Proofing Your Teen.” Today’s teenagers, when starting high school are all too willing to sacrifice who they are as a person to “fit in.” Flying Unlimited Inc. works with youth so they are willing to sacrifice fitting in, not only to be who they are as a person, but to be able to create a future with passion and live into a life they love.  The core principles of the workshops are communication, teamwork, self-esteem, confidence, goal setting, and personal accountability.

This series has a 15 year history. An independent 10 year social study was conducted to find the impact of the series on 400 at-risk youth from all walks of life.  The study demonstrated even 10 years post program, there is a profound impact during, immediately after, and long-term.  The long-term impact found 96% of participant using their skills acquired from this program in work, with family, and socially. Increased confidence, higher academic grades, better family life, and better communication is just a glimpse of the benefits of the "Life Proofing Your Teen" Program. (Copy of Social Study can be requested directly from our website).

Thank you for your time, support, and showing you care!

story:
The Participation Program II

The original interview on the Leak Project channel provides information on the original Participation program with an overview of the requirements to produce a personal evaluation that consists of a 1 hour presentation of 3 subjects with an application for Android or iOS cell phones and when used with the instructional videos will produce images that will reveal what is hiding in plain sight.

The Leak Project Interview https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wUqbCHeTk94

Ask Yourself

Would you like the opportunity to confirm or deny if an inhabited world is hiding in plain sight, and would you like to know if you or your loved ones possess a visible mark of an inheritance, or are marked with a curse, and would you like to review a solution that everyone can use to change their fate?

If the answer is yes to any of the 3 questions above, please read the following and click on the links to view the video samples or download pdf (requires Acrobat or pdf reader software) files of the subjects.

There is an Inhabited World – Hiding In Plain Sight – The Living Creatures

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=41e4p4Z9g44

Extended Version – More Images – You Won’t Believe Your Eyes

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UtVAE_iutP0

 

Who Are You – Do You Have an Inheritance or a Curse?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y9xlmtCufn0

Extended Version – The Marks Sample

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vmqhrn9a4RI

The Marks – SAMPLE

http://freepdfhosting.com/b1e96d56d6.pdf

Smithsonian – Can You Identify Your Ancestry?

http://freepdfhosting.com/71c6044054.pdf

Secret of the Mirror – SAMPLE 

http://freepdfhosting.com/d773918347.pdf

 

The Solution – Everyone Can Use

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LOb6v1hbIf8

Extended Version – The Secret of Light

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LOb6v1hbIf8

 

The Course Design

http://freepdfhosting.com/40a0cbc8ba.pdf

 

Who Am I

I am the honored presenter and this is a link to the original Leak Project interview.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wUqbCHeTk94

Campaign Purpose

The campaign is designed to produce an application for consumers of the present and subsequent generations that prefer handheld communication with computing power, photographic capabilities, applications and is not a computer, laptop, or tablet.

Campaign Mission

To Continue the Participation program to fund the development to convert our application to Android (1st Stage) and Apple (2nd Stage) smartphones. The Android and Apple cell phones provide the preferred technology of choice to deliver to everyone an all-in-one application that will reveal what is hiding in plain sight.

Campaign Results - Original

The original campaign results (click here), required adjustment to the perk that would provide a software solution that Participants could install on their Windows PC or Mac computer to process images and reveal what is hiding in plain sight.

Campaign Participant II

This release of the Participation Program II provides the opportunity to receive the downloadable package of Alternative Software, Video Instructions and Reference Guides.

Campaign Participant II – Goals

The original campaign realized 13%, and allows the production of the Presentation Videos and release of the Alternate Software Application with the Introduction, plus Instructional Videos and Reference Guides for everyone that missed the first opportunity.

Campaign Participant – Benefit

The Board of Directors has approved that if the remaining slots are filled for the Participation II Program, which would allow approval in producing the Android application, and upon its completion all Registered Participants would receive a download license for the Android application for their personal use for review and evaluation.

NOTE: To provide the Apple iOS application would require the second stage of development, and Campaign to provide the ICU application for Apple iOS handheld devices, and prevents the project in offering the free upgrade to Participants for the Apple iOS.

Release Date of the Participation Program – November 29, 2016

Registered Participants from the original and Campaign II will receive an email with instructions to access and download the Software, Video Instructions, and Reference Guides.

The Participation Program-Purpose

The alternative image software for installation on either a Windows PC or a Mac computer and instructional videos for each subject to demonstrate before and after results to compare with the reference guide for review and evaluation.

SUMMARY

Explanation of the Fundraising Project - What Participants Receive

The Special Edition purpose and goals summarized for information

a. The opportunity to secure a participation slot.

b. Participants receive the 1 hour Special Edition, 30 minute Video Instruction, Reference Guide used with the Software Application*

c. The Participation fee covers the cost of Studio, Editing, Graphics, Rights, and delivery.

d. The funds are paid to a recognized nonprofit, and public charity, managed by a Board of Directors.

e. The funds in Participation II are allocated for licenses, video, and remote production.

*The Software Application for installation on a Windows PC or a Mac computer.

The Special Edition communicates Knowledge, Wisdom, & Understanding that everyone can achieve.

The Introduction Video provides information on a gift that everyone has, and how it can be used to make the best choices in life and will include an additional subject in the release for Participants.

The Presentation Videos of each subject are designed to present the hypothesis with its argument, and the user can compare it with recognized scientific, and historical references that explain the statement of the hypothesis and define the observation.

The Instructional Videos of each subject provide a guide to produce the best results with each photograph and after transferring them to a Windows PC or Mac computer with the image software installed, the images can be processed and reveal what is hiding in plain sight.

 

The Participation Program II is the Invitation to learn, see, and understand

Participants will be able to reserve one of the remaining Participation Reservations to receive the Special Edition as follows;

Overview of the 1 Hour Program

Video Introduction - The Explanation of Our Existence - The Speck – The Wits +

The Explanation of the 3 Subjects & What Participants Will Learn

An Inhabited World is Hiding in Plain Sight

Would You Like The Opportunity to Photograph - What Is Hiding In Plain Sight?

Photographs have been captured of legendary-mythological living creatures from the writings of antiquity, and participants can produce photographic evidence with their camera, or cell phone camera and using the Software Application.

The Mark of Inheritance, The Mark of the Curse

Do You Possess The Mark of the Inheritance or The Mark of the Curse?

Mankind has lost the knowledge of their heritage, because it has been replaced with an identity, and categorized by race to disguise their origin to prevent them the opportunity to change their fate. 

Participants will be able to use the scientific method of the Smithsonian to learn who they are, and their camera, or cell phone camera with the Software Application to reveal if they possess an inheritance or a curse.

The Solution Everyone Can Use

Would You Like To Defeat Death & Remove Its Claim On Your Soul?

The mystery is revealed in the writings of antiquity and the instructions are provided to Participants on how to cleanse their flesh with the light of the sun, by using the optimum position to drive darkness out of their bodies that will remove death's claim of their soul/spirit, which is revealed in these writings as their reward. The Software Application is used with the image produced by a camera or cell phone camera to measure the results they achieve compared to the Reference Guide that will provide photographic evidence of their success.

Summary

The Special Edition communicates Knowledge, Wisdom, & Understanding that everyone can achieve.

The Benefits of the Participation Program

There is a contentious line drawn between science and the recorded history of religion, separating believers and non-believer and offered an opportunity for an interdisciplinary research that could apply the tools of science to disprove or verify the claims of the humanities.

The Participation Program

The Special Edition is a 3 subject presentation that allows everyone to evaluate the hypothesis, review the references, and by following the instructions in the use of the software application to produce photographic evidence for their personal review and consideration.

How Was the Program Formed?

A multidisciplinary research was required to develop a methodology that was simple to present with recognized sources that everyone can use to reacquire this lost knowledge by combining the references of antiquity and comparing the results they will produce.

The Evaluation Framework

The development required the disciplines of science and the participation of the humanities to evaluate the results of the investigation, and produce a presentation that would allow everyone to use their personal knowledge and experience and compare the recognized references and reproducible evidence they will produce.

Summary of the Journey

The journey to this time in the present has required 3-decades of exhaustive investigation, and the commercial development and availability of handheld devices that possess computing power are available to the public and allows everyone to photograph and confirm-what is hiding in plain sight.

The Impact

If everyone used The Solution, according to the writings of antiquity, then death could not claim the remaining souls of mankind.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can get the word out and share what you have read to help those who seek answers to the difficult questions and you can easily use the Indiegogo share tools!

story: ----

To grow our efforts at providing economic opportunities for Malawian women, Tiwale has acquired a plot to construct an education center. This center will provide secondary school education classes and further vocational skills training for the women of Ntsiriza Community, Malawi.

Project Women’s Center for Education and Entrepreneurship

Our goal is to construct a space for education and entrepreneurship for women in Malawi. In the past, we have given school grants for women to return to school, however, two challenges were reported:

  1. The schools were located in far communities and so participants could not afford and spare the time for the commute.
  2. Their classmates in the schools were younger children which was embarrassing and discouraging. 

The education center is targeted as a space for women of all ages who were forced to leave school early due to varied circumstances. 

Tiwale will hire a teachers that will provide daily evening classes at a time feasible for the women of the community. The classes will vary ranging from sciences, humanities, languages and the arts. The goal is to aid our participants towards the Malawi Secondary Certificate of Education (MSCE).

Our timeline:

  • August-September: Purchase plot for construction of education center
  • September: Cost calculations and team building
  • October-November: Fundraising and sells of vocational skills training products
  • December 2015: Commence construction of education center
  • February/March 2016: Launch classes!!

We are sourcing collaborations with organizations that recycle hardware so as to contract a donation for computers. We intend to host computer training summer camps, weekly art studio space popups and biweekly health education gatherings. With these activities together, we hope to empower 200 women annually. 

Moreover, as the space we purchased already has a small home in need of repairs. We want to improve this structure and turn it into a refuge for women who are temporarily homeless.

Project budget:

Our budget for the full completion of the center which includes a classroom, refuge home, office space and community store is US$15,000.  (Budget Breakdown below)

 The Challenge

By GDP per capita, Malawi is the world’s poorest country. According to the International Fund for Agricultural Development, 74 per cent of the Malawian population lives below the income poverty line of US$1.25 a day. Most families cannot afford to finance their children’s education which ranges between $30 and over annually. At secondary school age, only 33% of the sum that should be enrolled in secondary school education is attending school. From this 33%, only 42% are girls. Most girls marry early in exchange for dowry; payment from the husband’s family. With the infrequency of social mobility in Malawi, her daughter and her daughter’s daughter often face the same fate: early marriage and insufficient schooling. Over time this vicious cycle has created a substantial population of women who are undereducated, jobless and facing extreme poverty.

Our Approach

Tiwale means, “let us shine/glow,” in Chichewa. Tiwale was set up as a youth-led community based organization to empower Malawian women by providing economic opportunities through leadership workshops, micro-finance loans, vocational skills training and education grants.  

Tiwale started with a team of five youth ranging from 14 to 19 years old. The goal was to design a business education training program that was to be followed by micro-loans to fellow young women in poverty. The intended prototype was 10 women for the education program and 4 women to start businesses. The response however was tremendous with a surprise attendance of 150 women in the education program and a selected 12 women to initiate the micro-business program.  

To date, Tiwale has grown training 150 women in the business education programs, guiding 40 women to start businesses via micro-loans and another 50 women undergoing a vocational skills training program. The goal has been to promote the education of women and so with selling of fabrics made in the training program, Tiwale secured US$2,500 to purchase a plot of land to build an education center. With this space, we will provide secondary school education classes and further vocational skills development for the women in Ntsiriza community.

Other ways to participate:

  1. Shop and support by purchasing fabrics made in our vocational skills training program via our online store!
  2. Organize a donation. We need computers, lab equipment, first aid kits, books, art supplies and school supplies such as bags, stationary and boards.
  3. Volunteer and teach a vocational skill.
  4. Sponsor the salary of a teacher 
  5. Propose a curriculum
  6. Join our team and board
  7. Spread the word about our fundraiser

Founder’s Story

Ellen Chilemba is the Founder and Director at Tiwale Community Based Organization. She was born and raised in Malawi. When she was 16 years old, Ellen received a scholarship to represent Malawi at the African Leadership Academy (ALA) in Johannesburg, South Africa. ALA is an institution that seeks to enable lasting peace and prosperity in Africa as it develops and connects the continent's future leaders. At ALA, Ellen completed a diploma in Leadership, Entrepreneurship and African Studies. This inspired her to take a year off and launched Tiwale when she was 18 years old.   Through her efforts with Tiwale, Ellen has been recognized as Forbes Africa's 30 Under 30 for 2015, she is an Ashoka Future Forward Winner, a Commonwealth Youth Awardee for Excellence in Development Work, a Powell Emerging Leader Awardee, Women Deliver Young Leader, Grinspoon Entrepreneur and We Are Family Foundation’s Global Teen Leaders.

More on Tiwale:

http://www.forbes.com/sites/kerryadolan/2015/06/12/africas-most-promising-young-entrepreneurs-forbes-africas-30-under-30-for-2015/

https://www.clintonfoundation.org/blog/2015/03/30/young-women-aspire-change-world-clinton-global-initiative-university

https://www.mtholyoke.edu/media/helping-malawis-women-be-self-sufficient

story:
Support an Independent Youth Photo-Film-Sound Lab & Studio

In the '70s the communist youth built the Youth Center in Timisoara-Romania. After the revolution it was given to youth organizations for cultural, educational and recreational activities.

In the last 30 years the building has gone trough remodeling processes of all spaces except one: the sound booth and projection room. This has been miraculously left untouched preserving a genuine capsule of Romanian analogue history.

Our project aims to bring the sound and projection room to life by transforming it into a 100 % functional photo-film-sound lab & studio.

The BBC states that children aged 5 to 16 spend an average of six and a half hours a day in front of a screen. Screen time is made up of time spent watching TV, playing games consoles, using a mobile, computer or tablet.

Get involved! Help us offer kids an alternative.The world is analogue.

Remodeling an Abandoned Projection Room into a Analogue Studio & Lab 

The budget is tailored to cover expenses for remodeling the space, specific furniture, display modules and some photo, film & sound materials.

 

This Indiegogo campaign aims to raise 4500 $ for our project. This amount will be sufficient for a medium quality setup.

New perk added!!! "Film Is Not Dead" keychain.

We just added the 25 € perk - the "Film Is Not Dead" keychain. These are cool handcrafted gadgets made from recycled 35mm film canisters. Free shipping.

Grab a Piece of Romanian Film Projection History

We had the chance to collect thousands of original photos and posters used as ads in the communist era in Romania. Also we saved a dozen of original stamps from the majority of the closed analogue cinemas in the Timis county. Moreover we have the darkroom and audio equipment to process photos and cut our own vinyls.

We are happy to share some of our treasures to reimburse your kind support. You can get your hand on some analogue Romanian history.

 

  

  


  • argentique darkroom process copies of photos that were used as adds in the communist era in Romania.
  • original template posters adds of Romanian Cinema (empty or stamped)
  • moreover we invite you to come for a real experience to Timisoara-Romania to the summer workshop at the future photo-film-sound lab & studio
  • all backers names will be listed on our website. 

Our passion

We succeeded to organize three editions of Analog Mania, an international festival celebrating analogue photography, film and sound. Analog Mania is an independent festival that runs on own resources budget, the serious involvement of our partners and a lot of work of the volunteers.

And the truth is, that concerning the photo-film-sound lab & studio we are so passionate that we will get this project running no matter what.

If you can't contribute

Please share our campaign and get the word out...

story:
English:

Every child needs play and education. Play to explore new ideas, express themselves, and just to have fun. Education to solve problems and prepare for life. Our three major programs, talent development through sport, school sponsorship, and income generation try to achieve this simple goal. 
Donations towards this cause will help us set up a simple container office in our area of operation saving us, in effect, over 80% of the 1,440 EURO we pay for office space every year. 
We intend to begin setting up the office by mid-January 2017 in Mukuru Kwa Ruben, Nairobi, Kenya. 
Once complete the container office will be our main operating base, storage, and will host income generating activities as well. Every donation is important no matter how small.

Deutsch: 

Jedes Kind braucht Spiel und Bildung:
Spiel, um neue Ideen zu schaffen, sich auszudrücken und einfach Spaß zu haben. Bildung, um Probleme zu lösen und für das weitere Leben vorzubereiten.     
Unsere drei großen Programme, Talent-Entwicklung durch Sport, Schulpatenschaft und Berufsausbildung versuchen, diese  Ziele zu erreichen.
Spenden helfen uns, ein einfaches Containerbüro in unserem Einsatzgebiet in Mukuru kwa Ruben, Nairobi, Kenia zu schaffen, das uns in der Tat über 80% der 1,440 EURO, die wir jährlich für Büroflächen bezahlen, erspart.
Wir beabsichtigen, mit der Errichtung des Büros Mitte Januar 2017 zu beginnen. Nach Fertigstellung des Container-Büros, wird dies unser Hauptsitz, wo zugleich die Berufsausbildung erfolgt.
Jede auch noch so kleine Spende ist hilfreich!

story:
Passion for Connecting

It's so hard to put into words my passion for creating a community bookstore. I've been in publishing and book selling since 1989. I've worked at large independent bookstores in San Francisco and Oakland. In addition to front line retail experience I also have book marketing experience-I've worked for various publishers here on the West Coast from hippie independent publishing like Ten Speed Press to multimillion dollar corporate companies such as Harcourt. I've also worked at the University of California Press and some other educational publishers in between. BUT my life long love has always been book selling. Bookstores are an oasis for these challenging times. They are a place to give voice to those who would be silenced, solace to those who are in strife, knowledge to those who are seekers.

Why St. Johns is Ready for Two Rivers Bookstore 

St. Johns is a growing community. The University of Portland is just down the road. In town there is Way Finding Academy, an alternative 2 year college, Roosevelt High School which enrolled an unanticipated 300 students this fall, 3 elementary schools with additional kindergarten classes added-all in walking distance to Two Rivers Bookstore. The community itself has asked for an alternative meeting place to the bars and other eating/drinking establishments. I have been doing pop-up bookstores in St. Johns for the last several years. I've collected hundreds of emails of the folks who are dying for a bookstore.

Join Two Rivers Facebook Group!

What Two Rivers will offer the community:

Two Rivers will be a community focused store, carrying new titles, hosting events like storybook hour, author readings, book clubs, cookbook clubs, salon discussion groups, literary karaoke, workshops, teacher back to school nights and much more. Eventually I hope to create a student run publishing program, where the material is written by students, edited, designed and produced by students in the hopes of creating career opportunities for a new and diverse generation of publishers.

I Live Here Too

I'm very active in the St. Johns Community. I live just down the road from the retail space. I participate in many community organizations; The St. Johns Boosters (the local business association), The St. Johns Women's Choir, and the St. Johns Center for Opportunity (SJO). In the last year I have run pop-up shops in conjunction with SJO sponsored events like Biz Mob, the St. Johns Bizarre and a seasonal curated collection set up in RoM Shoes. In addition to pop-up bookstores, I've hosted and organized a neighbor Holiday Craft Bizarre. I love this community and would love to contribute to its growth by adding a neighborhood bookstore. All this to say, I can get things done with your help!

What We Need

Two Rivers Bookstore is trying to open on a shoestring. Your contributions will help:

  • Opening and operating expenses for the first year:
    • Opening and holiday inventory.
    • POS system
    • Operating costs such as credit card processing, equipment
    • And of course Indiegogo needs their share for helping us reach all of you!

We're running a 40 day campaign, To reach our goal that's $2500 a day or 100 $1000 contributions. Spread the word!

Independent Bookstores are Still Thriving

The strength of an independent bookseller is knowing its community, listening to their needs and responding with books and events that reflect that community (something Amazon can't do). One of the biggest obstacles I've been coming up against are the doubters-the ones who say bookstores are dying off. Well I'm here to tell you it's not true.

Some very reliable news outlets have some very factual reports:

Between 2009-2015 the number of Independent Bookstore have increased by 35% (NPR)

New stores are opening all the time (ABA resource for articles)

Independent Bookstores are Booming (CBS, April 2018)

Bookstore Sales are up (Forbes, May 2018)

Spread the Word Like Your Hearts on Fire

Books and reading are my passion. If you  or anyone you know is  a book lover, a reader, a community member or anyone that might support this crazy dream of mine please contribute or forward this campaign.

Use Indiegogo's share tools #stjohnsreads or find us on Facebook or Instagram

Thank you everyone! I would not have been able to get this far without the support and encouragement of my sister, friends and neighbors, especially the lady business owners here in St. Johns. Thank you Thank you! A special thanks to Drake Stewart who helped pull of a last minute miracle.
story_txt:
Passion for Connecting
It's so hard to put into words my passion for creating a community bookstore. I've been in publishing and book selling since 1989. I've worked at large independent bookstores in San Francisco and Oakland. In addition to front line retail experience I also have book marketing experience-I've worked for various publishers here on the West Coast from hippie independent publishing like Ten Speed Press to multimillion dollar corporate companies such as Harcourt. I've also worked at the University of California Press and some other educational publishers in between. BUT my life long love has always been book selling. Bookstores are an oasis for these challenging times. They are a place to give voice to those who would be silenced, solace to those who are in strife, knowledge to those who are seekers.

story:
What we believe:

The Havoc Girls Project believes non-traditional education for teenagers builds life skills that inform their futures. The program addresses topics like courage, determination, empathy and critical observation through the Bible. We hope teen girls would begin to ask themselves how they want to make a difference in their communities. We celebrate autonomy through unifying women in a safe, creative space. We ask our teen artists to accept the havoc within themselves to create the art that will wreak havoc on our society.

Where is it taking place?

We will be holding two trial programs this summer in Phoenix, Arizona, USA and in Bracknell, England. 


 Is HGP a non-profit?  

No, we are not a non-profit organisation yet!  Non-profit organisations often take years to develop and we have been working on this curriculum for the last 8 months. We look at this summer as an opportunity to listen to our audience and see how we can best reach teenagers.  Our greatest hope is that this program grows into a global educational program that unifies female artists globally. This summer is just the start!  

What will it cost?

We want to make this program free for the participating girls because we believe that everyone has the right to tell their story, no matter their background. This includes flights for our teaching artists, materials, and wages so our teachers can afford to take a week off their day jobs. We have been fortunate to find a free spaces in both Phoenix and Bracknell to host the program. Below, we have the project broken down for each location: 

Phoenix, Arizona: 

  1. Teaching Artist travel: $700
  2. Teaching Artist Room and Board: $100
  3. Teaching artists salary (3 teachers plus guests): $1300
  4. Student materials and transportation fees: $100
  5. TOTAL: $2,200

Bracknell, England

  1. Teaching Artists Salaries (3 teachers): £1374.00
  2. Student material : £130.00
  3. Travel (including Sarah’s flight & potential commute expenses): £800
  4. TOTAL:  £2,304

USD TOTAL FOR BOTH PROGRAMS: $5,144.08

GBP TOTAL FOR BOTH PROGRAMS: £4,028.61

We’re asking for donations no matter how small if you feel led. Please feel free to pass on our page to anyone interested.  

 

For further information, check us out on social media: 

@thehavocgirlsproject

https://havocgirls.tumblr.com/
