story:
The Dreamweaver House Autism Foundation

 

The Autism Learning Laboratory Initiative (A.L.L.)

 

Re purposed Special Education Methods

Updated by an Interwoven Network of Interactive Digital Applications

Noninvasive Cutting Edge Brain Technologies Seamlessly Built in as Applications or as Use Guides for a Recommended Device Addition

Autism Solutions:

These are solutions brought about by Dreamweaver House’s (A.L.L) approach, which constantly draws together the expert advice of, and works with an expanding volunteer coalition of, qualified American and internationally innovative and experienced MD’s, Neuroscientists, Behavioral Scientists, Researchers and Special Education Teachers.  These (A.L.L.) specialists cooperate in seeking effective solutions for autism.  They do so with a burning desire to be proactive in solving the puzzle and to improve the epidemic that is autism.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Does Brain Retrain™ seek to replace other special education methods for autism?

No! Brain Retrain™ is not about replacement. While the flames of autism's prevalence continues at this level of intensity, Brain Retrain is about immediate proactive intervention in getting for autism, accessibility to solutions for learning and communication. Accessibility is defined as having an awareness of what, where and how these solutions are currently available, and being able to use them in terms of time, affordability and with effective results for each learner’s individuality. Brain Retrain brings this all together by being built as an interactive and digital upgrade of current, new and forward thinking principles and practices. And it is presented on a Digital Platform.

How do we know Brain Retrain™ works? 

We know that Brain Retrain™ works because it has been rigorously tested within the Autism Learning Lab for the past 4 years. But, it works mainly because it is built upon updated research, the principles of time tested and evidenced based methodologies currently being used, (all be it, with limited accessibility), and especially, because for the first time, a special education method for autism is interwoven with non-invasive, modern brain retraining technologies. Brain Retrain™ does not seek to reinvent the wheel. Instead, Brain Retrain™ has introduced gears onto those wheels, making them more efficiently accessible and affordable. Brain Retrain™ recognizes that autism’s students respond differently to different methods of learning and communicating. And, although 87 percent of these students will respond positively to the Brain Retrain™ methodology (according to the Autism Learning Lab’s data), there is a small percentage of these students who will respond best to certain principles, that have been updated and re-purposed from other currently practiced methods. As the definitive platform for learning and communications in autism, Brain Retrain™ is built to identify the principles of those method such learners are best responding to.

OUR COMPLETE AUTISM RESOURCE DIRECTORY

We have in Brain Retrain™, a directory of all special education methods and resources for autism spectrum disorders. It is called our Applications Directory. It offers a constantly updated listing and their details, of new technologies, teachers of all methods, and their locations, nationally. After evaluating each learner’s additional needs, and using this resource directory, Brain Retrain™ would refer that particular learner to something, somewhere, or someone that utilizes what the learner additionally requires. In this regard, Brain Retrain™ will work as a gateway of accessibility for such students, and as their auxiliary support for effective and updated learning and communications.    

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

With Dreamweaver House’s over a decade of experience, research, services and products, in service to autism, and armed with the specialized road-map of our PROTOTYPE product called  Reading Movies™, we intend to raise $128,000 from the crowd community of aware and proactive citizens, to achieve the following:

Our Prototype:

The road to developing Brain Retrain™ had led to the creation of an earlier product called Reading Movies™, designed solely to encourage and enable reading skills in very young children. This is the precursor to the development of Brain Retrain™, the definitive product for learning and communicating. 

It was built as an interactive DVD consisting of children’s movies, which included a patented captioning technology designed to correct eye gaze fixation of many children with autism.  It also included audio tracks of brain retraining patterns of brainwave frequencies. 

The A.L.L Reading Movies™ product has become a highly successful baseline of the Dreamweaver House protocol for initiating the reversal of the symptoms of autism in some children at an early age.

Reading Movies™ is our prototype and the launching point and foundational basement architectural framework upon which Brain Retrain™ is being built. 

 

Cost: $65,000

Cost: $12,000

Cost: $51,000

With all this,  an effectively accessible tool for learning and communicating will be made available to the entire autism community, nationally and internationally, by the fall of 2018.

HERE'S THE DILEMMA..........

 

OUR TEAM LEADERS

Tiah A. Asare

Director of Research and Educational Services and

Director of the Autism Learning Lab

PhD Candidate – Literacy Studies /Autism - Hofstra University

MA - Childhood Education – New York University

Post Grad. Adv. Cert. - Early Childhood Education – Long Island University

Post Grad. Adv. Cert. - Special Education – Long Island University

BA – Music / Education – Wheaton College

Tiah is a highly credentialed educator, education researcher and a strong advocate of innovative solutions for autism. Her research broadens the education discussion by stepping outside the box, where medicine and psychiatry seeks to dictate learning ability, and to explore the role of concepts such as Neuro Bio Entrainment, which recognizes the ability of the brain to utilize noninvasive brainwave and other frequencies, to activate neural pathways of cognition, in developing communications skills. These lines of inquiry has led her to the revolutionary path, of making special education methods for autism more effective, by merging them with modern brain retraining technologies.

She has been serving the children and families of autism at Dreamweaver House, uninterrupted, since its inception in 2006, while still an undergraduate student at Wheaton College. Her academic background, together with her persona as a trained musician, her skills in electronic media and computing, makes her ably suited to head the development of Brain Retrain™, as the effectively accessible gateway learning and communications tool for the children and adults of autism.

Regina Santo

Parent's Advocate

Regina Santo, who is the proud parent of three children, including Christopher, a child of autism, has been a vital part of Dreamweaver House’s volunteer team of professionals. She is a Magna Cum Laude graduate of Pennsylvania’s Slippery Rock University, with a bachelor’s degree in Therapeutic Recreation. She is a trained Adaptive Special Olympics coach, which includes wheel chair participants, and for the past 35 years, Regina has worked in New York State’s Office for people with Developmental Disabilities, supervising hundreds in the varied capacities of Treatment Team Leader, and Weekend Respite Coordinator. Her career responsibilities, together with personally coordinating and supervising the daily,  almost 12 hour cycle of support staff for Christopher, makes Regina the ultimate ‘boots on the ground and go-to’ person, who has been directing Dreamweaver’s parents support inquiries and needs for most of its decade of community service.

Karalee Harrigan

Director of Mission Development and Programs

Co- Founder Dreamweaver House Autism Foundation

Karalee is a Magna Cum Laude graduate from the City of New York University, with a Bachelor of Science degree in Psychology.  Subsequently, she worked for the New York City Department of Health as a School Health Coordinator, and later she became a Mental Health Counselor with Saint Vincent’s Hospital in Staten Island, New York. She joined the Len Anthony Studio as an associate producer of children’s movies and media, before becoming a Co-Founder of the Dreamweaver House Autism Foundation in 2006.  Karalee’s practice as the administrator of Dreamweaver Houses’ Energetic and Informational Protocols for autism is highlighted by her advanced certification in Bio-Modulation Therapy from the Tennant Institute in Texas.

Len Anthony Smith

Founder and Executive Director of DreamWeaver House Autism Foundation

Len Anthony is a prolific producer, director and studio executive with an excellent multifaceted background in both the creative and business sides of the entertainment industries. In addition to writing, directing and producing motion pictures, stage plays music recordings and electronic media; he has also been an innovative and driving force in their marketing and distribution. He has had over two decades of service within the Hollywood Studio System of marketing and distribution. Within the entertainment industry he has served as the VP of International Marketing and subsequently as CEO of Studio Entertainment Corp. As Studio’s head of marketing he has traveled extensively producing, purchasing, distributing film and music products in such industry venues as the Cannes film festival, the Milfed film market in Italy, the Midem music market in France and the American film market in Hollywood. His tenure at Studio Entertainment has been featured in such publications as Billboard Magazine, The Hollywood Reporter, Variety, American Film, and Video Business.

Len’s familiarity with the marketplace for children’s movies drew his attention to the seeming inability of the mainstream to stem the epidemic growth of autism. As a lifelong proponent of the practices and principles of naturopathic and energetic medicine, with training from the Pan American University of Natural medicine, he became increasingly passionate about the urgent need for alternative solutions in the care, treatment and education of autism’s children. In 2006 he founded and initially self-funded the Dreamweaver House Foundation.  In addition to bringing some of the brightest and most innovative international MDs, neuro scientists, behavioral scientists and educators together, to investigate alternative options in treatment and learning for autism, he has pioneered a revolutionary new concept of using children’s movies, utilizing a new and patented media technology, to teach, encourage and improve reading and language skills to children.

Len Anthony’s academic background has steered him through a BA program in Theater and English and an Associate BSc in Photography, to a career launching fine arts degree in Film Production from the School of Visual Arts and his business initiating work in the graduate diploma program in Arts Management at Adelphi University.  In 2002 Len directed the new American drama ‘REFLECTIONS’, written by Joseph Koster. ‘REFLECTIONS’ opened Off- Broadway at New York's famed Cherry Lane Theater to rave reviews, as his tenure as a Director in the Actor’s Studio’s MFA program at New School University ended.

story:
In my 15+ years of financial trading, the most important breakthrough most definitely came, when I started to implement some macro-analysis in my trading.

Filtering out those technically-derived trades with an eye on the bigger picture really helps smooth out that equity curve!

It is all about understanding the link between [ECO]NOMIC information and [FIN]ANCIAL markets.

The problem was, how to combine all those bits of data and derive a set of "models" to make it all simpler to look at.

And so, through a few years of trial-and-error, I have managed to build a set of tools doing just that!


I would like to share these with everyone of similar interest through the ECOFINLAB project.

Take a peek at our Economic Events Calendar. Yes, it is very different!

Your funds will mostly be going to the development of those other tools you see on our site! Next in line is the Diffusion-Aggregator.


I am supposed to offer some perks for supporters, but I can't, because it is and shall remain free for everyone!

It will be cool though if this project becomes a self-sustainable entity, so that it is partly free for me too :-)


If you prefer all your funds in your trading account instead, (I understand) you can still be a supporter by sharing this link http://igg.me/at/ecofinlab with others!
story_txt:
In my 15+ years of
financial trading, the most important
breakthrough most definitely came, when I started to implement some
macro-analysis in my trading.
Filtering out those
technically-derived trades with an eye on the bigger picture really helps
smooth out that equity curve!
It is all about understanding the link between [ECO]NOMIC information and [FIN]ANCIAL markets.
The problem was, how to combine all those bits of data and derive a set of "models" to make it all
simpler to look at.
And so, through a few years of
trial-and-error, I have managed to build a set of tools doing just that!
I
would like to share these with everyone of similar
interest through the ECOFINLAB project.
Take a peek at our Economic Events Calendar. Yes, it
is very different!
Your funds will mostly be going
to the development of those other tools you see on our site! Next in line is the Diffusion-Aggregator.
I am supposed to offer some perks for supporters, but I can't, because it is and shall remain free for everyone!
It will be cool though if this
project becomes a self-sustainable entity, so that it is partly free for me too
:-)
If you prefer all
your funds in your trading account instead, (I understand) you can still be a
supporter by sharing this link http://igg.me/at/ecofinlab with others!

story:
My name is Taisha Dent. I was born and raised in the Bronx. I have been in the Social Work field for over 7 years, in which my focus has been to provide therapeutic services to youth and families. I have definitely grown a passion to helping the community, particularly young people. Through much thought and observation of what our youth need, I created my own organization, Help Emotion World.  Help Emotion World provides after school programming that engages youth and young adults in social change website and video game creation. This will serve as a tool for innovative activities and positive outlets.With the programming from Help Emotion World, our youth will get a chance to engage in a productive after school program that will allow them to have an outlet to help voice a concern of their choice, address some of their social-emotional concerns that they may struggle with, learn computer programming that will assist them in competing with today’s workforce and motivate them to think about their interests for the future.
I would appreciate your help and support in introducing this program to schools throughout the Bronx. The funds from this campaign will be able to provide after school programming for 2 schools ($5,500) for each school for 3 months, in addition to business cards and a company website.

I eventually would like to share this model of programming throughout New York City and beyond.

Thank you for your attention and I look forward to hearing from you!!

If you are donating at the $10 gift bracket, please send your full mailing address to helpemotionworld@gmail.com so the book you choose can be sent to you. To redeem your gift in the other donation brackets, please send your full name, email address and phone number to the same e-mail address along with the gift of your choice. Your name will be added to a list and sent to the sponsor.

Thank you!!

story:
Short Summary

The story involves two young people who meet four Framers right out of the 1787 Constitutional Convention with the help of a time-traveling app, and find themselves in a very interesting conversation. The short should run at about 9 minutes in length and will be released online.

Here is the informative video that was made a couple of years ago. Our goal is to take this to the next level with an actual short movie.


Cost

Because this production will involve authentic wardrobe, hair, and makeup, plus professional actors and camera crew from across the country, it is important that we make sure we have enough funds to complete the project. Generously rounding up to ensure we have enough, and using a memorable target number that reflects the mission, we have settled on $17,870.
 

What next?

Please subscribe to the Luke Historians Media channel on YouTube to keep up with the adventure...

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCyuHQ8IO0Uony4OiAeutX5Q

Please help us reach our goal by July 4th!

This is an independent production by Amanda Read, not a production of the Convention of States Project.

story:
«Ne rien faire, c'est prendre parti.»

(Fasal Kanouté, 2011)

Comment aider Haïti? Donner un poisson ou montrer à pêcher? La Fondation Renouveau Pédagogique de Camp-Perrin (FRPCP) vous propose le «comment pêcher»: offrir une aide financière directe pour soutenir la formation continue des enseignants locaux.

La FRPCP vise une éducation de qualité pour les populations haïtiennes vulnérables de Camp-Perrin.

Depuis 2006, la Fondation reconnaît la nécessité d’agir localement auprès d’enseignants haïtiens, lesquels sont les vecteurs d’une formation de qualité, les bâtisseurs de l’avenir. Elle fait de Camp-Perrin une zone stratégique de formation éducative. Comment? En permettant à une équipe de formateurs haïtiens et québécois de multiplier sur place les services auprès de la communauté. L’approche vise la pérennité du projet par la mobilisation de ces acteurs année après année.

La FRPCP a notamment permis la réalisation d’«Haïti mon pays»*, un recueil de poèmes d’enfants de Camp-Perrin mis en images par l’illustrateur québécois Rogé. Voici ce qu'a dit son préfacier, Dany Laferrière: « Il ne suffit pas uniquement de nourriture et de médicament, il faut investir dans l’énergie humaine, et c’est ce qu’Haïti a de plus important : ses enfants ! Ces enfants qui peuvent tout, même faire un livre!»

* Vous pouvez vous le procurer, en anglais ou en français, ici pour soutenir la FRPCP : http://www.leseditionsdelabagnole.com/

___________

La Fondation Renouveau Pédagogique de Camp-Perrin poursuit des objectifs nobles et ne ménage pas ses efforts pour y parvenir. Cependant, elle a besoin de plus de ressources matérielles et financières pour: 

  •  planifier des ateliers de formation,
  •  imprimer des documents de travail,
  •  transporter et fournir du matériel pédagogique et didactique aux enseignants.
C'est toute génération qui vous en sera reconnaissante! Vous aurez aidé une population à se prendre en main, car l'éducation de qualité est la seule voie de sortie pour les enfants d'Haïti.

___________

Votre contribution donnera à la FRPCP les moyens de répondre à sa mission : la formation continue des enseignants de Camp-Perrin et de ses environs.
Votre participation à cette campagne devient une aide directe aux personnes concernées! Prenez note que les intervenants d’ici et de là-bas offrent gracieusement leur service.

 ___________

Vous pouvez toujours nous aider en participant à nos activités de financement:
  • Achat du livre Haïti mon pays: http://www.leseditionsdelabagnole.com/
  • Cinéma Beaubien en février de chaque année
  • 5@ 7 en mai de chaque année
  • Banquet annuel Fête des pères en juin de chaque année
  • Utilisation des outils de partage sur Indiegogo pour inviter vos amis à nos activités !
  • Don en matériel pédagogique

Il n’y a pas de petits dons, tous marquent la solidarité humaine.

Merci beaucoup ! Mèsi anpil!


Quelques liens à propos du projet

  • Site Web: www.frpcp.org
  • Dany Laferrière: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C8798bhGkRk
  • Entrevue avec la fondatrice de la FRPCP: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVeD_1ugLbY
  • Séminaire de 2012: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2jHN8GGlzFg
  • Analyse de Jacky Lumarque : http://lenouvelliste.com/lenouvelliste/article/...

story:
Short Summary

My name is Garr Bostic, and I hope to gain your help with travels across the USA in order to jump start an extremely powerful healing method I have created. I have mostly been involved in remote healing, and recently have been guided to begin work in a more direct fashion. I am being guided to reach out and share this method with more people, and it seems that the best way for people to learn about this is for me to go out into the world and physically meet with people.

I first developed a general tool to give people a way to work on themselves. Then I spent time expanding upon it, working out a lot of the details. It turned out to be a complex, mostly unknown system that - through extensive investigation and experimentation - I was able to simplify enough for the average person to use. I now want to share my efficient and simple translation of the complex system.

A General Outline Of My System


First I enable in the person the ability to communicate with 'everything'. This includes their own body. I show them how they are going to be able to communicate with each part of their human body, and that these body parts will have the ability to communicate back to them. This is slightly similar to Kinesiology in how the body can respond, yet with my method the parts of the body will each have a voice of their own and will be able to speak and answer questions directed at them. This opens up the potential for gaining a whole lot of insight regarding physical ailments, "hereditary" diseases, pain, etc. 

Just as many are beginning to realize that our ailments are a result of what we think and believe, more and more people are working with a healer. And many of those people will again need to make return visits for that same help, as the beneficial effects "wear off". What if you could now become aware of the specific beliefs that cause the ailment? And what if you had the tools to remove those underlying beliefs yourself?

The physical issues that this communication system allows one to address are truly amazing. However, the benefits are not limited to the physical alone. Imagine having the ability to communicate with your heart. For instance, it turns out that very many people are confused regarding what is their "life calling". They think that when someone says "follow your heart" it means to just do whatever their head tells them to do. Now they can specifically find out what their heart wants them to do, and by that, identify their true (or Heart's) purpose in life.



A small portion of abilities that can be gained from this system: 

- The transformation and erasure of harmful beliefs.

- Healing of the self and others by touch.

- Healing of the self and others by thought.

- Comprehension of dream metaphoric language, along with the ability to apply this new understanding in ways that help with problem-solving and spiritual expansion.
-Comprehension of fear and how it creates the external experience (what is often called karma).

What We Need & What You Get

I am hoping to meet many people across the country who want to make a difference in the world. Provided that goals are met, the advanced perk ensures that I will visit your area (USA only) for an in person meetup. All healing work is free of charge, all basic training is free as well. I would ask that you invite any friends that are interested as the group experience helps to push your doubts to the side and become more comfortable with the experience. It also helps you form a local support group.


The Impact

Because I was not happy with the common systems that create a reliance upon the healer, I wanted to develop a system to empower the individual and give them the ability to face their problems on a personal level.

While each person trained becomes a power in their own right, I continue to bring information to light, which allows everyone involved to continue with advancements in understanding, if they choose to stay updated. I offer a free forum membership that functions as a support group.


Challenges

I am fully self trained in the Arts. I have trained myself through my own guidance in methods commonly described as Regressive Hypnotherapy, Axiatonal Alignment, Energy Body Reconstruction, Quantum Touch, Interpersonal Reconstructive Therapy, etc. 

My wife will join me with the touch healing form of work, and help with that area of training.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word is a contribution in itself. Please share this in any way you can. Healing work is always offered for free, if you have a friend that has been seeking alternative methods, they are welcome to contact me. 


Feedback

This is from our first hands on healing test (combined with the system I designed). This individual deals with Scoliosis and found my name listed on the Dolores Cannon website.:

"It has been feeling pretty good. I started skateboarding last week and it doesn't bother me like it used to. I have never felt stable enough to attempt getting on a skateboard. But I've been taking the dog to the park and rolling around. No tricks for me tho lol my back feels so much stronger than I ever remember it being in the past 14 yrs." 

I do have a lot of feedback from remote healing. If you have questions feel free to contact me.

story:
"From cutting loose in 'Footloose', moving toward the darkness in 'The Addams Family', and more, this auditorium has been entertaining for decades and decades to come."

We are the Bearden High School Senior Committee. At the beginning of this year, we conducted a poll asking the seniors of the Class of 2016 what they wanted as their senior gift. A majority of the responses, just as in years past, were in reference to an auditorium renovation. In an effort to engage the community in our quest to revitalize the BHS auditorium, we are reaching out to the public. With your help, we are hoping to secure $250,000 dollars by May 6th. 

Because the BHS auditorium is one of Knox County’s largest public auditoriums and its widespread use by both the community and the BHS Fine Arts Department, we are confident this project will be completed with assistance from people like you.

Who Else Is Involved? 

  • Bearden High School Foundation
  • Bearden High School PTSO 
  • BHS Alumni 
  • Tim Burchett, Knox County Mayor  
  • Jim McIntyre, Knox County Schools Superintendent
  • Knox County School Board 
  • Dr. John C. Bartlett, BHS Principal
  • Bearden High School student body and faculty  

The Impact

  • In September 1969, 47 years ago, Bearden High School moved to its current location.

  • The auditorium was built to seat 1250 people, but only 1204 seats remain because 46 were taken apart to repair other seats. 

School use of the BHS Auditorium:

  • Advanced Acting
  • Parent Meetings
  • Student Government Conventions
  • Stage Tech
  • Band/ Orchestra/ Chorus Concerts
  • Coffee House Performances
  • Key Club
  • Fellowship of Christian Athletes
  • National Honors Society
  • National Junior Honors Society
  • Class Meetings
  • Musical Theater

Community use of the BHS Auditorium:

  • Knox County Teacher In-Service Meetings
  • Political Events
  • Church Events
  • Community Plays
  • Musical Events
  • Knox County Band Exhibition

Risks & Challenges

The BHS Senior Committee, facilitators for the Senior Class, is responsible for planning graduation events and purchasing a traditional senior gift. We, the Class of 2016, are determined to see this Auditorium Renovation through its completion. Our largest question has been how to raise $250,000. Reaching out to people through an online platform such as this one is our hope to secure funds necessary for this project. Your donation is greatly appreciated because all involved with BHS for years to come will thank you for your support. The Senior Committee is confident about this project and cannot wait to "take a bow" when all is said and done. 

Other Ways You Can Help

HELP US  spread the word about the BHS Auditorium Renovation Campaign 2016. Share this site with everyone you know. With the support of the community and people like you, we will make this happen.  

Thank you, 

Class of 2016

BHS Senior Committee

story:
Short Summary

Many people are deeply concerned that the education system  is not serving and preparing our children to become engaged citizens who are capable of solving some of humanities greatest problems. They are often not affirmed as human beings and engagement rates in schools globally is rated at only 36%. Overlay that with the speed of technology, jobs students are training for today will be gone before they leave school. 

The school systems was set up to serve the industrial age, not the knowledge and technological age we now find ourselves in. Schools are set up to serve the 30% of our children who aspire to go to University.  

Education is well overdue for disruption.

Parents and enterprise leaders everywhere are searching for a fresh approach to schooling ­ schooling that:

  • values and develops the whole person
  • encourages the path to life long learning
  • infuses learning with entrepreneurial spirit & authenticity
We are supporting families seeking options for their students, our focus is a holistic, nature based approach to learning, and our priority is to support child-led interests and activities. We help students become self-directed learners and offer resources to support and guide them. Individualized, customized curriculum and learning tools combined with authentic participation in community life form the core of the program. The pedagogy combines spiritual, intellectual, emotional and physical dimensions of learning, offering a truly integrative approach. We are replacing 'subject-centredness' with 'student-centredness', which uses affirmed, engaged students as the hallmark of success.

So, we are creating a physical school on the green Kapiti Coast as well as getting the curriculum which supports this type of learning onto an online resource portal and community, available to all teachers, homeschoolers and parents interested in holistic, nature based approach to learning.

About us:

This is the day Three Springs School was incepted, by a pool in Bali. (So excuse the hair!)

We Rustica Lamb and Angie Stead are the Directors and Shareholders of Three Springs School. We met in Bali in November 2015 and realised our common passion was holistic, student centred learning that affirmed and grew confident, strong and resourceful young adults. 

Rustica's dream had been to bring a version of the Bali Green School to New Zealand, but the timing was never right and the people hadn't shown up. Then she met Angie, and it all just fell into place - fast. We have the land on the Kapiti Coast under contract and are currently requesting resource consent. Unconditional date is June 30 and settlement is September. We are looking for investors for the land and buildings. But that's is not what this campaign is about.

Angie is the owner of four childcare centres in the Wellington region and has over 30 years experience in early childhood education. She is a specialist in pre school teacher education and turning around low performing centres. Three Springs School is an extension of her current lifes work.

Rustica is the Director and Shareholder for Bloom Learning Solutions which provides people, technology, tools and capability development for learning and development teams and projects in New Zealand. She has a Bachelor of Arts  in Psychology and Education from Otago University, and is an elearning specialist, leader and entrepreneur. 

What We Need & What You Get

As you can imagine, the curriculum for such a school is very different to your standard local school. It is based on the founding curriculum of the famous Bali Green School and also Silkwood school in Australia. And we want to make this widely available to teachers, homeschoolers and parents worldwide. In doing so, we will also build an ecosystem of interested people that can share and build on the foundational material, in the true spirit of abundant thinking and collaboration. 

We are looking to raise $120,000 New Zealand dollars. This is broken down into:

  • $72,000 for an instructional designer to work with educationalists to convert the curriculum from hard copy to an online resource (6 months @ $12,000) July - December
  • $20,000 consulting fees and advice 
  • $28,000 administrative set up costs
We will be using the docebo learning management system which is a cloud based SAAS, so there are no technology development funds required.

So, we are literally offering a school in a box, which will include:

  • The syllabus
  • Teacher training
  • Governance and management policies
  • School policies and procedures

This will all be available online and you will also be a part of a unique global community all with the same vision.

Our primary focus for the funding is the creation of the online portal. If we do not meet our funding goal, we will focus on the syllabus and teacher training first and policies and procedures at a later time.

The Impact

Angie and Rustica have a vision of leading the movement that disrupted education globally, just as Uber and Airbnb have. By funding our campaign, you become a part of the journey and a special part of our community as Founding Partners.
By the time we are 100 years old (yes we are going to live that long) we want to have impacted 1,000,000 children with the positive experience that we know this curriculum brings.
We cannot do this on our own, so we need your help.

Risks & Challenges

Because this campaign is about getting learning resources online, the risk is low. Rustica has over 20 years experience in learning and development and has been a major player in the elearning industry in New Zealand. As an instructional designer for over 10 years, it makes it easy for her to translate paper based material onto engaging online material.

We are also luck to be mentored and supported by Roger Hamilton, global entrepreneur and futurist, with who we meet monthly.

Our key challenge will be getting the word out to the world, which is where we need your help. Please share and spread the word, if this message and mission resonates with you.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people will want to support with thier time rather than money, so do feel free to share the Indiegogo share tools!


Thank you! Thank you!
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Many people are deeply concerned that the education system  is not serving and preparing our children to become engaged citizens who are capable of solving some of humanities greatest problems. They are often not affirmed as human beings and engagement rates in schools globally is rated at only 36%. Overlay that with the speed of technology, jobs students are training for today will be gone before they leave school. 
The school systems was set up to serve the industrial age, not the knowledge and technological age we now find ourselves in. Schools are set up to serve the 30% of our children who aspire to go to University.  
Education is well overdue for disruption.

Parents and enterprise leaders everywhere are searching for a fresh approach to schooling ­ schooling that:



values and develops the whole person


encourages the path to life long learning


infuses learning with entrepreneurial spirit & authenticity

We are supporting families seeking options for their students, our focus is a holistic, nature based approach to learning, and our priority is to support child-led interests and activities. We help students become self-directed learners and offer resources to support and guide them. Individualized, customized curriculum and learning tools combined with authentic participation in community life form the core of the program. The pedagogy combines spiritual, intellectual, emotional and physical dimensions of learning, offering a truly integrative approach. We are replacing 'subject-centredness' with 'student-centredness', which uses affirmed, engaged students as the hallmark of success.So, we are creating a physical school on the green Kapiti Coast as well as getting the curriculum which supports this type of learning onto an online resource portal and community, available to all teachers, homeschoolers and parents interested in holistic, nature based approach to learning.

story:
The background

“Kitaab”, Urdu word for “book”, is a brainchild of “Ideal Ideaz”, a software house founded by a group of friends, all sharing the same vision to do something impact-ful for the society as well as themselves.

Urdu is world’s 3rd biggest language* (mixed with Hindi by some analytics) and is written right-to-left. Spoken primarily in Pakistan, India, Bangladesh, Afghanistan and Middle-East and by the large community of Asian people living in US, UK, Canada and Australia. The language offers a deep literary heritage and is considered as one of the sweetest languages in the world. Unfortunately, the literature is dying because of the declining trend of book reading which in turn is caused by rising prices of paper books and decreasing affordability of people. eBooks can revive the book reading habit by offering books which are,

  • Free (belonging to public-domain or copyright free)
  • Paid but very cheap as compared to paper-back editions
  • Easily accessible online
  • Easily readable giving the best eReading experience
  • Encouraging amateur authors to publish their works free of cost
  • Encouraging professional authors to sell their books to a much larger audience around the globe

Though, the concept of eBooks exists in the society but only in a form that people scan books, create static PDFs and upload. The proper eBook creation process is not followed because there is no such platform yet which can display right-to-left languages’ text as easily as left-to-right’s. Furthermore, interface of the platform in the same language is also needed. Even further, the eBook creation process is lengthy and requires considerable time, money and effort because of composing the manuscripts in digital form and then using development techniques to generate optimized eBooks in the proper epub format. Therefore the concept remains limited.

The statistical analysis of such resources offering scanned images as books show that the people do want to read eBooks but they are helpless.

  • A static PDF can be “read” but not “enjoyed”
  • PDF books are almost impossible to read on mobile devices
  • There is no dedicated mobile app for Urdu eBooks reading, having the interface language in Urdu too
  • Available collection is not very vast, specially the classic literature
  • In scanned images, you do not have the customization features offered by eBooks (font style, size, color, line height, spacing, background color, day mode, night mode etc.)
  • Due to piracy, authors and publishers remain hesitant

So we develop Kitaab

Kitaab is a complete eReading and ePublishing solution for not only Urdu but all right-to-left (RTL) languages. 

Scope includes, 

  • Free Android and iOS app optimized for RTL eBooks reading
  • ePublishing mechanism by which Urdu books will be made available in industry standard EPUB format
  • Generating a vast library of FREE eBooks belonging to public-domain and copyright free
  • Digital Rights Management (DRM) system to handle piracy on copyrighted books
  • Platform for publishers and authors to sell their books in ebook form
  • Translation of other languages masterpieces to Urdu, thus bridging the societies
  • Primary interface language as Urdu, secondary language English
  • English eBooks can also be read with as much ease as Urdu
  • Exciting social sharing features not yet offered by any eReading app
  • Expanding the horizons to include other RTL languages like Arabic and Persian

We need your support!

Kitaab is a mega project and despite of having all the necessary vision, experience and skills, we lack just one thing, the financial resources to carry out the full scale development and building the free online library of Urdu classic books. At our own, we have successfully completed the ver 1.0 for Android. Our major cost heads are,

  • Development of Android app
  • Development of iOS app
  • Acquisition of public-domain books and their conversion to digital form. This is a significant cost head which has raised the cost of overall project, but is as crucial as the development itself.
  • Developing an owned DRM system
  • Developing a web platform where users can submit their ebooks to be uploaded on Kitaab
  • Online marketing to create awareness
  • Offline marketing in universities, literary circles, events, book fairs

The challengers!

Optimizing for an RTL language on machines and softwares which all work in LTR format was the foremost challenge which has been overcome with unique algorithms and innovative techniques. Generating a significant free library of ebooks to start with is quite a comprehensive challenge which involves considerable money alongside the effort. The current DRM systems for ebooks offered by providers like Adobe are too costly to be integrated and will kill the concept of providing cheap books to the people of under-developed countries. Thus developing a new and owned DRM system is another challenging task for which some algorithms have already been planned and need to be field tested before deployment.


Contribute to a whole culture!

By contributing to this project, you will help more than 900 million Urdu speakers around the globe (stats by Encyclopedia Britannica) to read their favorite books on mobile which will in turn,

  • Help to revive the literature of a centuries old language
  • Literature educates societies thus producing more tolerant, talented, creative and lively individuals 
  • Encourage authors to write more as their creativity is delivered to more people

If we do not meet the funding goal, then our development pace will be significantly hit. Library building costs are almost as high as the development and is one of the primary success factors of this product. No classic library - no Kitaab!

Current Status and Launch Plan

  • We have launched Android based first version on Play Store with a limited number of books
  • Public Domain Library is being worked upon and is the only bottleneck at the moment. Due to our limited resources, this phase is eating much time and effort.
  • DRM and Paid Books category will be included in second version and is dependent upon the funding we raise.
  • iOS app development will be started as soon as we raise a certain amount of funds to bear the cost.

Download Kitaab

You can download Kitaab from Play Store on your Android phone now.
Get Kitaab
Help us realize a DREAM

Whether you know Urdu or not, a contribution to this project will be a contribution to a better educated society of millions of people living in every corner of the world. If you know any Urdu/Hindi speaker around you then do share the word with him and ask him to get ready to download Kitaab on his mobile. 

Stay tuned to our official website

Our official website is
http://kitaabapp.com
Currently showing pre-launch version. It will soon display a section of Online Library, Acknowledgements, Publish your book section and a book discussion social forum.

Q. I don't know Urdu, is Kitaab for me?

Yes, Kitaab fully supports English, Arabic, Persian and other languages' ebooks too. Kitaab's interface is available in English as well. Along with our own Urdu library, we have connected Kitaab to English online libraries like Project Gutenberg and Feedbooks etc. Once we are done with Urdu, then we will expand to Arabic and Persian as well and make interfaces available in those languages.

Q. Don't you think you are asking too much?

Absolutely not, as Kitaab is a complete end-to-end solution. It's not only an ereader, not only a library, not only an epublisher, not only an online book store..it is all of them at once. We have to do it all because these all are linked and are meaningless in absence of other. The library building requires acquisition of books, requires manpower to convert them to digital form, requires time as it is a laborious process hence the cost of library built-up phase is almost equivalent to the development of rest of all modules together. In fact, such a project would take much more finance to be developed if it were based in US or UK etc. Our costs are far lesser because we are Asia based.

Q. What can I do if I cannot fund?

Even just 1 penny of yours will be another step towards changing a whole cultural trend. But if you can't then you can definitely help us by sharing the word with your friends, sending us comments to encourage, and showing us your commitment to download the app once it is launched. We will still be grateful to you.

story:
Education Crisis in Africa: In School, But Without Books

Promoting Global Learning (PGL) is a UK charity (Registration Number: 1158202) established in 2014, by Sue Gerrish and Henry Yentumi, with a vision to raise the standard of education in Africa. Following several visits to Africa, Sue and Henry realised the challenges African children face to learn and they became passionate about transforming their life chances. In England, children are very fortunate to have an abundance of books and to be surrounded by stimulating, colourful and well-resourced schools and classrooms. In Africa the situation is quite the opposite:

  • Of Africa's nearly 128 million school-aged children, only half have the opportunity to attend school and learn basic skills.
  • An estimated 37 million African children learn so little while in school that they are hardly better off than peers who never went to school.
  • More than 90% of African children who attend school have never owned a book of their own.
  • Teachers use a ‘chalk-and-talk’ method of teaching a class of up to 60 pupils. This is a valid teaching method but only 78% of schools have blackboards and less than 50% of schools have chalk.

Within a few months of setting up, PGL had filled a garage with old textbooks, story books, stationery and laptops kindly donated by schools in the UK. Now they have collected more than 500,000 essential books from over 500 schools and individuals across UK, which are ready to be shipped to Africa. PGL's next goal is to ship a container of 100,000 books to pupils in nursery and primary schools in Ghana and to set up 3 mobile libraries in communities which have limited access to books or lack the funds to build a permanent library.


Help us to set up three Mobile Libraries for children of the Upper West Akim District in Ghana

We are getting ready to ship more than 100,000 books to Ghana and to distribute our educational materials through 3 mobile library vehicles. These libraries will provide services to disadvantaged schools in the Upper West Akim District of Ghana and aim to ignite a passion for learning, reading and exploring among local children.

  • Upper West Akim District is located in Eastern region of Ghana and has a total population of 97,950. 
  • 65% of the working population is engaged in agriculture and their income levels are extremely low.
  • There are 167 public schools available at the basic level. The total number of students at school is 19,811 with approximately 15,000 students in nursery and primary schools.
  • 13 primary schools are operating under trees; and a further 10 primary schools and 8 junior high schools have no permanent classroom blocks.
  • The pass rate for Maths is 27% and for English is 22%, 11 schools have a zero percent (0%) pass rate. 

To make this happen, we need to raise £60,000:
Your contribution will make an enormous difference in the lives of thousands of children in Ghana. The fund will be used for:
  • Shipping: £3,000 - Shipping a container of 100,000 books from UK to Ghana.
  • Mobile Library Vehicles: £34,000 - Purchasing 3 second-hand Transit type vans in good condition: each costs around £11,300.
  • Interior Design: £4,800 - Designing, shelving and colouring  expenses to decorate the vans and turn them into to 3 efficient and friendly mobile libraries.
  • Annual Staff Salary: £3,200 - Hiring 3 drivers and 3 librarians.
  • Staff Training: £1,500 - Organising training for our staff and volunteers. We plan to engage 2 volunteers per community.
  • Annual Fuel Cost: £5,400 -  Average monthly fuel expense per vehicle is around £150.
  • Repair & Maintenance: £2,100 - Average annual repair & maintenance cost of £700 per vehicle.
  • Annual Insurance: £1,000 - Insuring 3 mobile library vans.
  • Annual Storage & Garage: £5,000 - Renting a storage unit for books and a garage for the mobile library vans.

If you help us to meet our goal, your kindness will not go unnoticed or unrewarded. Please check out the right rail for the packages of authentic African perks you could receive as a way of saying thank you for your vital contribution.

Minimising operational risk through local partnerships

Creating change like this is not an easy thing to do. We have formed local partnerships with “Street Library Ghana” and “Wechiau Community Library” in Ghana. Our partners’ commitment, insights and experience will maximise our efficiency and access, enabling us to deliver books to the most vulnerable children in rural communities. 

The Impact

We are inspired by the words of Kofi Annan,“knowledge is power. Information is liberating. Education is the premise of progress, in every society, in every family." 

Imagine a world where children must learn to read without books. Imagine a classroom where over 60 children are studying from a few copies of old, uninspiring textbooks. Sadly, this is the reality in many schools in Africa. 

Through your help, we are able to provide a well-resourced and inspiring learning environment by organising reading clubs and introducing a library concept to thousands of vulnerable children in deprived rural communities. Together, let’s transform the life of many children in 2016.

Your contribution will give hope and opportunity to many children in Africa. We promise to keep you posted regularly on how your generosity has transformed the lives of the children.Thank you.

For Further information, please check our website:
http://www.promotinggloballearning.org/

These libraries will provide services to disadvantaged schools in the Upper West Akim District of Ghana and aim to ignite a passion for learning, reading and exploring among local children.

Upper West Akim District is located in Eastern region of Ghana and has a total population of 97,950. 
65% of the working population is engaged in agriculture and their income levels are extremely low.
There are 167 public schools available at the basic level. The total number of students at school is 19,811 with approximately 15,000 students in nursery and primary schools.
13 primary schools are operating under trees; and a further 10 primary schools and 8 junior high schools have no permanent classroom blocks.
The pass rate for Maths is 27% and for English is 22%, 11 schools have a zero percent (0%) pass rate. 




To make this happen, we need to raise £60,000:

Your contribution will make an enormous difference in the lives of thousands of children in Ghana. The fund will be used for:



Shipping: £3,000 - Shipping a container of 100,000 books from UK to Ghana.

Mobile Library Vehicles: £34,000 - Purchasing 3 second-hand Transit type vans in good condition: each costs around £11,300.

Interior Design: £4,800 - Designing, shelving and colouring  expenses to decorate the vans and turn them into to 3 efficient and friendly mobile libraries.

Annual Staff Salary: £3,200 - Hiring 3 drivers and 3 librarians.

Staff Training: £1,500 - Organising training for our staff and volunteers. We plan to engage 2 volunteers per community.

Annual Fuel Cost: £5,400 -  Average monthly fuel expense per vehicle is around £150.

Repair & Maintenance: £2,100 - Average annual repair & maintenance cost of £700 per vehicle.

Annual Insurance: £1,000 - Insuring 3 mobile library vans.

Annual Storage & Garage: £5,000 - Renting a storage unit for books and a garage for the mobile library vans.

If you help us to meet our goal, your kindness will not go unnoticed or unrewarded. Please check out the right rail for the packages of authentic African perks you could receive as a way of saying thank you for your vital contribution.
Minimising operational risk through local partnerships
Creating change like this is not an easy thing to do. We have formed local partnerships with “Street Library Ghana” and “Wechiau Community Library” in Ghana. Our partners’ commitment, insights and experience will maximise our efficiency and access, enabling us to deliver books to the most vulnerable children in rural communities. 


The Impact

We are inspired by the words of Kofi Annan,“knowledge is power. Information is liberating. Education is the premise of progress, in every society, in every family." 
Imagine a world where children must learn to read without books. Imagine a classroom where over 60 children are studying from a few copies of old, uninspiring textbooks. Sadly, this is the reality in many schools in Africa. 
Through your help, we are able to provide a well-resourced and inspiring learning environment by organising reading clubs and introducing a library concept to thousands of vulnerable children in deprived rural communities. Together, let’s transform the life of many children in 2016.

Your contribution will give hope and opportunity to many children in Africa. We promise to keep you posted regularly on how your generosity has transformed the lives of the children.Thank you.
For Further information, please check our website:http://www.promotinggloballearning.org/

story:
Short Summary

Bishop, CA is a beautiful but isolated small-town. There are limited opportunities for anything besides the (although impressive) outdoor activities. Our closest major airport and city is Reno, NV which is a 4 hour drive, weather permitting.

None of the students have been to New York and only 2 have been out of the West. The same 2 are the only ones who have ever been on a plane.

Our goal is to visit the places discussed (or examples of the types of places discussed) in The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald; for example, Oheka Castle, Times Square, Central Park, Grand Central Station (instead of Penn Station because the 1920s building was demolished). Additionally we had hoped to attend the play Hamilton because of the similarities between his real life and Gatsby's fictional one, however, we will still tour the historical sites if we are unable to get tickets. For example, Federal Hall, Hamilton Grange, The Bowery, Hamilton's grave, the original site of King's College (now Columbia). Finally we will experience some important New York landmarks and museums, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Empire State Building, and the 9/11 museum.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We have a place to stay with friends of the teacher.
  • We need to cover the costs of travel, entry fees, tickets, and food while there.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal to the point that the trip is not feasible, the money will go to scholarships for Palisade Glacier High School graduates.

The Impact

  • I think this trip will change my outlook on living here in Bishop because there are so many other opportunities and experiences. -Melodie
  • This trip will be memorable for me because I've always wanted to see the world and this will be my first step. -Bekah
  • I'm excited to experience a completely different way of living from our small mountain town.-Mason
  • This trip will give us an opportunity to open our eyes to another world and it might be the only time we get to take a trip like this. - Ashlyn
  • I am seventeen I live in Bishop, CA and I have never left the state. I am a very outgoing person who loves to explore and of everyplace in the world I have always wanted to go to New York. - Emily
  • I have always dreamed of going to New York and experiencing the City life, the only big city I have ever been to is Seattle in Washington. New York would be a different sight to see compared to the places I have been and seen.  - Taylor
  • We would like to be able to go see Hamilton because then we can go and actually experience what it’s like to be in New York and also to experience the play Hamilton in person. -Kiyah
  • I am the first in my family to pass my sophomore year, graduate high school, and now go to college. I am the youngest of 10 children and would love the opportunity to experience New York City. - Priscilla

Risks & Challenges

Any donation is appreciated. It is possible that we will not reach our goal. If we are unable to make the trip any monies not used for the trip (or beyond our goal) will be used to provide scholarships for deserving Palisade Glacier High School students to pursue their post-secondary goals. 
To view the interactive maps of our trip, please visit: https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/edit?hl=en_US&app=mp&mid=zbYIzFX0Y02Y.k4psA84Z22J4

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
When I was five years old my favorite thing in the World was drawing monsters. Many years later my mother handed me a stack of those original childhood drawings and I saw something magical in those early creations. I cast 6 of those monsters as the “ScrapKins” and created a story about a tribe of creatures that build a world out of the things we throw away.

Combining my years of experience working with The Jim Henson Company and designing educational products and toys for kids, I created the ScrapKins Recycled Arts School to get kids ages ages 5–10 years old to see the creative potential in everyday objects. From milk carton pirate ships to cardboard tube dinosaurs, the ScrapKins guide children to "re-think" junk and awaken the creative process.

ScrapKins: Junk Re-Thunk  is our 2nd book and the definitive guide to the ScrapKins. It includes 80 full-color color pages of comics, biographies of the six ScrapKins, puzzles, and illustrated instructions for 24 recycled-art projects kids can create using stuff found in almost every home. This book represents a journey I’ve been on my whole life to create things that kids treasure. This is the book I wanted when I was seven. A manual, a friend, an invitation to unlock creativity, and a secret glimpse into the wonder that still exists in the World. 

The tour is the best way to reach as many kids and families as possible with the ScrapKins mission of creativity through resourcefulness. By visiting schools, museums and bookstores across the US, we get the opportunity to empower kids with the joy and wonder of creating art from junk.


In each city we visit, we have 3 goals:
  1. Visit 2–3 Schools for an assembly or workshop about the ScrapKins
  2. Visit 1–2 Bookstores to talk about the book and teach a project to kids
  3. Create a Pop-up Recycled Workshop at a museum, festival or public space

CITIES WE ARE SCHEDULED TO VISIT* (so far):

  • New York City: April 3–9 + Book Launch Party, April 2
  • Washington, DC/Baltimore:  April 10–17
  • Rochester, NY:  April 18–22
  • Boston, MA:  April 23–27
  • Philadelphia, PA:  May 2– 8

CITIES FOR FALL 2016 (exact dates TBD):

  • Atlanta, GA
  • Chapel Hill, NC
  • New Orleans, LA
  • Austin, TX

*For each $800 we earn above our goal, we can add another US city to the Tour! We’d like to go around the world, and with your help, we can do it!


  • Hiring a publicist: This is our biggest expense to help reach out to local media and arrange bookstore and school visits in each of the cities we visit
  • Travel expenses: Airfare, rental cars and food
  • Shipping and perk fulfillment
Brian is staying with friends and family along the way to save costs. If you’d like to help shelter him, he’d love to stay with you.

Check out our amazing Perks for being a donor! We're grateful for your help and believe you deserve something in return. Choose a level that you feel good about and we'll send you something magical.

Everyone should be able to feel the pride in making something, to experience the joy of creating art. Making stuff fuels the imagination, sparks the brain to solve problems and empowers kids to gain confidence in creation. And art shouldn't require special tools. That's why all of the ScrapKins projects are made from common household recyclables. That's the underlying message: We should use what we have and begin to engage kids in conversation about why recycling is important and where our trash goes.

I feel honored to be able to share this message with children. This is why I’m here. I've been building the ScrapKins for 10 years but it's really something I've been creating my whole life. This is my gift to the Universe. To you. To your kids. To your friend’s kids. To your nieces, nephews, step-siblings, grandchildren and anyone who always wanted to be creative but didn’t know how.  You already have the tools and materials. The ScrapKins are your guide. 

Brian Yanish is a professional illustrator. He has worked for The Jim Henson Company in Los Angeles, trained as a special effects mold maker, written and performed comedy, designed educational software, and sold his own line of T-shirts. He currently lives in New York City, where he writes and illustrates children’s books and designs and develops stories and characters for live events, museums, television, toys, apps, and other media. www.brianyanish.com

ScrapKins has created programs for Sesame Workshop, Whole Foods Markets, The American Museum of Natural History, Seventh Generation, Clif Bar, World Science Festival, Boston Children's Museum, Maker Faire and Scholastic Afterschool. In 2012 ScrapKins was invited to host 4 days of Recycled Art Workshops in Doha, Qatar, in the Middle East.
www.scrapkins.com

    • GET TOUR UPDATES!  >> SIGN UP FOR OUR MAILING LIST <<
    • Invite ScrapKins to your school: brian@thescrapkins.com
    • Follow ScrapKins on Social Media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram: @Scrapkins
    • Subscribe to our channel on YouTube
    • Review our book on Amazon
    • Share our campaign on your Blog, Tweet it, Instagram it, Facebook it!
    • Save materials and make art with your kids

story:
Short Summary

Studio 3 is a non-profit music academy coming to Pendleton, Indiana in the fall of 2016. Founded and started by Benjamin and Tessa Denen, this school will give students in the area a place to pursue their passion in music and continue to grow through one on one lessons. The AND1 model will also include involvement in a band specific to their skill level and age, or a class chosen by the student, which could be teaching songwriting, composition and arranging, or recording. Studio 3 will operate in three semesters, beginning and ending with the school year, plus summer.


Meet the Founders

Benjamin Denen graduated from the prestigious Belmont University in Nashville, TN with a degree in Commercial Music Guitar Performance.  While living in Nashville he toured extensively throughout the US playing a variety of styles of music sharing the stage with some of the industries top stars. In addition to touring, he has produced or played on countless albums and composed numerous pieces for film/media. He eventually left Nashville to serve as a youth pastor, earning a Master's Degree in Youth Ministry Leadership from Huntington University.  

Tessa Denen, who grew up in Pendleton, also attended Belmont University studying Music Business. On the business side of the industry, she has worked events with some of today's top country artists, worked in artist development, and also as a booking agent.

The two married two years after meeting in Nashville and have been dreaming of opening a music school for as long as they can remember.  Their combined skill sets and passions led them to believe that this will be a great venture and one from which the community of Pendleton could benefit.


What We Need & What You Get

Let's be honest, no business, even nonprofit schools, can begin without funding. The funds raised will go toward the renovation of the space as well as the equipment needed to adequately teach one on one lessons, in band rehearsals, as well as recording and writing classes. Though $10,000 will not cover all fees that will be incurred, it will go a long way in helping our opening in the fall of 2016.

Every donation, no matter the size, will go a long way in helping Studio 3 to open its doors. We want to thank you for your support. Below are a few perks or "thank yous" for your generous donation: 

  • Up to $20 - choice of Studio 3 keychain or bumper sticker
  • $50 - both a bumper sticker and a keychain
  • $100 - one month free tuition for one student
  • $350 - one semester free tuition for one student
  • $1,000 - band of professionals musicians to play live at your event 
  • $10,000 - we will name the studio and/or other programs after you or the person of your choosing

The Impact

While growth in personal musical abilities is the aim of our education process, it is our goal to see our students grow in all facets of their lives.  Numerous academic studies have drawn correlations between music instruction and improved literacy, language skills, brain development, and reduced auditory degeneration later in life.  Additionally, the sense of community and corporate identity that collaborative group opportunities provide will help students improve their social skills. 

Risks & Challenges

NONE!!!! There are no risks in donating financially to Studio 3 Music Academy. This school will open and will be a great benefit to the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, but feel that Studio 3 is an organization you believe in, there are many items that can be donated. Contact them directly at info@Studio3MusicAcademy.com to get specifics.

There will also be a fair amount of work that needs to be done on the space. Not overly difficult, but general construction to build lesson rooms, as well as painting. If you would be willing to donate manhours, contact Studio 3 at the email address above.

Another huge help is to help spread the word. Share this campaign, tell your friends, shout it from the rooftops, anything to get others in the know.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

To make it real 21st Century school we need:
Educated teachers…
21st technology equipment…
Modern teaching aids…
Better equipped library…
Help us to improve quality of our school. We need your support for that.
Students and teachers…
Elementary school Grohote, Šolta…

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need funds for  education program in RWCT (Reading and Writing for Critical Thinking) for 7 teachers at http://www.fso.hr/forum-for-freedom-in-education/ 
  • ICTEdu Moduls 4, 5, 6 for all school employees
  • Travel expenses for participants and tutors
  • New computors for library, reading room and classrooms
  • Professional literature for teachers - library
  • New books for library
If we don't reach our entire goal we will use funds to improve some of our goals. If we collect more then panned we will include more teachers into this project. For your contribution you will get our unique perks.

The Impact

Teacher education is more important today than ever before. 21st Century and fast changes in technologies needs teachers that will be up to date. Old fashioned schools can't educate students of 21st Century.

Great teachers help to create great students. An inspiring and informed teacher is the most important school-related factor influencing student achievement.


Risks & Challenges

The main risk is that we will not be able to educate all teachers planned in this project if we do not get the planned fund. Then we will make it partly and equip part of classrooms and library.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
1 in 4 inner-city youth witness a murder by 17. Two-thirds experience at least one traumatic event. 1 in 3 develop post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). The emotional and cognitive impacts of trauma are keeping millions of youth from developing into the great leaders they can be. We’re launching MindRight, a nonprofit to unlock the talent of inner-city youth by helping them recover from trauma.

For many teens, their pain is the status quo. As one said, "you're expected to live this way." With our mobile messaging platform, we’re reaching kids where they are - their cell phones. Our technology helps youth take the crucial first steps in the healing process by sending daily messages that:

Empathize by helping youth build emotional awareness

Normalize the impacts of trauma through psychoeducation

Stabilize day to day stressors by teaching positive coping skills

We've been piloting for 6 weeks. One user said, the app "helps me get back up again." We have a waitlist of schools and nonprofits representing 3,000+ students. Your donations will go to product development and scaling pilots in LA, DC, New Jersey, and Philadelphia.

We all know that facing adversity early in life can transform us into extraordinary leaders. If we can help inner-city youth survive everything they endure, what can’t they do?

Join us in making this vision a reality for our kids.
story_txt: 1 in 4 inner-city youth witness a murder by 17. Two-thirds experience at least one traumatic event. 1 in 3 develop post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). The emotional and cognitive impacts of trauma are keeping millions of youth from developing into the great leaders they can be. We’re launching MindRight, a nonprofit to unlock the talent of inner-city youth by helping them recover from trauma.For many teens, their pain is the status quo. As one said, "you're expected to live this way." With our mobile messaging platform, we’re reaching kids where they are - their cell phones. Our technology helps youth take the crucial first steps in the healing process by sending daily messages that:Empathize by helping youth build emotional awarenessNormalize the impacts of trauma through psychoeducationStabilize day to day stressors by teaching positive coping skillsWe've been piloting for 6 weeks. One user said, the app "helps me get back up again." We have a waitlist of schools and nonprofits representing 3,000+ students. Your donations will go to product development and scaling pilots in LA, DC, New Jersey, and Philadelphia.We all know that facing adversity early in life can transform us into extraordinary leaders. If we can help inner-city youth survive everything they endure, what can’t they do?Join us in making this vision a reality for our kids.

story:
www.artemis4refugees.com

Make a statement about your commitment to helping refugees with a bold, powerful Artemis accessory- designed by a refugee and manufactured locally from recycled material.

One $30 Artemis pendant can help provide 1 month's worth of education to a refugee.

Four women in the second year of their MBA program sat together drinking coffee and tea trying to stay warm in the Rochester, NY winter.  We talked about watching ACLU lawyers helping refugees detained by President Trump’s Muslim ban.  We wanted to find a way to use our own unique skill sets to help refugees the best way we could.  

Sarah had started non-profits and benefit corporations before and knew the ropes. She also worked in fashion before B-School so the team wanted to make that a part of what they did.  

Kat was a teacher for ten years before she came to B-School and specializes in business strategy and operations, so her passion for education as liberation had to be part of it.  

Audra has experience working in risk management and exposure to finance. She resents the inequity that happens in our world, and works tirelessly to fight it. All four of them wanted to fight this fight.

Fahria was especially impacted because she grew up with Muslim immigrant parents, and works with a refugee orphanage in Bangladesh. As a metalwork artist, she understands the power of creating handmade work.

We've built a fashion accessory company, called Artemis, that sells handcrafted work made by refugees in places such as Nepal and Turkey. A portion of the proceeds from the sale of those items supports organizations who provide educational and work placement support to refugees around the world. We are working with organizations such as RefugeeOne, a resettlement agency in Chicago who helps provide language training, school supplies, work placement, among many other services.

We all know that education is the great equalizer.  And many refugees, especially women, were not in a position to get educations before and are definitely not in a position to gain education in the camps where the sole motivator is survival.  But if we can provide education, primary, secondary, language, and vocational, we can give refugees hope of providing for themselves and their family; hope that they can rise out of the ashes of their home country and flourish with new jobs, new homes and new lives.  

When you donate to Artemis, or purchase one of our accessories, you are supporting the mission of bringing refugees what they are so often denied, dignity.  

Why "Artemis"? 

Artemis was the ancient Greek goddess of lots of things, most notably the moon and hunting, but she also was the protector of maidens and children.  So many refugees are women and children, that we wanted to embody this spirit of protection of the most innocent who have been victims.  We also want to target the refugee education crisis with the accuracy of one of Artemis' silver arrows.

Your Impact

One $30 Artemis pendant can help provide 1 month's worth of education to a refugee.

For every pendant sold, we donate at minimum of 25% of that revenue to our educational and work placement partners. To see how far a donation can go, check out one of partner's donation impact page.

What We Need:

$5,000 will help us:

  • $4,000- launch our e-commerce site and develop our first set of inventory, the proceeds from which will be giving to our educational partners who are providing educational and work placement support for refugees.
  • $1,000- to cover a portion of our travel expenses to compete for $1M in funding in the Hult Prize competition in London.

If we don’t reach our $5,000 goal, we will fulfill our perk obligations as much as possible, and any remaining donations will be given to our educational partners.

What You Get: 

About our Jewelry

Our perks include a variety of pendant necklace options, ranging from stainless steel to customizable gold plated. Each pendant comes with a necklace cord and has handmade touches. Ultimately, we strive to have each piece designed or handcrafted by refugees from around the world, but today we're taking it one step at a time, so your piece may be handcrafted in our hometown in Upstate New York.

Risks & Challenges

We recognize that launching any initiative can be risky business. Artemis’ biggest risks lie in ensuring we can drive enough sales of accessories to cover our costs and support our educational partners. A crowdfunding campaign is one strategy we are taking to reduce this risk. The Artemis team is comprised for four experienced business professionals whose goal is to see Artemis succeed so that it can make as much impact as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t donate at this time? Help support Artemis 4 Refugees in other ways!

  • Share our campaign via social media to your family and friends.
  • Feature us your blog or website.
  • Follow us on social media for updates: https://www.instagram.com/artemis4refugees/
    • https://www.facebook.com/Artemis4Refugees/
