story:
Meet Pique: The Common App for Scholarships 

Discover and apply to unlimited scholarships with just one profile.

It's that simple. 

Say hello to the new way to apply to scholarships, Pique.

It's paperless. Beautifully designed. Takes the scholarship app process from 5hrs to 30mins. And most importantly, it's 100% free for students and educators.

We're on a mission to make scholarships and college more accessible to students and we need your help!

The Problem: 7/10 Can't Afford College

Families shouldn't have to break the bank or spend their life's savings to simply finance an undergraduate education but that's precisely what's happening.

Student debt in America has reached over $1 trillion. 7 out of 10 students graduated in 2016 with $37k+ in student debt. College tuition rates continue to increase each year. And headlines like these:

have become the norm. We have a problem. 

As tuition rates continue to climb, more students and families are turning to scholarships. So we decided to create an easier way for students to apply to scholarships. Pique streamlines the scholarship application process so that students spend less time working on applications and more time winning money for college. 

 

Scholarship Matching

For some students, finding the 'right' scholarship is the biggest obstacle in the scholarship application process. That's why Pique provides students with a curated list of scholarships broken into 4 categories: National Scholarships, Niche National Scholarships, Local Scholarships, and Based on Previous Applications.

With our Scholarship Matching feature, students can:

  • Save the scholarships that 'pique' their interest
  • Receive notifications when a deadline is approaching
  • Filter by Word Limit (Not every student has the time to write a 4 page essay, which is why Pique lets students filter by how many words a scholarship essay prompt requires)

The Pique Difference:  Because our team vets our scholarships, students never have to worry about 'sweepstake scholarships' or an outdated database. 

Pique Profile

The Pique Profile takes the hassle out of requesting, managing, and submitting all the required documents for a scholarship application. Students simply request and upload documents (official transcript, essays, recommendations, cover letters etc.) onto their Pique Profile and when their profile is complete, they can reuse it to apply to any scholarship hosted on Pique. 

Why Students Need Pique: 

Between studying and taking the SATs/ACTs, researching, visiting and applying to colleges, keeping up their grades, doing community service, participating in extracurricular activities, completing their FAFSA, and studying for AP/IB exams, students are pretty strapped for time. 

The last thing students have time to do during a busy senior year is navigate a scholarship application process that looks like this: 

  1. Find Scholarship
  2. Write an Award Winning Essay
  3. Get Two Recommendations (from teachers, mentors, coaches, counselors, etc.)
  4. Request an Official Transcript from a Counselor
  5. Purchase and Send SAT and/or ACT scores
  6. (If it's a paper-based scholarship) Buy stamps, envelopes, and get the application postmarked by a specific date
  7. Repeat

Students need Pique because students need more than a scholarship database, which is currently the only tech solution websites offer to students. Applying to scholarships, as shown above, is a 7 step process. The problem with a scholarship database is that it only addresses the first step, 'Find Scholarships.' Once students find scholarships, however, they run into several problems when going through steps 2 - 7 and that's where Pique comes in.

Our goal is to not just help students save time finding scholarships, but to also help them save time applying to scholarships. 

Yep, this could be us but, you know, we haven't hit our campaign goal just yet. 

Meet the Team: 

We're Brian and Kevin, two District of Columbia Public School Alums, 1st Generation College grads, techies, and activists. We've been buddies for over a decade and experienced the difficulties of navigating the scholarship application process first hand:

  • Brian won over $15,000 in local DC scholarships to Haverford College
  • Kevin won the Posse Foundation Scholarship, a 4 year, full-tuition leadership scholarship, to Lafayette College 

                               (Brian)                                                                 (Kevin) 

    A lot has changed for us since our days on the playground, including the quality of our vision and our interest in the tech space. 

    Since college, we have both worked in tech and have seen and contributed to products moving from ideas to realized products - Brian as a Web Developer and Kevin as a Business Developer. 

    We've always thought that applying to scholarships shouldn't be a convoluted and time-consuming process and wanted to create a free solution we wished existed when we were in high school. 

    Honestly, why didn't Pique exist a decade ago?  

     

    Where We Are Today 

    Our team has finished the hardest parts of developing Pique. To date we have completed Pique's user research and pilot, developed our site architecture and wireframes, completed all of the platform's frontend development and partnered with nonprofits in the college access space.

    We're on track to bring students to Pique this Fall, but need your support and help in spreading some Pique Love.

     

    Join The Movement. Make A Difference.

    Our team has made great strides in building Pique and in order to bring Pique to life and into the hands of high school students across the country, we need your help!

    Your support through our Indiegogo campaign will allow our team to finish product development and onboard students, educators, and scholarship providers onto Pique. 

    Pique is increasing students' access to scholarships and in turn college. If you believe in our mission and want to help our team create an easier way for students to find and apply to scholarships, join the movement and let's make a difference in access to higher education!

     

    You Had Me at 'Making College More Accessible' but..

    Why Else Should I Support Pique?


     

    A Big Thanks! 

    We can't express how humble and grateful we are to have your support with our Indiegogo Campaign. When we began our user research last summer and talked to parents, students, nonprofits, counselors, teachers, and scholarship providers from across the country, we knew we needed to build Pique. We didn't know how we would build Pique or where we would get the resources, but after the 6th "I wish I had this when I was in High School" or "my students could really use this right now," we knew we would find our way.

    Access to higher education in America has to change and our team is determined to build the tech solutions that can bring about that change on a large scale. 

    Thank you again for your support and even if you cannot contribute with a monetary donation, sharing our story on your Facebook with friends, family, students, educators, and scholarship providers, goes a long way. 

    The Pique Team

    Equity. Access. Tech. Innovation. Love. 

    ========

    You Got Questions. We Got the Answers (Sway). 

    How much will Pique Cost Students and Educators?

    Pique is 100% free for students, educators, and schools. We monetize by charging scholarship providers a small fee so that we can ensure that students from all economic backgrounds have access to our platform.

    How Does Pique Help Recommenders?

    Between teaching a full day, reviewing last night's homework, creating tomorrow's lesson plan, running an extracurricular activity and writing college recommendations, most teachers do not have the time to also write a nicely tailored recommendation for each scholarship a student applies to. That's why we designed Pique to allow teachers to write a standard recommendation to be saved onto a student's Pique Profile and reused. Our thoughts are simple: help educators save time in the scholarship application process and they will in turn have more time to prepare tomorrow’s lesson plan, review last night’s homework assignments, and strategize ways to enhance the classroom environment.

    Pique also helps recommenders manage their recommendation requests. Pique provides recommenders with a 'Recommendation Dashboard' so they can easily track which recommendations have been completed and need to be completed. 

     

    Will Pique Ever Be Available to Undergrads and Grad Students?

    Yes! We know that it's not just incoming freshmen that need help in finding and applying to the free money out there for an education, this is why we intend to make Pique available to undergrads and grad students looking for scholarships, fellowships, and grants. 

    Our timeline for expanding Pique to undergrads and grad students will depend on the success of our Indiegogo campaign and securing the additional funding needed to onboard providers that offer awards to undergrads and grad students. So support the campaign and we will add you to our 'undergrad/grad students' list so you can be one of the firsts to know when we expand Pique. 

    How Does Pique Handle FERPA Compliance as It Relates to Recommendations?

    Under FERPA, parents or eligible students (students over the age of 18 or students enrolled at a college or university that saves recommendations) have the right to review confidential letters of recommendations. Like other platforms in the space, Pique offers students the chance to waive their right to review recommendations submitted on their behalves.

    I'm a Recommender: Can I Still Write a Personalized Recommendation for My Students?

    Absolutely! Scholarship Providers using Pique accept ‘generic recommendations’ because they understand that not all educators and mentors have the same amount of free time to write recommendations. (A counselor at a high school where the counselor to student ration is 1:80 presumably does not have as much time to spend on recommendations as a counselor at a high school with a ratio of 1:40). That being said, if time is on your side and you prefer to write a personalized recommendation, feel free to do so!

    Is Pique Secure?

    Yes. We understand that students will upload very sensitive information onto our platform. As such, we have taken extreme measures to make sure our platform is secure. Pique saves and stores students’ information onto Amazon Web Services (AWS), one of the tech industry’s most secure cloud platforms. We use AWS to encrypt and back up students’ data on a daily basis and frequently run security tests through AWS.

    Does Pique Sell Student Data? 

    Nope.

    What About the Perks? When will they be available? 

    Great question! Our Pique Shirts and Stickers will be available to backers in June 2017 and our Ebook will be available in August 2017 (right in time for the new school year)!

     

    What's Your Team's Favorite 'Get Out' Meme? 

    This.

story:
The challenge

We all have mountains to climb in life. Whether it’s a mountain of rock or one of troubles and disbelief, the challenges are there every day for us to fight and overcome. 

And while some of us may get help along the way, for underprivileged children this climb starts early and with stones tied to their feet.

This year, I have decided to combine my passion for supporting education with my passion for nature (and trekking) and started this fundraising campaign that I hope you will support. 

Between the 1st and 7th of October, I will attempt to climb Kilimanjaro (5895m), while raising funds for Teach for Romania. I am doing this to help underprivileged children get access to education,  increasing their chances of escaping poverty. Climbing the highest freestanding mountain in the world symbolises the struggles those children have when trying to succeed in life. 

My target is to raise £1 for every meter of the total ascent, £5895 in total. 

I will fund the entire climbing part/logistics of the expedition myself, therefore all the money raised in this campaign will go directly to Teach for Romania to support teaching of underprivileged children in rural communities.

     

    The Reason

     

    What is Teach for Romania, their mission and their values?

    Teach for Romania is a Non-Governmental Organization with a mission to recruit and select the most valuable young Romanians, train them as inspirational teachers and support them to become leaders in Romanian education.

    Teach for Romania's vision is to create life options through quality education for every child in Romania.

    The Teach for Romania model was initially developed in 1990 by Teach for America in the United States. It aims to attract top graduates who would not have normally considered the teaching profession among their future professional options. The model works successfully in 45 countries across 6 continents, where it is implemented by the partner organizations of the Teach for All network.

    Teach for Romania core values are Integrity, Excellence, Authenticity, Perseverence, Determination, Life Balance, Collaboration and Continuous Learning.

     

    What are the main issues we are trying to solve?

    Student motivation: According to the most recent international education study performed by PISA (OECD), Romanian students are the least motivated to study of all students from a group of 65 countries analysed. Other recent international studies demonstrate that Romania’s education system ranks towards the bottom of both European and global rankings.

    School drop-out rates: Romania has a 17.4% average drop-out rate, compared to 12.8% which is the European Union average. This is more pronounced in the rural than the urban communities, however the figures are slowly increasing in both sub-categories.

    High school graduation rates: Among students who remain in school through the 12th grade, only 56% passed the national high school graduation exam ("Bacalaureat") in 2013, latest data available. The figures above, as well as others published in recent years, demonstrate that Romania suffers from an overall lack of quality education as well as an inequality of access.

     

    What are the funds for / who is your money going?

    All the funds raised in this campaign will go towards sponsoring one teacher - which means supporting the education of over 150 children - for the academic year.

    Teach for Romania currently has 87 teachers active in 72 schools and high schools in 12 counties, supporting 6,500 children in the education process.

    The goal for next year is to get an additional 30 teachers on board who would support 4,500 children.

    Teach for Romania has had a tremendous success over the past few years since its inception in Romania in 2014 and continues to grow - since last year, the number of teachers in the program and the number of schools has grown. We now have 87 primary and secondary school teachers in 72 schools and high schools in 12 counties. (3rd & 4th generation of teachers and Alumni that chose to continue teaching) This year’s aim is to focus on the organization’s sustainability, curriculum development and increase the overall quality of the programme.

    More about Teach for Romania at: http://en.teachforromania.org/

     

    Why am I doing this?

    As most of you know by now, education has always been an important part of my life and I would like to continue to give back in the best way I can, by promoting good education and making it available to those communities that need it the most.

    After I coordinated a series of projects targeting disadvantaged communities in native Romania, I came to the conclusion that the only way to make a lasting chance and give those children a chance to succeed in life is by giving them access to quality education.

    The education and qualification that a child receives, as well as the environment that he develops in, are crucial for the opportunities that he would have later on.

    The teachers at Teach for Romania promote an education based on strong solid values, broadening their pupils life choices and horizon.

     

     

    The Trip

     

    Mount Kilimanjaro

    In the wild northern reaches of Tanzania, a snow-capped giant rises majestically above the African plains and savannah, as iconic as it is unfathomable, the roof of Africa, Mount Kilimanjaro.

    At 5895 meters tall, this dormant volcano is the highest mountain in Africa and the highest freestanding mountain in the world. For more than a hundred and twenty years, this astonishing natural wonder has drawn climbers from all over the world and is listed as one of the world’s great 7 summits. Kilimanjaro is famous for its incredible biodiversity, which covers almost all the ecological systems known to man. from lush rain forests, to alpine desserts and the famous artic summit.

     

    What are the risks involved?

    There are a number of uncontrollable risks (e.g. weather) that could hinder our ascent. Under no circumstance will we push forward if weather conditions deteriorate and do not allow for safe passage. We will stop whenever we feel we cannot go forward unless risking unnecessarily.  

    Apart from sheer fatigue at high altitude there are real risks that will not be taken lightly. This would include acute mountain sickness, hypothermia, rock falls and avalanches, cliff falls, colds and respiratory infections, twisted ankles and sore joints, tropical diseases. On the summit there is 30% less oxygen than at sea level so the ascent will get exponentially more difficult as we climb up the mountain.

     

    Who is going to help me?

    The expedition will be guided by TrekkingHero, a trekking company with a lot of experience in climbing Kilimanjaro. Their guides, porters, chefs and drivers will help me reach the top and get back home safely.

    http://www.trekkinghero.com

     
     

    How can you help?

    1. Please donate. Contributions are highly encouraged and needed for us to reach the campaign goal. I will be doing the climbing, but in essence this is a team effort, so please donate whatever you can.
    2. Please share the fundraising link / this campaign / this webpage via social network (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn etc) and distribute directly to those interested in this cause (family, friends, your colleagues, people who care and can help).
    3. Please stay involved beyond this fundraising campaign so that we continue to build a better education system and create life options through quality education for every child in Romania.
     

    Thank you all for your love, support and contributions. See you at the top!
story_txt:
The challenge

We all have mountains to climb in life. Whether it’s a mountain of rock or one of troubles and disbelief, the challenges are there every day for us to fight and overcome. 
And while some of us may get help along the way, for underprivileged children this climb starts early and with stones tied to their feet.
This year, I have decided to combine my passion for supporting education with my passion for nature (and trekking) and started this fundraising campaign that I hope you will support. 
Between the 1st and 7th of October, I will attempt to climb Kilimanjaro (5895m), while raising funds for Teach for Romania. I am doing this to help underprivileged children get access to education,  increasing their chances of escaping poverty. Climbing the highest freestanding mountain in the world symbolises the struggles those children have when trying to succeed in life. 
My target is to raise £1 for every meter of the total ascent, £5895 in total. 
I will fund the entire climbing part/logistics of the expedition myself, therefore all the money raised in this campaign will go directly to Teach for Romania to support teaching of underprivileged children in rural communities.

More about Teach for Romania at: http://en.teachforromania.org/

http://www.trekkinghero.com

 
 

How can you help?


Please donate. Contributions are highly encouraged and needed for us to reach the campaign goal. I will be doing the climbing, but in essence this is a team effort, so please donate whatever you can.

Please share the fundraising link / this campaign / this webpage via social network (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn etc) and distribute directly to those interested in this cause (family, friends, your colleagues, people who care and can help).

Please stay involved beyond this fundraising campaign so that we continue to build a better education system and create life options through quality education for every child in Romania.

story:
Who are we?

Good Kenyan is a Social Enterprise that aims to empower, transform and engage high school leavers in a four month program. The program has a set curriculum in basic IT, Personal Finance, Entrepreneurship and Life Skills. To empower them economically, we teach them how to make cards, bags and gift boxes from recycled materials and earn once the items are sold. We will also offer one on one mentor-ship and motivation talks.

What are we trying to achieve?

 To contribute to the eradication of poverty, as well as to a positive and healthy society by transforming and empowering it’s youth through our program. We seek to fill the gap that exists between completion of high school and the commencement of tertiary education. Currently in Kenya, there is no formal system to engage youth during this formative stage that affects the rest of their adult lives and should be well guided.

Why are we doing it?

Good Kenyan was founded out of Lucy Chepchumba’s own life experience. Having lost her mother before completing high school, she stayed with relatives and was idle for a big part of the year. She also did not have help in choosing her career or clear guidance in life issues such as personal finance or workplace preparedness. Lucy promised herself that she would offer someone else this guidance once she established herself. Her co-founder, Humphrey Kayange, is a long-time friend and Olympian rugby player for the Kenya team who wants to give back to his country. Out of a shared vision to give a helping hand to the next generation of Kenyans, our social enterprise was born.

Kenyan youth are often idle on completion of high school making them easy targets for crime, abuse of alcohol and drugs or unhealthy sexual behaviours. Our project aims to engage them positively during this transition period. Youth unemployment levels remain high so we are offering a solution to this. The need for the use of recycled material has become an environmental issue and Kenya has issued a ban on plastic packaging so our recycled products are sustainable and attractive to the market.

Mentorship and coaching is our greatest pillar as we pair the youth with career and life mentors through our networks to ensure they learn from experience.

How will we use your contribution?

It will help us purchase second-hand computers, industrial blenders, a screen printer, and purchase raw materials. Your contribution will enable us to pay trainers, facilitate mentoring, provide for the overall running of the project and feed the cohorts for four months in session. We anticipate needing $8500 to have a successful second program for 10 cohorts. If we don't meet our funding goal, we will soldier on with the limited resources we have as we continue fundraising and selling products.

What other ways can you help?

Donate a computer, industrial blender, screen printer, white board or your training expertise.

Pre-order our Handcrafted Christmas Cards from recycled materials.

Visit our website www.goodkenyan.co.ke, Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter and kindly share our campaign with your Friends and Family on social media and direct email.

 

“Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it’s the only thing that ever has.” – Margaret Mead

 

Here’s a look at how we have done so far. If you like what you read, please consider a donation to help us run our 2nd program!

Cohort 1- Program Pilot

Our program runs for 4 months and each group is referred to as cohort. We launched on 30th April 2017 starting with 10 young people who successfully completed on 15th September 2017. The cohort commenced with ten youth recruited from Dreams children’s home, neighboring communities of Kerarapon, Vet Slums and Ngong town. We used churches and the local administration to spread the word. Twenty five youth turned up for an interview, out of which we selected ten based on their needs and demonstration of willingness to learn.

During the business and entrepreneurship classes, the youth learnt how to make packaging from recycled materials, life skills and attended IT classes. We have also partnered each youth with a career and life mentor from our networks and friends of Good Kenyan.

Beyond attending the program, each youth was encouraged to select a community project to undertake by end of the program. These projects are facilitated by Good Kenyan and once a month they mentor high school students from the local schools.

Our current challenges include: only four computers in a class of 10 that the youth share during the IT classes and an open air workshop which makes it difficult to conduct classes in cold and rainy weather. We also do not have many of the materials and equipment we require to support highly interactive learning sessions such as interactive screens and projectors. Additionally, most of our training is offered on a pro-bono basis and sometimes the trainers do not honor the schedule due to competing priorities. Finally, we require a greater supply of raw materials and other equipment such as screen printers to increase production of the packaging materials.
